Title: Salesforce Merge Fields
Text: Salesforce Merge Fields | GetFeedback Help Log in GetFeedback In this article Before You Start Adding Merge Fields to Survey Links Sending Surveys Using Salesforce Mapping Merge Fields to Salesforce Using Encrypted Merge Fields Help Salesforce Salesforce Merge Fields GetFeedback Salesforce Merge Fields Before You Start Adding Merge Fields to Survey Links Sending Surveys Using Salesforce Mapping Merge Fields to Salesforce Using Encrypted Merge Fields Essentials feature : Available on Essentials, Pro, and Ultimate plans. By default, GetFeedback doesn't track your survey recipient addresses, or identify who is clicking on a GetFeedback survey link. If you want to track respondent details and match survey responses with known contacts, leads, or opportunities, add merge fields to your survey link. Merge fields can pull in data from Salesforce to create a unique URL for each respondent. When someone uses the link to complete the survey, we’ll track their responses using the merge fields in your survey link. If you’re sending a survey from Salesforce, you can either add merge fields to the survey link or to your GetFeedback email template. If you’re creating a custom template to send from Salesforce, you’ll need to add merge fields to your survey link manually. We'll add the merge fields to your survey for you when you set up a Visualforce or HTML email or use our automated email builder . Before You Start Make sure to set up Salesforce Custom Mappings or Managed Mappings before you send your survey. Adding Merge Fields to Survey Links If you build your email outside of GetFeedback, you'll need to manually add merge fields to your survey link (for example, when you create a custom email template in Salesforce). When adding merge fields to your survey link, follow the proper syntax outlined by GetFeedback and utilize proper Salesforce merge fields. The image below shows how to format a link. This example includes Salesforce merge field syntax in the merge field value section of the link. The merge field pulls in the respondent’s data when they go to your survey link. Examples Here's an example of a generic survey link that pulls in the respondent’s Contact ID and first name. Salesforce pulls in a recipient’s contact ID and first name when you send the email. When the respondent uses the unique link to complete the survey, GetFeedback pulls the merge field data from the link to associate it with the response. www.getfeedback.com/r/xxxxxxxx?ContactID={!Contact.Id}&FirstName={!FirstName} Here's an example of how the template link above may look after it is sent to a Salesforce Contact. When the respondent clicks the link, GetFeedback pulls the merge field values from the link and places the values in the results table on your survey results page. www.getfeedback.com/r/xxxxxxxx?ContactID=0030X000001XXXX&FirstName=Tym Sending Surveys Using Salesforce There are many ways to send surveys using Salesforce. You can add merge fields using our tools, and we’ll format the link for you. You can use the following methods to send surveys with Salesforce: Create a Visualforce template to send from Salesforce. Use our Salesforce email automation to build an email template, outbound message, and workflow in Salesforce. Send from GetFeedback using a Salesforce Report . Show a survey after a Salesforce Chat . Mapping Merge Fields to Salesforce Once you've added merge fields, you can map this information into Salesforce along with the associated answer information. To map a merge field to Salesforce: Take and fully submit your survey , using the merge fields you want to map to Salesforce. Since merge fields can have any name, this step allows GetFeedback to know which merge fields you'll be mapping and gives you a chance to test out your distribution URL. Once you've done this, you should see those merge fields in your survey response table. The example image below uses the Name and Email Address merge fields at the end of the survey link: After submitting your survey, go to the survey builder in GetFeedback. Select Mappings > Salesforce Custom Mappings to set up your mappings . When you select the item you want to map, choose to Map a merge field , then select the fields you want to map. After setting up your mappings, test your survey to make sure your mappings and merge fields work correctly. Using Encrypted Merge Fields By default, respondents can view the merge field data in the survey link. For example, if you use the Contact ID merge field, your respondents can see their Contact ID in the link when they take your survey. Respondents may also be able to manipulate or remove merge fields from your survey link. You can encrypt merge fields to hide personal data from your survey respondents and prevent them from changing the link. Learn more about encrypting merge fields Related Articles Sharing and Transferring Surveys Error: “No such column” in Salesforce Getting Started with GetFeedback for Salesforce Company SurveyMonkey About Us Jobs Blog Help SurveyMonkey Help GetFeedback Help Market Research Help SurveyMonkey Audience Help SurveyMonkey Contribute Help Wufoo Help Apply Help Support Site Status Unsubscribe Contact Us Email Opt-In Policies Legal Center Privacy Policy Cookies Notice California Privacy Notice Copyright © 1999-2025 SurveyMonkey BBB credentials logo TrustedSite logo

Title: Introduction to SurveyMonkey Apply: Reviews & Assignments
Text: Introduction to SurveyMonkey Apply: Reviews & Assignments | Apply Help Log in Apply Help Getting Started Introduction to SurveyMonkey Apply: Reviews & Assignments Apply Introduction to SurveyMonkey Apply: Reviews & Assignments The reviewing of the applications your site has collected will heavily contribute to the award/decline decision. Before launching your program, your review process should be finalized in order for the applications you collect to be reviewed fairly using the same review standard. This article is dedicated to helping you create a reliable review process as well as how to complete and manage these reviews within your SM Apply site. Review Tasks: Overview Setting up the Evaluation for a Review Stage To access the Evaluation section of your stage: Go to your Workflow Hover your cursor over the stage you wish to edit Click on the More Options icon beside the stage name Select Edit Click on the Evaluation tab Simple Review There are three review types available within a Simple Review stage: Settings Scale Custom Labels Yes/No The score is either 0% or 100%. ✔ Rating Choose to have your rating out of 3, 4, or 5. Scale Create a custom scale: minimum of 2, max of 10. ✔ Advanced Review Forms An Advanced Review consists of a form to be completed by the reviewer. To build a new form select Create a new form. If you would like to use an existing form, select Use existing form. When an advanced review stage has been added the form used is considered a review form . This configuration allows you to associate scores with review questions asked within the form that can then be used to calculate a total score. Within your form, click on the Questions tab in the top left corner Under Advanced Questions, double-click or click and drag the question to add it to your form From the Options tab, enter the Question Title Add an Extra Description (Optional) Add your Choices. You can add the Choices individually by clicking Add or by clicking the Bulk button. You can add the variables in a list within the Bulk Editor Set the Score for each Choice by changing the score field from None to a numeric value Manage Reviews To access Manage Reviews: Go to your Site Dashboard Click on the Reviews statistic within a program tile NOTE: Manage Reviews can also be accessed by selecting the Reviews tab while in Monitor Mode. Reviewers & Teams Tab This section will appear at the left of your page. Select Reviewers to see a list of reviewers assigned to this program. You will be able to see the name of the reviewer as well as the number of assignments they currently have. Select Teams to see a list of the Teams you have added to the site. If you select the Teams tab, you will be able to see the name of the team, how many reviewers are in that team, and the number of assignments the team currently has. You can also select the drop-down icon to view a list of the reviewers in that group. How to Add a Reviewer to a Team To add an individual to a review team: Click on the Manage Users icon in the top right corner of your screen. Locate the user you wish to add to a reviewer team. Hover your cursor over the user and click on the More Options icon in the far right column Click Add to Team Select the team(s) you wish to add the user to Click Add In order to add multiple reviewers to a team at once: Click on the Manage Users icon in the top right corner of your screen Select the users you wish to add to a reviewer team Click Actions Click Add to Team Select the team(s) you wish to add the user to Click Done How to Remove Reviewers from a Team Click on the Manage Users icon in the top right corner of your screen Click on Teams Select the Team that the reviewer is currently a member of Click Done Locate the user you wish to remove from a reviewer team Hover your cursor over the user and click on the More Options icon in the far right column Click Remove from Team Optional: Select Unassign them from all applications assigned to this team. NOTE: When an application is assigned to the team it is also assigned to the individual user. If this is selected, then any submissions assigned from the team will be removed from the reviewer when they are removed from the team. Optional: Select Delete all their completed reviews with this team. WARNING! This will permanently delete any completed reviews that the reviewer has completed for applications assigned to the team. If this is not selected, but the reviewer is unassigned from the submission, the completed review will remain pended to the application but not available to the reviewer. Click Remove Distributing Assignments to Reviewers Stage Assignments To access the Assignments section of your stage: Go to your Workflow Hover your cursor over the stage you wish to edit Click on the More Options icon beside the stage name Click on Assignments Manual Assignments To assign applications manually: While in Monitor Mode, select the Reviews tab at the top of the page Select Assign Select the Review stage where assignments are being distributed Select Reviewers and Teams OR Applications . This selection will determine what is shown on the next page. If Reviewers is selected a list of Reviewers and Teams is displayed. If Applications is selected, a list of applications within that review stage will be displayed. Select Next If assigning by reviewer or team : Select the reviewer or team from the available tabs Select Next Apply necessary filters Mark applications to assign Select Assign If assigning by applications : Mark the applications to assign Select Next Select the Reviewer or Team the applications are being assigned to Select Assign NOTE: To remove assignments made in error follow the same steps above. The difference being that you will need to remove the application selection to remove an assignment then select Save. Assignments Using Automations In some cases, assigning through an automation may best fit your process. When configuring your automation, the assignment is made through the configuration of your DO statement. An automation can assign to a specific reviewer, a review team, or assign based on an existing relationship. Manage Reviews: Assignment Details Manage Reviews is a source that can be used to track assignment details such as the completion status of a reviewer. While within Manage Reviews, the details displayed will depend on whether or not you are viewing the Reviewer assignments details or the Team assignment details. To view assignment details: Click on the Review tab Click on a Reviewer to view their assignments -- OR -- Click on the Teams Tab Click on the the drop-down arrow beside a team to reveal reviewers in the team Click on a Reviewer to view their assignments Reviewer Assignment Column Description [Select Assignment] Use the checkbox to select an assignment and perform an action on it. Application This column will display brief details about the application: Application Title Name and Email Address of the Owner of the Submission User's Profile Image (if applicable) Status The current status of the completion of the review by the reviewer. There are three statuses: - Not Started - In Progress - Completed Team This column will display all of the teams that the reviewer is a member of. NOTE: This column is only available if you select a Reviewer through the Review tab. Last Edited Will display a timestamp of when the application was edited (saved or submitted). Completed On For assignments that are In Progress or Completed, this column displays the last date that the review was updated. Review This column will display the percentage of completion of the review. In order to view the Team Assignments Details Click on the Teams Tab Click on the Team you wish to see the assignments for. Team Assignment Column Description [Select Assignment] Use the checkbox to select an assignment in order to perform an action on it. Application This column will display brief details about the application: Application Title Name and Email Address of the Owner of the Submission User's Profile Image (if applicable) Not Started The total number of reviewers in this team that have not started a review for this application. In Progress The total number of reviewers in this team that have started a review for the application but have not completed it. Completed The total number of reviewers in this team that have fully completed their reviews for this application. Export Assignments From the Manage Reviews page, administrators can view assignments for reviewers by selecting a reviewer from the Reviewer list. The same can be done for teams by selecting the Teams tab and selecting one of your review teams from the list. Once the assignments are shown, assignments can be selected and exported to allow administrators to monitor the review process. Features and uses for exporting assignments are: View which assignments are complete/incomplete for the reviewer/team Information is displayed in a useful PDF document The completed reviews are included in this export The export can be customized to selected assignments or all assignments for that reviewer/team In order to Export your assignments from the site. Select the applications you wish to Export. Click Actions Click Export Completing a Review Assignment Reviewer Split Screen The reviewer split screen is exclusive to reviewers completing a review of an application. The left hand side of the window presents all application materials to be considered for the review. The right hand side of the window presents the review form to be completed by the reviewer: In order to access applications in the Split Screen view: When in the Reviewer Portal, click the View icon of the Scholarship you are completing the reviews for Click Start or Continue beside the application you wish to review to enter the reviewer split screen Reviewer Application Notes Reviewers can add notes to applications and read notes left by fellow reviewers and site administrators within the Notes tab within the reviewer split screen . To access Notes as a Reviewer: Click to Begin , Continue , or View the application in the Reviewer Split Screen From the application side of the split view, select the Notes tab NOTE: Reviewers cannot create private notes. All application notes will be visible to administrators and fellow assigned reviewers. Add a Note To add a new note: Go to the Notes tab within the Reviewer Split Screen Enter the note you wish to add in the Add a Note field Optional: Click Email Notifications and select Email Administrators and/or Email assigned reviewers . Depending on the options(s) selected, an email will be sent to the administrators and/or the other reviewers assigned to the application to let them know a new note has been added. Click Add Note Edit a Note Within the Reviewer Split Screen, you have the ability to edit the notes that you have written for an application. To edit a note: Go to the Notes tab in the Reviewer Split Screen . Underneath the Note you wish to Edit (beside the time stamp) click to Edit the note Make the necessary changes to the note Click Save Changes Delete a Note If a note is no longer applicable, the note can be deleted from the application. To delete a note: Go to the Notes tab in the Reviewer Split Screen. Underneath the Note you wish to Edit (beside the time stamp) click to Delete the note You will be asked "Are you sure that you want to delete this note?" Click Yes WARNING! Once a note has been deleted it cannot be retrieved. Clear Completed Reviews Administrators have the ability to clear reviews that have been completed by reviewers within the site. To clear a review completed for an application: Go to Manage Reviews Select one of the tabs to locate the assignment (Reviewers or Teams) Mark the application(s) from the list that you wish to clear the review from Click Actions Click Clear Review WARNING! Once a completed review has been deleted, it cannot be retrieved. Next Steps Now that your review process is finalized go back to the Build Mode article to finalize your program and launch! Once launched, our Introduction to SurveyMonkey Apply: Monitor Mode will help you monitor your program effectively. Title: Changing Field Label Placement
Text: Changing Field Label Placement | Wufoo Help Log in Wufoo Help Themes and Styles Layouts Changing Field Label Placement Wufoo Changing Field Label Placement The Label Placement setting lets you adjust the position of Field Labels in relation to the field itself. By default, field labels appear on top of the field, but you can change the placement so that field labels are displayed to the left of the field instead. You can only change the field label placement at the form level—you can't apply different label placement settings to individual fields on your form. To change the label placement: Log in and go to Forms . Click the form you want to edit. Click the Form Settings tab. From the Label Placement dropdown, choose from the following options. Title: Payment Options
Text: Payment Options | GetFeedback Help Log in GetFeedback In this article Sales Tax Find your GetFeedback Invoice (Legacy or Standalone Plans) Help Account Management Your account Payment Options GetFeedback Payment Options Sales Tax Find your GetFeedback Invoice (Legacy or Standalone Plans) GetFeedback accepts different methods of payment depending on the plan you've signed up for. Legacy (standalone) GetFeedback plans pay by credit card on their Settings > Payment & Pricing page. Other plan types, such as the GetFeedback CX or GetFeedback for Salesforce plans receive a monthly or annual invoice. If you do business in a state that has sales tax, and GetFeedback maintains a physical presence in that state, your GetFeedback subscription may be subject to sales tax, this information will be on your plan invoice. If you're subscribed to a GetFeedback CX plan, and you've lost track of your invoice, please reach out to your Customer Success Manager, Account Executive, or the GetFeedback support Sales Tax If you do business in a state with sales tax, and GetFeedback maintains a physical presence in that state, your GetFeedback subscription may be subject to sales tax. You can find the dollar value of the sales tax collected at the bottom of your plan invoice. Why am I only being charged sales tax now? A recent supreme court case has changed the US sales tax landscape for many out-of-state sellers. The case expanded the sales tax nexus to include economic/digital nexus for sellers that do not have a physical presence in the taxing state. (case citation: 585 U.S 17-494) This change has prompted many technology companies providing Software as a Service (SaaS) to review the states in which they have a sales tax nexus. GetFeedback has a legal obligation to collect and remit sales tax from customers who consume our services in states that are subject to sales tax. From June 1, 2019, in states where we include sales tax on your invoice, you will no longer be required to remit use tax to the state in respect of our services. This removes any use tax liability and compliance burden from you. If I'm currently not required to pay sales tax, could that change in the future? Yes. If GetFeedback has a physical presence in a state, sales tax nexus may apply. Sales tax would then be applied to invoices from the date a physical presence commenced. As the digital economy continues to grow, we expect the number of states that charge sales tax on SaaS transactions will increase. We will always let you know of any changes to how we charge you. What happens if I don't provide my zip code? Zip code disclosure is a requirement for all active accounts. If you pay for your GetFeedback plan by credit card, you can update your billing information by navigating to Account Settings > Plan & Payment. When did you start charging sales tax? We began charging sales tax in applicable states on June 1, 2019. Find your GetFeedback Invoice (Legacy or Standalone Plans) For all other plans, your invoice will be sent to the billing contact email address we have on file. If you need a new copy of your invoice, contact us . Title: Usage and Attitudes
Text: Usage and Attitudes | SurveyMonkey Help Log in SurveyMonkey In this article Setting Up Your Project Advanced Analysis Features Filters & Crosstabs Help Solutions Market Research Usage and Attitudes SurveyMonkey Usage and Attitudes Setting Up Your Project Advanced Analysis Features Filters & Crosstabs ADD-ON FEATURE : You can use this solution with any SurveyMonkey plan type. Get started now , or explore our market research solutions . Our Usage & Attitudes solution helps you learn about your customers’ preferences, habits, and purchase behaviors that drive attributes like frequency of use and likelihood to purchase. Setting Up Your Project Getting Started Check out our Market Research Solutions page to learn more about Usage & Attitudes projects. Click Get Started when you're ready to start building your project. Enter your project details These include your company name or logo and are automatically added to the first page of your survey. Choose your target audience Select your target audience by choosing Country , Gender , Age , and Income criteria. Click More Targeting Options to browse and choose from hundreds of other targeting options. (Optional) Add a screening question to narrow down your target audience, and disqualify people who aren't the best fit for your survey. This is useful if you didn't find all the targeting options you wanted. To get an accurate cost estimate, choose how many questions will be in your survey. You'll be able to review the final cost based on the length of your survey before purchasing at checkout. Review the cost and estimated completion date. If everything looks good click Next: Design Survey . Decide what analysis features you want to use Some features are only available with certain question types and settings. Check out the Advanced Analysis Features section for more details. Design your survey Add custom questions to your survey or use the question bank specifically designed for Usage & Attitudes projects. You can edit questions from the question bank to fit your research goals. (Optional) Apply any logic features . All logic types are supported, except quotas and custom variables. Customize your survey style . TIP! The question bank has over 150 questions made specifically for this solution to help you get answers you need. Click Question Bank when designing your survey to review and add questions. Preview your survey Once your project is set up, click Preview to make sure it looks good. Toggle between Desktop , Tablet , and Mobile views to see how your survey will look on various devices. Checkout & payment You don't need a specific plan type to run your project. Before you checkout, we'll ask you to review your order details. You'll see a breakdown of the total cost, and can go back to make any last-minute adjustments to your targeting criteria. Projects can be purchased with a debit or credit card, or with Audience Credits . Analyze & export results The Analyze tab will show you summaries of all your questions, let you use the advanced analysis features, and export your data. Available export formats: PowerPoint (PPT) SPSS .XLSX .CSV With PPT exports, you'll be able to customize and edit the slides in PowerPoint after exporting. Advanced Analysis Features We have specialized analysis features to help you understand your customer's habits better. If you want to use these features, there are certain things to keep in mind when designing your survey. Key Driver Analysis Key Drivers allow you to choose an outcome metric and then see which attitudes and behaviors of your customers have the highest correlation with that outcome. For example, you could choose the outcome metric of purchase intent then see data points about what drives people to purchase. Setting Up Your Survey to Use Key Drivers The only question type compatible with Key Drivers is the Multiple Choice question . How you set it up depends on what you want to analyze: Outcome metrics use a multiple choice question with 2-7 answer choices. Data points are created from multiple choice questions with the same number of answer choices as the outcome metric. Example If you want to know how often people will use your product, set up a multiple choice question with 5 answer options asking people about frequency of use. Frequency of use would be your outcome metric. Then, any other multiple choice questions in your survey with 5 answer options will show as data points when determining how often people want to use your product. For example, one of these questions could ask people on a 5 point scale how innovative they find your products. This shows as a data point for the frequency of use outcome metric in Key Drivers. Data points create a chart that helps you correlate how these affect each other. Using the example above, you would be able to see how frequency of use changes depending on how innovative people find your product. Viewing Key Drivers in Analyze When you're ready to Analyze your data: Go to the Analyze section of your project. Click the dropdown menu on the right side of the page and select Key Drivers . Click the blue text above the chart to choose your settings. Choose your outcome variable from the dropdown and preferred chart scale. Click Save . To see our recommendations based on this outcome metric, click the Insights icon above the chart. AI Powered Insights AI insights help you understand your data by recommending filters that significantly change the question distribution. Setting Up Your Survey to Use AI Insights Question type Insights What you see Multiple Choice What scored well vs what didn't score well. See the top 3 insights per compatible question. Only displays insights that have 95% significance (0.05 p-value). Checkbox Significant changes to the answer distributions. Filter sets that most significantly change the answer option distribution. How insights are calculated Calculations depend on question type: Multiple choice questions use a one-tailed z-proportion test with 95% confidence interval to recommend filters that generate the largest difference in answer distributions. Checkbox questions use a two-tailed chi-squared test with 95% confidence interval to recommend filters that generate the largest difference in answer distributions. See AI Powered Insights in Analyze When you're ready to Analyze your data: You can also click the Insights icon on your question charts. If you can't click the icon, it means no insights were found for that question. Go to the Analyze section of your project. Click Auto Insights . Check which metrics you want to show. Choose whether you want to group insights by Metric or Score . You can also click the Insights icon on your question charts. If you can't click the icon, it means no insights were found for that question. Filters & Crosstabs Filters and crosstabs help you view a specific subset of your data. Filters To get started, click ø Filters at the top of the Analyze page. Select options break down your results even further by choosing the criteria you want to focus on. You can only apply 1 filter at a time. You can save filters for future use on your same browser and device. It's not possible to share filters. Crosstabs Click the dropdown menu on the right side of the Analyze page and select crosstabs . Choose the rows and columns you want to see, then click Next to see a preview. You can name and save your crosstab to come back to it again later, or export it to a .CSV file. Need more data? We can help! Contact our team to purchase additional responses. Title: Account Types and Account Ownership
Text: Account Types and Account Ownership | SurveyMonkey Help Log in SurveyMonkey In this article Account Types Changing Your Account Type Ownership of Accounts Enterprise and Team Plans Individual Plans Help Privacy & Legal Privacy & Data Account Types and Account Ownership SurveyMonkey Account Types and Account Ownership Account Types Changing Your Account Type Ownership of Accounts Enterprise and Team Plans Individual Plans Account Types Your account type - listed in Account Details for paid individual plans - determines how we interact with your account. Because our paid services are primarily intended for use by businesses and professional users, your account type is set as Business by default. Team and Enterprise accounts are always considered Business accounts. However, if you have a paid, individual plan and you are primarily using our service for personal, family or household purposes, we ask that you log in to your account and update your account type to Consumer (Personal) so that we may better understand such personal use of our platform and services. Changing Your Account Type First, in the Account Details section of the My Account page, click Edit next to Business in the Account type field. Then, on the Account type screen, select the Consumer (Personal) option, and click Save . Ownership of Accounts The owner of your account and the data in it depends on your plan type listed in the Account Details section of the My Account page. Enterprise and Team Plans If you have an Enterprise or Team account, we regard the organization to be the owner of the team and all the accounts on that team. This makes it easier for organizations to ensure they retain ownership and control of all surveys and survey data contained in the User, Admin, and Primary Admin accounts. SurveyMonkey doesn’t claim ownership of the survey questions your organization creates or responses it collects through its accounts. The organization, or a verified representative of it, is responsible for payment obligations and has the ability to manage all the team's accounts—even if that representative is not an account holder. Individual Plans If you have an individual plan and have not joined a team, the email address listed in My Account is considered the sole owner of, and is accountable for, the account and information created and collected using our system. If your email address is a work email address, then your organization will be considered accountable for the account and information created and collected using our system. Each SurveyMonkey account is meant for one person and sharing accounts is against our Terms of Use . Title: Survey Design System Messages
Text: Survey Design System Messages | SurveyMonkey Help Log in SurveyMonkey Help Site Survey Design System Messages SurveyMonkey Survey Design System Messages Badges For your convenience, the survey designer shows badges to indicate when certain features are implemented on pages and questions in your survey. This allows you to quickly identify, remove and change the question or pages affected by these features. Hovering over the badges will show a tooltip indicating what feature they're representing. If you click on the badge, it'll jump you to the feature in the interface. Page Skip Logic Applied Page Randomization Applied Question Skip Logic Applied Quota Applied Question Randomization Applied Notifications In the lower right hand corner, we'll pop up information, messages and statuses on communication happening between your browser and our servers. These notifications are used to both let you know when data is being transmitted or received. If an error occurs, you'll see it show up in red and persist on the screen. You can reference some of the most common error messages and what they mean in the Errors section at the bottom of this page. Warnings The following messages are shown when we detect that you've made a change that might cause an adverse affect on your survey. CIRCULAR LOGIC This warning display because the Question Skip Logic you've implemented causes a page to redirect to a question on the same page. Please note that question logic only executes when the user hits the Next button at the end of the page. EDITING CERTIFIED QUESTIONS The use of some SurveyMonkey features results in the loss of certification for questions added from our Question Bank Library . If you edit the wording of a question or how the answer choices are presented, it'll no longer be certified, which means it might be subject to bias and accuracy issues. This will also cause the Question Bank-certified badge disappear from the question. Parts of certain Certified Questions can be customized if you see dropdowns in the question text. Clicking on those words will give you alternative options that can better fit the context of your survey. Limitations The following messages are shown when changes to the survey or question will limit the features you can use. RESPONSES COLLECTED: Changes to this question will be limited. Because this question has collected responses, the changes you can make to this question will be limited to help preserve the integrity of the data already collected. For example, you will only be able to hide certain answer options rather than delete them. CHOICES ADDED: Save this question to apply logic to recently added answers. The choices you've recently added to the question weren't saved before you switched to the logic tab. Until you save the question, the new answer choices will not be available in the Question Skip Logic settings. You'll need to save the question and then edit it again to use the new answer choices in your skip logic. QUOTA APPLIED: Changes to this question will be limited. Because a quota was created that references this question, the changes you can make to this question will be limited to help preserve the integrity of the quota. For example, you will only be able to hide certain answer options rather than delete them. LOGIC APPLIED: Changes to this question will be limited. Because this question has question logic associated with it, the changes you can make to this question will be limited to help preserve the integrity of logic. For example, you will only be able to hide certain answer options rather than delete them. LOGIC APPLIED : This survey has skip logic in it. Therefore, only the percentage complete can be displayed. If you apply page skip logic or question skip logic to your survey, the number of pages complete will be hidden from the progress bar. You can, however, still show percentage complete in the progress bar. Errors The following are some errors that may occur while designing a survey. Something went wrong, Server Error, Invalid input These will occur if something bad happened on our side. Please retry your action again and if the issue continues to occur then please contact customer support . Error saving logo This will occur if you something went wrong while saving your custom logo to your survey. Try saving/uploading your logo again and if the issue continues to occur then please contact customer support . Piping error This will occur if you have attempted to use piping logic that is invalid. Please check your piping logic and try again. Quota error This will occur if you something went wrong while applying a Quota to your survey. Try again and if the issue continues to occur then please contact customer support . File Upload Not Available This will occur when the service we use to handle file uploads in SurveyMonkey could not be loaded. Please try refreshing the page and if the issue continues to occur then please contact customer support . Title: Measuring Customer Satisfaction (CSAT) with Salesforce
Text: Measuring Customer Satisfaction (CSAT) with Salesforce | GetFeedback Help Log in GetFeedback In this article Calculating CSAT Scores Measuring CSAT with Salesforce Help Salesforce Measuring Customer Satisfaction (CSAT) with Salesforce GetFeedback Measuring Customer Satisfaction (CSAT) with Salesforce Calculating CSAT Scores Measuring CSAT with Salesforce GetFeedback makes it easy to measure customer satisfaction with the CSAT question. CSAT helps you understand a customer’s experience with a specific interaction or experience, such as contacting support or making a purchase. You can use CSAT scores to coach your employees, improve transaction experiences, and more. You can use CSAT with other metrics to understand the full customer experience with your brand. This guide helps you calculate and report your CSAT scores in Salesforce. Use these formulas to calculate the CSAT score from your GetFeedback surveys and build reports and dashboards in Salesforce. Calculating CSAT Scores GetFeedback calculates CSAT as a percentage of satisfied responses (people who selected 4 or 5). Satisfied scores are a more accurate predictor of customer retention. To calculate CSAT score: Take the number of respondents who answered 4 and 5. Divide that number by the total number of survey responses. Multiply by 100 to see the percentage of satisfied customers. The formula for CSAT scores looks like this: (Number of satisfied customers (4 and 5) / Number of survey responses) x 100 = % of satisfied customers Example : 500 people responded to a CSAT survey. 68 were Very Satisfied (score 5), and 74 were Somewhat Satisfied (score 4). Add the number of Satisfied and Somewhat Satisfied responses to get 142. Divide 142 by the total number of responses (500). You get .284 . Multiply .284 by 100 to get 28.4%. This is your CSAT score. The equation would look like this: (142 / 500) x 100 = 28.4% Measuring CSAT with Salesforce You can track CSAT scores in Salesforce to include them in dashboards and reports. There are a few steps to complete to set up CSAT in Salesforce: Create your CSAT survey Create a CSAT object in Salesforce Map your survey to the CSAT object Add merge fields to your survey Create a CSAT Survey Create a GetFeedback survey with a CSAT question. You can use a template or build a survey from scratch. You can also use Quick Launch to quickly build a CSAT survey that integrates with Salesforce. Create a CSAT Object in Salesforce Create a custom object to hold CSAT responses from your survey. You’ll use Salesforce Custom Mappings to send survey responses to this object. When creating your CSAT object: Name the object after your survey so you can recognize the object - for example, “Case Closed CSAT.” Include a field for every survey question/answer you want to map to Salesforce. Include a field for each merge field in your survey. Set Up Mappings In GetFeedback , map your survey to the CSAT object you created in Salesforce. Use our custom mapping tool to send survey responses to your custom object and fields. Some survey questions can only be mapped to certain Salesforce field types. Learn more Add Merge Fields To track who sent a response, you can add merge fields. Merge fields pull in data from Salesforce when someone opens your survey, such as their Contact or Account ID. Merge fields also help Salesforce know where to map data to. The way you add merge fields depends on how you send your survey: Sending automated emails from GetFeedback : You’ll add merge fields while setting up your email automation. Sending to a list using a Salesforce report : You’ll add merge fields to each contact in your list. Sending emails directly from Salesforce : You’ll need to add merge fields to the survey link using our Salesforce link builder . Learn more about merge fields Send Your Survey You can now send your survey to respondents. When someone takes your survey, their response will be mapped to Salesforce. You can set up dashboards and reports in Salesforce with the data you mapped from your survey. Create Salesforce Reports and Group Responses If you create reports in Salesforce, you can group customers by CSAT score. You can use this data to quickly find unsatisfied customers. When you create your report in Salesforce, calculate the overall CSAT score using this formula: ((CSAT_Survey__c.CSAT__c:AVG)/5)*100 Your survey respondents will be grouped by score on the report. Title: Release Notes – November 2024
Text: Release Notes – November 2024 | SurveyMonkey Help Log in SurveyMonkey Help What's new Release Notes Release Notes – November 2024 SurveyMonkey Release Notes – November 2024 Expanded Build with AI question types SurveyMonkey Genius, your personal AI-powered survey expert, can now generate star rating, ranking and matrix question types when you use Build with AI to create a survey. Build with AI is available for all customers. Available question types may vary by plan Learn more about Build with AI Tag teammates in surveys with “@” Invite others to collaborate on surveys using “@” to invite people to comment on specific questions or areas of your survey. Available on Team and Enterprise plans Learn more Get more demographic data from Audience panel projects View more demographic breakdowns in Analyze for your targeting criteria (on 200+ criteria), such as marital status, in addition to currently-available demographics (age, gender, household income, device type, US region). Available on Basic, Advantage, Premier, and Team plans. Limited availability on Enterprise plans. Learn more about reaching your target audience Badges for Analyze rules Easily understand the rules you have set in Analyze with new applied rules badges, so you can see how your data is being sliced and diced at a glance. Available on all plans Learn more about filtering survey results Analyze with AI (beta) SurveyMonkey Genius will help you analyze your survey data by providing charts and key insight summaries, so you can reach valuable conclusions more quickly and reliably. Title: Printing a PDF of a Survey
Text: Printing a PDF of a Survey | SurveyMonkey Help Log in SurveyMonkey In this article Print Options Limitations Help Managing & Sharing Surveys Organizing & Copying Printing a PDF of a Survey SurveyMonkey Printing a PDF of a Survey Print Options Limitations Print Survey PDF Paid feature Log in to see if this feature is included in your plan. Log in Sign up free To download the survey design in PDF format: Select the Design Survey tab. Select the printer icon on the right side of the survey design header. Select your print options—see the options in the table below. Select Download PDF . A PDF of the survey design in your default survey language downloads to your computer. Once you open the download, you can print it from the PDF viewer program you use, like Adobe Reader . TIP! If you don't see the printer icon, go to your browser settings and zoom out your view. Print Options You can choose from these options when you print your survey design. Option Description Print style Choose Optimized for Print to download a grayscale PDF of the survey design, or choose Use Current Theme to download a PDF in your survey's theme colors. Include images Include your logo, images, and Image A/B Tests in the PDF. Include survey title Even if your display options are set to hide the survey title, checking this box includes the survey title in the PDF. Include page numbers Shows the page numbers at the top of each page. If your display options are set to hide page titles, page numbers won't appear in the PDF. Print without page breaks All survey questions get downloaded together, without survey page breaks on the PDF. Orientation Choose Portrait (Vertical) or Landscape (Horizontal) . Paper Size Choose Letter (8.5" x 11") , Legal (8.5" x 14") , or A4 (210mm x 297 mm) Limitations The PDF of your survey design won't include the following aspects of your survey: Logic Menu choices in Dropdown or Matrix of dropdown menus questions Languages other than your default survey language SurveyMonkey footer Navigation buttons Getting Feedback? You can share an online preview of your survey and invite people to comment . The online preview will let others test the survey experience, and their responses won't be recorded. Title: Previously Recorded Webinars
Text: Previously Recorded Webinars | Apply Help Log in Apply In this article How to prepare for a new application cycle Testing Your SMApply Site Review Assignments Manual and Automatic Emails Administrative Permissions Piping Reusable Applicant Tasks Custom Fields Managing Applications Automations Testing your site Advanced Expression Piping Help Getting Started Previously Recorded Webinars Apply Previously Recorded Webinars How to prepare for a new application cycle Testing Your SMApply Site Review Assignments Manual and Automatic Emails Administrative Permissions Piping Reusable Applicant Tasks Custom Fields Managing Applications Automations Testing your site Advanced Expression Piping Missed a webinar or need a refresher? Browse through the topics below to view a previously recorded webinar: How to prepare for a new application cycle It’s that time of year -- you’ve selected your awardees and shared the great news! Maybe you have a few weeks to take a quick break, but it won’t be long before it’s time to start the application and review process again. In this Masterclass Webinar, learn how to easily close off an application cycle to prepare for your next round of application and review. With a few easy steps, you can make archiving and storing data quick and easy. The best part? Following these steps also ensures you can track data year-over-year and measure your impact! In this Masterclass Webinar, learn how to: Make changes in the application process prior to starting a new cycle Safely archive past application and review data Pull and compare reports for each application cycle To view this session, Click HERE . Testing Your SMApply Site Testing, testing! How to make sure your site is ready to launch In this Masterclass Webinar, learn how to quickly and easily test your site from start to finish, to ensure it’s ready for your applicants and reviewers. When your site is complete and you’ve had your last call with the Implementation Specialist, it’s time to start testing! Testing your site helps ensure you’re comfortable with the final product, and allows you to become more familiar with the workings of your site. By creating test users and reviewing your site, you’ll gain a better understanding of how your site works and equip yourself with the knowledge necessary to help users on their journey as an applicant or reviewer. In this Masterclass Webinar, we covered: Creating test users and testing all site functionality Troubleshooting common questions from applicants and reviewers Getting familiar with site details and management processes To view this session, Click HERE . Review Assignments Take control of your review process with Reviewer Assignments In this Masterclass Webinar, learn quick and efficient methods of assigning applications to reviewers in a way that makes sense for your process. When your application deadline closes, it’s time to assign applications to reviewers. Instead of assessing and assigning each one individually, use SurveyMonkey Apply’s assignment features to determine the best and most efficient way to get your reviewers the applications they need. By leveraging SurveyMonkey Apply’s assignment features, application assignment and review can happen quickly, saving time and removing redundant tasks for administrators while reducing wait time for applicants. In this Masterclass Webinar, we covered: Reviewing different options for assigning applications to reviewers Managing reviewer visibility settings Using Apply’s newest review feature; Application Highlights Harnessing the power of automatic assignments To view this session, Click HERE . Manual and Automatic Emails Effortlessly communicate with your applicants and reviewers using SurveyMonkey Apply In this Masterclass Webinar, learn how to effectively communicate with applicants and reviewers throughout your process while saving time and effort! Communicating with your applicants and reviewers is essential to a smooth and efficient process. Applicants want to be informed throughout their application process, and reviewers appreciate a few reminders and updates from time to time. SurveyMonkey Apply can help you streamline and automate communications throughout your site, while still offering a personalized experience. By automatically or manually sending emails through SurveyMonkey Apply, you can maintain communication with users without missing a beat. In this Masterclass Webinar, we covered: How and when to leverage manual vs. automated emails Which communications can be automated throughout the application process New ways to automate information sharing using Apply’s Dynamic Documents feature To view this session, Click HERE . Administrative Permissions Keep your programs secure with controlled administrative access In this Masterclass Webinar, learn about the different levels of administrative access you can grant to users in SurveyMonkey Apply. Setting permissions for each of your administrators helps keep your data secure by ensuring program-level data is accessed only by those who need it. Administrative permissions also help to reduce clutter for program leads by showing them only what’s relevant. Overall, permissions can help by creating a more efficient chain of command. Not only will you you be able to delegate tasks to program leads, but you’ll have confidence knowing they won’t be able to see any additional information outside of the programs you allow them to work with. In this Masterclass Webinar, we covered: Learning about the different levels of administrative access that can be granted Understanding the benefits of setting administrative permissions for users Gathering useful tips on how to set administrative permissions, from start to finish To view this session, Click HERE . Piping Use piping to auto-populate data into applications and emails Personalize your application, save time and improve data accuracy. In this Masterclass Webinar, learn how to leverage piping to automatically bring previously entered information into forms and emails, reducing redundant tasks while ensuring accurate information throughout your process. For example, pipe an applicant’s first name, last name, and email into forms, eliminating their need to manually enter it multiple times. Or, say you want to send reviewer feedback to applicants via email, auto-populate that information into an email instead of copy and pasting each and every comment. We covered: • What information can be piped into forms or emails • how to auto-populate data in Apply • Primary use cases for piping in an application process To view this Session, Click Here Reusable Applicant Tasks New feature alert! Save your applicants time with Reusable Applicant Tasks Sometimes an application process requires applicants to fill out their information more than once, or on more than one page. Reusable Applicant Tasks will allow your applicants to re-use data they have previously entered into your SurveyMonkey Apply site, whether that be data from an application form, previously uploaded documentation, or media. Applicant experience is important - and we want to make sure that your applicants have the most seamless one possible! This Masterclass Webinar will explore how to create Reusable Applicant Tasks in your workflow, to save applicants time. We covered: Common use cases How to create a Reusable Applicant Task How to use Reusable Applicant Tasks across stages and across programs To view this Session, Click Here Custom Fields Custom Fields are a special set of custom data that you can implement within your site. These Custom Fields can be used to gather and apply extra data to different aspects of your site, such as applications or users. This MasterClass Webinar will cover how to add and configure a Custom Field to collect required data. We’ll cover: How to create a Custom Field How to manage Custom Fields Popular Use cases To view this Session, Click Here Managing Applications Managing Applications efficiently can help you and your staff cut down on time spent sorting through applications, allowing you to move towards your mission faster. In this MasterClass Webinar, we’ll go through the “applications” area of the site, and show you some tips, tricks, and features. We’ll cover: General application overview How to filter and search for applications using specific criteria How to move applications to different stages How to send emails Making Decisions To view this Session, Click Here Automations Automations can help you eliminate redundant tasks and save time for the whole team. In this webinar, you'll learn the basics of automations: where they are, how to use them, and why! We’ll cover: Different types of automations How to create an automation How to create a more specific automation with ‘conditions’ Best practices for building automations To view this Session, Click Here Testing your site Testing your site throughout the build will help ensure that when you’re ready to start collecting applications, everything is running smoothly. No surprises! We’ll cover: How to test your site from an Applicant’s perspective How to test your site from a Reviewer’s perspective Basic and effective tests you should be running To view this Session, Click Here Advanced Expression Piping Advanced Expression Piping is a feature that helps you automatically calculate numbers entered into a form, saving time and avoiding errors from manual calculation. In this webinar, you'll learn how to build advanced formulas and how to use them in your application and review process. We’ll cover: How to use calculations in a form How to update existing formulas Information on the different mathematical operators you can use in a calculation To view this Session, Click Here Related Articles July 2025 August 2025 June 2025 English Company SurveyMonkey About Us Jobs Blog Help SurveyMonkey Help GetFeedback Help Market Research Help SurveyMonkey Audience Help SurveyMonkey Contribute Help Wufoo Help Apply Help Support Site Status Unsubscribe Contact Us Email Opt-In Policies Legal Center Privacy Policy Cookies Notice California Privacy Notice Copyright © 1999-2025 SurveyMonkey BBB credentials logo TrustedSite logo

Title: Using Themes to Style Surveys
Text: Using Themes to Style Surveys | SurveyMonkey Help Log in SurveyMonkey In this article Applying a Theme Types of Themes in the Theme Library Creating Your Own Themes Customizing your Themes Editing Details and Limitations Classic Themes Accessible Surveys Help Creating Surveys Themes & Format Options Using Themes to Style Surveys SurveyMonkey Using Themes to Style Surveys Applying a Theme Types of Themes in the Theme Library Creating Your Own Themes Customizing your Themes Editing Details and Limitations Classic Themes Accessible Surveys You can change the appearance of your survey by changing the colors or fonts, applying a theme, or customizing options like adding a logo or removing the footer. Applying a Theme To apply a theme to your survey: Go to the Design Survey tab in any survey. Select Style . Select the Themes tab. Select any theme to apply it to your survey. As you build your survey, you can always use the rich text editor to make formatting changes to specific text to override the theme settings. Theme colors apply to Email Invitations ! When you use the HTML Template with an email invitation, the header and Begin Survey button match the Survey Title Background color of your theme. Types of Themes in the Theme Library You can choose from themes in a few categories: Theme Type Description Standard Themes Standard themes are basic, pre-designed themes anyone can apply to your survey to change the overall the look and feel. You may need a paid plan to customize it further. My Themes These are Standard Themes you customized or generated. When you create a custom theme , it's saved in My Themes so you can use it again in the future on any of your other surveys. Premium Themes Premium themes are pre-designed themes that use advanced customization features. Team Themes Team themes are themes that have been customized and saved to your team's Library . Primary Admins and Admins can add themes to the Library to share them with every member of their team. If your team has added a CSS theme, you’ll find it here. Creating Your Own Themes There are a few ways to build your own theme: Generate a theme from an image : Use our theme generator to build a custom theme based on an image, like your company’s logo. Create a custom theme : Manually create your own custom theme. Anyone can create a custom theme and preview it on a survey. Depending on your plan and the features you use, you may be prompted to upgrade your plan or remove the paid features before you can send your survey. Generating a Theme from an Image Device limitation: Generating a theme using an image is only available to customers on desktop devices. Generate a theme to quickly customize your survey theme to match your brand’s style. All you need to do is upload an image, like your company logo, and we'll use machine learning to pull colors from the image to generate a theme. File requirements: Upload a PNG, JPG, or GIF. File size can be 2 MB or less. To generate a theme: Go to the Design Survey tab of your survey. In the Style menu, select Generate theme . If your survey already has a logo, your theme is generated based on that image. If you haven’t uploaded a logo yet, continue with the instructions below: Select Upload image . Choose whether to Use image as my logo . Select Generate theme . SurveyMonkey generates and saves your theme. Choose from the suggested font, color, and layout options to customize your theme. If you want to add a color, click + under Select theme color . You can use more detailed customization tools later. (Optional) Use the thumbs up and down buttons to tell us whether the generated theme works well for you. Select Done . To find your generated theme, go to the My Themes section of the Themes tab. Theme generation isn't available if your survey uses a classic theme. Create a copy of your survey to use this feature. For Teams and Enterprise plans, this feature may not be available if an admin has set a default logo in your library . Manually Creating a Custom Theme Custom Themes Paid feature Log in to see if this feature is included in your plan. Log in Sign up free To create a custom theme: Go to the Design Survey section in any survey. In the left sidebar, click Style . Select the Themes tab. Under My themes , select Create custom theme . Your theme is saved in the Style menu under My themes. In the Settings tab, customize your theme. Customizing your Themes To edit custom and generated themes: Open the Style menu. Go to the Themes tab. Scroll to My themes . Find your theme, then select the three dots menu. Select Edit . Theme Settings These are the sections you'll find in the Settings tab as you're customizing your theme. Logo and footer settings aren't carried over when you apply your custom theme to a different survey. Expand | Collapse Nickname Enter a name for your theme to stay organized. Respondents won't see this. Logo When you add a logo you can choose to position your logo Left , Center , or Right . Footer You can hide SurveyMonkey branding from the bottom of your survey design. Fonts You can change the font type, style and size for the survey title, survey questions, and answer choices. The font formatting used for your thank you message , disqualification message , over-quota message , or password required message is inherited by the Answer Choices font settings. Layout You can use layouts to choose how and where your background color or image is displayed. Background Image You can upload your own background image or select one from thousands in our gallery. How your background image displays and what size your image should be depends on the type of device and screen size. We recommend uploading your background image, then previewing your survey to see what it will look like on multiple device types. To change the background image: Click Replace . Choose From Computer or From Image Gallery . Click Done . Backgrounds on Mobile Devices How background images display on mobile or tablet devices depends on which layout you choose: Full background surveys don't display the image. Instead, the survey background color will show. Partial background surveys will display the image by shrinking it to fit the device. Images larger than 600px may be cut off. TIP! When you select a background image, it's automatically used as your Thumbnail Image . You can further customize your Thumbnail Image & Text in the collector options. Colors You can change the color of the elements listed in the table below by using the color picker, or entering your own hex codes. Element Description Title Text The text color of your survey title . Quiz score text takes on the Title text color selection, so choose contrasting Title text and Survey background colors. Question Text The text color of your survey questions. Answer Choice Text The text color of a question's answer options. Accents Accents are things like buttons, progress bars, and selected checkboxes. Accent Text The text color for accents like buttons, progress bars, and selected checkboxes. This color will always appear on top of the Accents color, so make sure there’s enough contrast so it’s easy to read. Survey Background The background color that appears behind the questions in your survey. If you’re using a background image, this color is hidden. Secondary Background If you’re using a background image, this color overlays on top of the background image. You can control the Overlay Opacity in the Background settings to make the text in your survey easier to read.If you’re using a Split Background layout, this is the background color of the Third, Half, or Banner part of the layout. The Survey Background color will only show if you haven't added a Background Image. Previewing Your Theme As you customize your theme, you can view your changes on the right side of the page. However, to see the background image, you need to preview your survey. Editing Details and Limitations There are a few things to keep in mind when editing your themes: Expand | Collapse Fonts Font You can choose from several popular fonts for your survey. Choosing a font from the Font menu applies it to every text element in your survey. You can override the main font for the Survey Title or Page Title by selecting a different font in those specific sections. Font Size & Style For each of the following text elements in your survey, you can edit either the text size, style (bold, italic, or underline), or both—depending on the element. Element Text Size Style Survey Title ✅ ✅ Page Title ✅ ✅ Page Description ❌ ✅ Progress Bar ✅ ❌ Question Text ✅ ✅ Answer Text ✅ ✅ Error Text ✅ ✅ Colors You can change the color of the elements listed in the table below by using the color picker, or entering your own hex codes. Number Element 1 Survey Logo Background 2 Survey Title 3 Survey Title Background 4 Survey Background 5 Page Title 6 Page Title Background 7 Page Background 8 Progress Bar Text 9 Progress Bar Indicator 10 Progress Bar Border 11 Progress Bar Background 12 Page Description 13 Error Text 14 Required Asterisk 15 Question Text 16 Answer Text 17 Answer Text Highlight The Survey Background color will only show if you haven't added a Background Image. Button Colors The background and font colors of the Next button will always match the Survey Title Background and Survey Title settings, which you can edit in the Colors section of your theme. If these colors are the same, the buttons will default to grey with black text. However, you can't change the button color if you use the Sea Foam or Autumn themes. See the Editing Limitations sections below for more information. Logo When you add a logo you can choose to position your logo Above Title , Below Title , or Left of Title . Editing Limitations Depending on the theme you're using, there may be some elements that can't be edited. Theme Editing Limitations Autumn The theme is full width, so you can't add a Background Color or Background Image.You can't edit the shape or color of the Next and Previous buttons.You can't change the height of the Survey Title Background.You can't edit or remove the circles around the question numbers. Boardwalk You can't remove the drop shadow around the survey. Charcoal You can't remove the small horizontal line under the Survey Title.Editing options are limited for Matrix/Rating Scale or Matrix of Dropdown questions.You can't update the Font Type of Answer Text. City Lights You can't change or remove the header background image.You can't change the transparency of the Survey Title Background.Editing options are limited for Matrix/Rating Scale or Matrix of Dropdown questions.You can't update the Font Type of Answer Text. Jungle The theme is full width, so you can't add a Background Color or Background Image. Midnight Editing options are limited for Matrix/Rating Scale or Matrix of Dropdown questions. Moss You can't change the rounded corners of the survey.Editing options are limited for Matrix/Rating Scale or Matrix of Dropdown questions. Ocean Editing options are limited for Matrix/Rating Scale or Matrix of Dropdown questions. Sea Foam The theme is full width, so you can't add a Background Color or Background Image.You can't edit the shape or color of the Next and Previous buttons.You can't change the height of the Survey Title Background.You can't change the color of the question numbers. Sky You can't change the rounded corners of the survey Spring Editing options are limited for Matrix/Rating Scale or Matrix of Dropdown questions. Adding CSS Themes Enterprise Admins have the option to add a CSS theme to completely customize survey fonts, colors, and branding. Keep in mind, CSS isn’t the same as JavaScript and allows styling customization, but not logic changes. To add a CSS theme, see Managing Brand Assets in the Library . Editing a Custom or CSS Theme Changes made to a custom or CSS theme affect any surveys with that theme applied. If you need to edit an existing custom theme that’s already being used on other surveys, select the three dots next to the theme and choose Duplicate . This ensures you don’t change your existing surveys. If you share a survey with a custom theme, only the survey owner will be able to make edits. Classic Themes The following themes are considered classic themes: Jungle, Sky, Ocean, Sea Foam, Midnight, Spring, Autumn, Charcoal, Moss, Aqua, City Lights, Boardwalk, and Seashell. To use a classic theme on a new survey, you can make a copy of an existing survey with the classic theme applied and the styling will carry over. It isn’t possible to use a classic theme on a survey created any other way . Incompatible Features Some features aren’t supported when using a Classic theme. If you want to add incompatible features, like the Best Worst Scale, Name, Email Address, Phone, Address questions, confirmation emails for web link surveys, or MaxDiff questions, you need to update your theme to any Standard or Premium theme. To create a copy of your survey with a compatible theme to utilize all features: Add a new Best Worst Scale, Name, Email Address, Phone, or Address question to your survey that uses a Classic theme. Click Copy survey . This keeps the rest of your survey design intact and creates an exact copy but with a compatible theme. You’re able to change your theme to any other Standard or Premium theme after copying. Accessible Surveys You can use SurveyMonkey to create surveys that are accessible to people using screen readers. Learn more: Creating Accessible Surveys Related Articles Scoring Your Survey Measure Customer Satisfaction (CSAT) with SurveyMonkey Accepting Payments with PayPal English Company SurveyMonkey About Us Jobs Blog Help SurveyMonkey Help GetFeedback Help Market Research Help SurveyMonkey Audience Help SurveyMonkey Contribute Help Wufoo Help Apply Help Support Site Status Unsubscribe Contact Us Email Opt-In Policies Legal Center Privacy Policy Cookies Notice California Privacy Notice Copyright © 1999-2025 SurveyMonkey BBB credentials logo TrustedSite logo

Title: Get Feedback on Error Pages
Text: Get Feedback on Error Pages | GetFeedback Help Log in GetFeedback In this article Targeting Visitors on a Particular Page (URL) Targeting using custom JavaScript value trigger Targeting using a manual trigger Help Programs Survey use cases Get Feedback on Error Pages GetFeedback Get Feedback on Error Pages Targeting Visitors on a Particular Page (URL) Targeting using custom JavaScript value trigger Targeting using a manual trigger Get insights into why your users land on a system error page by setting up the right targeting criteria using a Full Survey or Slide Out Survey . With this information, you can pinpoint key issues and make changes to reduce the number of people getting sent to a system error page. To create an error page survey: In app.usabilla.com, create a web campaign. Create either a Full Survey or Slide Out Survey. Add questions to ask respondents how they got to the error page. It’s best to use the radio button element for these questions. For example, you can ask, “How did you land on this page?” and provide the following options: I had an issue with my device I clicked the "next" button I clicked the "back" button I searched for this specific word: Other Target users when they land on an error page. Depending on how you distinguish your error page, you can either: Target visitors on a particular page (URL) Target using a custom JavaScript value trigger Target using a manual trigger Targeting Visitors on a Particular Page (URL) If your URL path indicates the error page, you can target the URL path of the error pages. For example, target visitors when the path contains: /404/,/systemerror/,/errorpage/,/404.html Targeting using custom JavaScript value trigger If you indicate the error page in the title of the page rather than the URL, you can target a custom JavaScript value and use the document:title option. The variable “title” is equals to “the title of your error page.” To use custom JavaScript triggers, please contact support@getfeedback.com for assistance.to help set this up. Targeting using a manual trigger If you are using a content management system (CMS), it's best to use a manual trigger. Add the manual trigger using the script tag. Title: Creating a Real-Time Poll
Text: Creating a Real-Time Poll | GetFeedback Help Log in GetFeedback In this article Real-Time Polling Use Cases Distributing the Survey URL Viewing the Results of a Real-Time Poll Help Programs Survey use cases Creating a Real-Time Poll GetFeedback Creating a Real-Time Poll Real-Time Polling Use Cases Distributing the Survey URL Viewing the Results of a Real-Time Poll Use a one question survey to poll your audience in real-time. Video Real-Time Polling Use Cases Many organizations use GetFeedback for real-time polling in presentations and keynote addresses. This can be an effective mechanism to connect with an audience and have them participate in the direction of the presentation. This style of polling is extremely effective in settings like: training sessions keynote presentations demo jams marketing focus groups Distributing the Survey URL You can easily distribute a survey link to your audience in real-time by distributing the survey to those in the audience via text message, email, or private/public social media. You can also use the GetFeedback survey link and display that as part of the presentation on the screen. Audience members then simply type the URL into the browser on their devices to access the survey. Viewing the Results of a Real-Time Poll GetFeedback Summary Report screens update in real-time without requiring a browser refresh, so you can view your summary data in real-time. Related Articles Sharing and Transferring Surveys Error: “No such column” in Salesforce Getting Started with GetFeedback for Salesforce Company SurveyMonkey About Us Jobs Blog Help SurveyMonkey Help GetFeedback Help Market Research Help SurveyMonkey Audience Help SurveyMonkey Contribute Help Wufoo Help Apply Help Support Site Status Unsubscribe Contact Us Email Opt-In Policies Legal Center Privacy Policy Cookies Notice California Privacy Notice Copyright © 1999-2025 SurveyMonkey BBB credentials logo TrustedSite logo

Title: Connecting to Zendesk
Text: Connecting to Zendesk | GetFeedback Help Log in GetFeedback In this article Connecting GetFeedback to Zendesk Connecting a Survey to Zendesk Help Zendesk Integrating with Zendesk Connecting to Zendesk GetFeedback Connecting to Zendesk Connecting GetFeedback to Zendesk Connecting a Survey to Zendesk Connect your Zendesk account to GetFeedback to automate survey emails or use Quick Launch with Zendesk. Connecting GetFeedback to Zendesk Create a Zendesk connection so you can connect and map your surveys to Zendesk. To connect to Zendesk: Select Integrations > Zendesk . Select Add Connection . Set up the connection details: Connection name . Enter a nickname for your connection so you can remember it easily and distinguish it from other connections you might add later. Zendesk subdomain . Log in to your Zendesk account, then copy the subdomain visible in the URL (it’s the part before “.zendesk.com”). Zendesk admin email . This is the same email address that your admin uses to log in to Zendesk. API token . Your admin can generate an API token for you. Webhook connection . Toggle on to automatically create a webhook in Zendesk. If you do this, you won’t have to create a webhook when setting up a Zendesk Automation. Select Connect . You can now set up Zendesk Automation or create a Quick Launch setup using your Zendesk connection. Connecting a Survey to Zendesk Once you connect GetFeedback to Zendesk, you can set connections for individual surveys. You'll need to connect a survey to Zendesk to use the Zendesk automation or map response data to tickets. To connect a survey to Zendesk: Open your survey, then select Settings . To connect your published survey to Zendesk, make sure the Live Survey tab is selected. Under Zendesk Connections , select the dropdown and choose a connection for your survey. Title: Accepting Payments
Text: Accepting Payments | SurveyMonkey Help Log in SurveyMonkey Help Creating Surveys Survey Use Cases & Templates Accepting Payments SurveyMonkey Accepting Payments PAID FEATURE: Accepting payments is only available on some paid plans—see what's on your plan . Let your respondents make payments right within your form via PayPal or Stripe for classes, application or membership fees, event registrations, and more. You can either assign prices to a single question to easily charge different prices, or charge a fixed price for your entire form. Form owners can choose to offer various prices linked to a single question or set a fixed price for everyone taking your form. If you want to add payments to your form, first choose which third-party payment processor you want to use and learn more in the corresponding article: PayPal Stripe It’s only possible to add one payment method per formm and we don’t recommend switching payment methods on a form. Tip ! Send your respondents a confirmation email so they have a record of their payment on your form. Currency Options Form creators can charge payments in the following currencies: AUD, CAD, CHF, EUR, GBP, HKD, JPY, NOK, NZD, SEK, SGD, and USD. Title: Salesforce: How to Prepare
Text: Salesforce: How to Prepare | Apply Help Log in Apply In this article Salesforce: Overview The "WHAT" The "WHO" The "HOW" Help Advanced Features Salesforce: How to Prepare Apply Salesforce: How to Prepare Salesforce: Overview The "WHAT" The "WHO" The "HOW" Salesforce: Overview Salesforce is a Customer Relationship Management (CRM) tool and it can house large amounts of information. The information in Salesforce is often required within SurveyMonkey Apply in order to fulfill a client’s procedural requirements. Similarly, information in SM Apply is often required to be sent back to Salesforce. Currently, the integration only allows for application-based information. When an application is created, Applicant Custom Fields can be pushed or pulled. Therefore, you will not be able to pull information from an Eligibility Form in the site. Information is collected within SM Apply in the way of creating, editing or submitting an application. This information can be mapped to the corresponding Salesforce field in the form of a “Push” action in our integration. This allows for a client to gain access to the fields that are most important to them from within their Salesforce environment, without having to access SM Apply. If you already have information on the applicant housed in Salesforce, we can PULL this into their SM Apply application, potentially eliminating the need for the applicants to re-enter the information. The "WHAT" This integration allows your organization to exchange information between Salesforce and SurveyMonkey Apply. To get started, ask yourself: What type of data needs to be exchanged? Applicant information? Recommender information? Reviewer information? What type of fields are being sent from Salesforce? SM Apply supports data from standard objects and custom objects. The "WHO" SM Apply facilitates the setup of the integration; however, a member of your organization will be responsible for configuration and mapping. The integration is established using one set of Salesforce login credentials that belong to your Salesforce environment. To get started, ask yourself: Do I have a general Salesforce admin login? [hint: you’ll need one] Who initially configured my company’s Salesforce environment? [colleague or 3rd party?] Is the person responsible for the integration familiar with my company’s Salesforce environment? The "HOW" Information can either be PULLED into SM Apply or PUSHED out to Salesforce. In order for this to occur, the fields in SM Apply should match those in Salesforce. To get started, ask yourself: What information needs to be PULLED into SM Apply? What information needs to be PUSHED to Salesforce?
