Title: Adding a Quota
Text: Adding a Quota | SurveyMonkey Help Log in SurveyMonkey In this article Video Overview Designing Quota Questions Terminology Adding a Quota Viewing Quota Results Help Creating Surveys Applying Logic Adding a Quota SurveyMonkey Adding a Quota Video Overview Designing Quota Questions Terminology Adding a Quota Viewing Quota Results Quotas Paid feature Log in to see if this feature is included in your plan. Log in Sign up free A quota limits the number of people who can take your survey. It helps you get a balanced sample of specific responses and the exact amount of data you need. Once your quota is met, the collector closes so no one else can take your survey. Then you can see the complete results of your quota in your results. Video Overview Designing Quota Questions First, create the survey questions you want to add a quota to using only these supported question types : Multiple Choice Checkboxes Dropdown Menu We suggest adding 1–3 questions with answer choices that help you identify who you want to get responses from. Check out the Video Overview for examples. Terminology Get to know some of the terms you'll encounter when building your quota. Term Definition Simple Quota A type of quota. A Simple Quota lets you use 1 qualifying question in your survey to set limits for how many people can answer with specific answers. You can set limits for one or more Answer Groups from any 1 question. Combination Quota A type of quota. A Combination Quota lets you automatically close your survey once you receive a specific combination of responses across 2 to 3 questions in your survey. Quota Label Field The field where you name your Simple or Combination Quota. The label could be representative of your desired target respondent base. Answer Group Label You can name each Answer Group you create for your quota. This label represents how a someone will answer your qualifying question(s). Answer Groups These are the answer selections you need people to select when taking your survey. Answer Groups can include a single answer choice or multiple answer choices on any single question. A quota can have 1 or more Answer Groups, like in a checkboxes question. Each Answer Group limit needs to be met before your quota is met and the collector closes. Assign Values You Assign Values to combine Answer Groups from your 2–3 questions in a Combination Quota. Once the Answer Groups are selected, you'll set the limit of responses needed with that exact Answer Group combination. You can't Assign Values on a Simple Quota. Equations You can add additional equations, which allow you to Assign Values to other Answer Groups in your Combination Quota. Equations aren't used on a Simple Quota. Quota Options You can control what the over-quota survey takers see after answering your quota questions. Adding a Quota Once your survey design is complete, you're ready to add your quota. There’s a limit of one quota per survey. If you're not sure if a Simple Quota or Combination Quota is best for you, check out the Terminology section above. Expand | Collapse Adding a Simple Quota To apply your Simple Quota: Go to the Design Survey section. In the left sidebar, click the Logic icon. Click Quota . Click Simple Quota . Edit the Quota Label . Select a Question . Pick the page and question that you’ll base your quota on. Click Next . Edit the Answer Group Label . Choose a label that represents the answer choice or choices you’re setting the limit for. Select your Answer Group. In the Quota field, edit the number of people you want to take your survey and respond with the selected answer(s). Click Save . Your Answer Group Label displays with a summary of the number of collected responses and the number of desired responses. (Optional) If you want to add additional Answer Group limits to your Simple Quota, click + Answer Group and repeat steps 8–11. Once you have your Answer Group(s) set up, click the Options button. Select what survey takers see after the quota is met and click Save . Click Done . Adding a Combination Quota To apply a Combination Quota: Go to the Design Survey section. In the left sidebar, click the Logic icon. Click Quota . Click Combination Quota . Edit the Quota Label . Select Questions . Pick 2–3 questions to base your quota on. Click Next . Edit the Answer Group Label for your first question—choose a label that represents the answer choice or choices you’re setting the limit for. Select choices for the Answer Group. Click Save . Click + Answer Group to your second and third questions. Add at least 1 answer group for each question in the Combination Quota. You can add more than 1 answer group to any question in your quota. Once all Answer Groups are set for each Quota question, click Assign Values . To make an equation, choose the Answer Groups you want to combine and edit the number of people who you want to take your survey in that answer group in the Quota field. Click Save . (Optional) Select + Add Equation to create any other set limits for your survey. Click Save . Your Answer Group Label displays with a summary of the number of collected responses and the number of desired respondents. Once you have your target demographics captured by your Answer Group(s), click the Options button. Select what survey takers see after the quota is met and click Save . Click Done . If you add a quota to your survey, you can't embed your first question in an email invitation . You can't add a quota to your survey if you plan to purchase SurveyMonkey Audience responses. Instead, use multiple Audience collectors to reach the respondent sampling you need. Quota Options You can edit the quota options to choose what survey takers see after submitting an answer that exceeds a quota limit. You can also edit the survey closed message for people who try to take the survey after it's closed. Option Description End the survey They proceed to the Survey End Page . Display a custom message They see the custom message you entered. Redirect to your own webpage They are redirected to the URL you entered. Close window Their browser window closes. The font formatting used for a quota's custom message can be controlled by setting the Answer choice font setting . Live Surveys If your survey is live—meaning it already has responses—you can still edit or apply a quota. When you apply a quota to a live survey, existing responses don’t count towards the quota, only new responses do. If your survey closed because the quota was met, you can adjust the quota to accept more qualified responses. You also need to reopen the collector so more people can take your survey. Viewing Quota Results When you're ready to view your quota results, head over to the Analyze Results section. The Quota status bar lets you know how close your quota is to being met. Saved Views When a quota is applied to a survey, a saved view is created for each set of qualified responses. If you have more than one limit set up on your quota, you'll have multiple saved views. When you select a saved view, it displays a filtered view of only the Complete responses within that quota limit. To select a saved view: Go to the Analyze Results section of your survey. In the left sidebar, click Saved Views . Click the name of the view. A green check mark ✅ next to a view means the view is selected. You can toggle a view on and off by clicking its name. Don't edit the filters in these saved views, since there isn't a way to revert back to the original saved view. If you want to add additional filters, use the Original View and build your filters from scratch. Exporting Quota Responses To export quota responses: Go to the Analyze Results section of your survey. Click E Saved Views . Click the More icon ( ... ) next to the quota view you want to export. Select Export view . Choose Summary data or All responses data . Select the file format and settings you want. Click Export . Response Status In the Individual Responses tab of the Analyze Results section, you'll see the Response Status for each respondent. Only Complete responses count towards your quota and are included in your Saved View. Over Quota and Incomplete responses aren't included in your Quota. Deleting Responses If you delete an individual response that counted towards your quota, the quota is still considered met. If you want to collect more qualified responses, increase your quota. Related Articles Scoring Your Survey Measure Customer Satisfaction (CSAT) with SurveyMonkey Accepting Payments with PayPal English Company SurveyMonkey About Us Jobs Blog Help SurveyMonkey Help GetFeedback Help Market Research Help SurveyMonkey Audience Help SurveyMonkey Contribute Help Wufoo Help Apply Help Support Site Status Unsubscribe Contact Us Email Opt-In Policies Legal Center Privacy Policy Cookies Notice California Privacy Notice Copyright © 1999-2025 SurveyMonkey BBB credentials logo TrustedSite logo

Title: Collecting Payments Through Your Form
Text: Collecting Payments Through Your Form | Wufoo Help Log in Wufoo In this article Merchant Setup Payment Options Assign Prices Managing Your Payment Form Help Build a Form Managing Forms Collecting Payments Through Your Form Wufoo Collecting Payments Through Your Form Merchant Setup Payment Options Assign Prices Managing Your Payment Form PAID FEATURE: Collecting payments is only available on some paid plans—see if it’s on your plan . You can collect payments from people who fill out your form by integrating with one of our partnered merchants. To collect payments through a form, or to access the Payment Settings page for an existing payment form: Log in and go to Forms . To the right of the form, If you're using legacy Wufoo, click Payments . If you're using the new Wufoo experience , click the View Payments icon (cart). In the Merchant Setup section, choose and authenticate the merchant you want to use to collect payments (for example, Stripe). In the Payment Options section, choose the currency you want people to pay you with, and configure any of the optional settings. In the Assign Prices section, set the prices for your form so Wufoo knows how much to charge the people that submit your form. Select Enable Payment in the upper-right corner of the page. Click Save Settings . Merchant Setup A merchant is the third-party payment processor that will process your transactions and settle your payments. Choosing the Right Merchant for You There's lots to consider when choosing a merchant. Compare the features available with each merchant to make sure you choose the one that works best for you: Choosing a Merchant Authenticating Your Account Once you choose the merchant you want, the information you'll need to enter to link your merchant account to Wufoo is different depending on the merchant you choose. The following articles include an overview of how each payment integration works and how to set it up in Wufoo: Stripe Square Stripe Subscription Billing Braintree PayPal Standard PayPal Website Payments Pro PayPal Payflow Pro Authorize.Net USA ePay Payment Options Payment Options are the settings that control things like what fields appear on the payment page, who gets receipts, what info those receipts include, and more. Available payment options vary by merchant. List of Payment Options & Descriptions Payment Option Description Currency Determines the currency of the payments you'll receive, which will be reflected on the payment page. You can only set one currency per form. Set up Recurring Billing Set the frequency at which you want to request payment from the people that submit your form. This Payment Option is only available in the Wufoo UI if you're using PayPal Standard , but you can also set up recurring billing with Stripe Subscription Billing , outside of Wufoo. Collect Shipping Address Adds a shipping address section to the payment page where people can select a "Same as Billing Address" checkbox if their billing and shipping address are the same, or they can enter a different shipping address. Email Receipt to User Adds an "Email Receipt To:" field to the payment page, where people can specify an email address to send a copy of their receipt to. You can also use Templating to customize the receipt emails with information specific to the person's entry, and other form and transaction metadata, like the unique ID for the transaction, or the purchase total. Email Copy of Receipt to Me Enter your email address to receive a copy of each receipt to your inbox. If you want to send receipts to more people, you can enter up to 20 email addresses in this field, separated by commas. Limit Card Types Accepted This setting only controls which credit card icons show on your form, but it doesn’t block other card types from being accepted. For example, if you hide Discover, someone could still enter a Discover card number and successfully submit the form. If you want to block certain card types from being accepted, you need to do that on the merchant side. Allow for Coupons Adds a field to your payment page where people can enter a coupon code to get a discount. You'll need to set up the coupon codes in Stripe (Subscription Billing only). If you're using a different merchant but would still like to set up a coupon code system, you can assign negative prices to certain fields in your form, and use the Rule Builder to create a dynamic coupon system. Learn more on our blog: How to Create a Coupon System for Your Wufoo Payment Forms Allow for eCheck Payments Adds the ability to accept payments from consumer and corporate bank accounts, via eCheck.net. Your Authorize.Net account must be specifically configured to accept eChecks to use this payment option. Email Invoice to User Automatically emails a Freshbooks invoice to the client after they submit your form. The invoice will be sent to the email address they entered in your form, so make sure you've included an Email field. If you leave the Email Invoice to User option deselected, instead you'll just need to manually review invoices in your Freshbooks account before sending them off to your clients. Pre-Populate Billing Info Pulls the answers from the Name, Address, and Email fields on the form and pre-populates them into the Credit Card Name, Billing Address, and Email fields on the payment page. People filling out the payment page will still be able to edit these fields if they need to. Show Running Total Adds a running total to the form itself, so people filling out your form can see their total before proceeding to the payment page. Assign Prices Assigning prices tells Wufoo what to charge the people who fill out your form. You can set a fixed amount that everyone needs to pay as the minimum fee, assign prices to individual fields on your form, or both. For example, if you're building a registration form and everyone needs to pay the same minimum registration fee, you could set a Fixed Amount. If there are optional add-ons or special tickets that cost extra, you can also assign prices to individual fields on your form that people may select to sign up for those options. Setting a Fixed Base Price A fixed amount is a base price that everyone needs to pay if they submit your form, regardless of what answers they select. To set a fixed amount: In the Fixed Amount field, enter a name for base fee. This name is what appears on the running total as people fill out your form, and on receipts. Enter a price into the $ textbox. This is the price that every person that submits your form will be charged on the payment page. In the Fixed Amount field, enter the amount you want to charge every person that submits an entry to your form, regardless of what answers they select. If you don't want to charge a base price, set this field to 0. Assigning Prices to Individual Fields You can assign prices to answer choices from Dropdown, Multiple Choice, Checkboxes, or Price fields. Price Fields Since Price fields let people enter their own price, you don't have to assign your own prices to these fields. However, you do need to enable payment for them so that the prices people enter will register with your payment integration. To enable payments for a Price field: First, make sure the Currency Format you selected in the Field Settings of the Price Field matches the Currency you selected in the Payment Options. Go back to the Payments Settings page by clicking Payments next to your form in the Form Manager. From the Assign Prices to a Field dropdown, select the Price field from your form. Dropdown, Multiple Choice, and Checkboxes Fields To assign prices to these field types: From the Assign Prices to a Field dropdown, select a field from your form. In the textbox next to each answer choice, enter the price you want to assign to that choice. This can either be a positive or negative number (just add a - before the price to make it negative): If you enter a positive number , and someone chooses that answer choice when they fill out your form, the price associated with that choice will be added to their total. If you enter a negative number , and someone chooses that answer choice when they fill out your form, the price associated with that choice will be deducted from their total. If you enter 0.00 , and someone chooses that answer choice when they fill out your form, their total won't be affected either way. Repeat steps 1 & 2 for any other fields you want to assign prices to. Allowing People to Buy More Than 1 of Something There's no way to add a quantity dropdown next to a field, but you can use a Dropdown or Multiple Choice field to offer different quantities, and then assign prices to each quantity. Learn more: How to Be Even More Clever with Quantity Fields Adding Tax or Shipping Costs At this time there's no way to add taxes or shipping costs, but you can take these added costs into account when you assign prices. If you want to add tax, we recommend adding that percentage of tax to the price of each item in your form. Managing Your Payment Form Once you share your payment form with the world, here's what you need to know about managing your payment form moving forward. Disabling Payments If you want to stop collecting payments on a form, you can disable payment at any time: Click Forms at the top of any page. Click Payment under the form. Deselect Enable Payment in the upper-right corner of the page. Click Save Settings . If you ever want to re-enable payments, we'll remember your payment settings so it's easy to start collecting payments again. Monitoring Payment Status in the Entry Manager To view the payment status for an entry: Click Forms at the top of any page. Click Entries under the form you want to check. Click See all entries . Click an entry in the table—the payment status will be listed on the right side of the page. Payment Info Description Amount This is the total amount that was charged, regardless of whether or not the charge was actually paid. Status This tells you if the charge was paid, unpaid, or denied. By default, the status of any submission will be “Unpaid”. If your merchant account is set up to notify Wufoo, the status of the submission will be updated as it's either processed or denied by the merchant. You can manually change the payment status by clicking on it. Confirmation All merchants create a transaction or confirmation number for a payment. You can also include payment status information in the datagrid widget on a report. Title: Admin FAQ
Text: Admin FAQ | Apply Help Log in Apply In this article User FAQs Application FAQs Reviewer FAQs Site and Program FAQs Help FAQs and Troubleshooting Frequently Asked Questions Admin FAQ Apply Admin FAQ User FAQs Application FAQs Reviewer FAQs Site and Program FAQs If you are an admin for a site and are building and monitoring programs on your site, below are a few commonly asked questions from SurveyMonkey Apply site administrators. User FAQs How do I change a user's name or email address? Once an account has been created for a user, they will be able to access the account using that email address. However, depending on the circumstances, an applicant may request their email address to be changed. If this is the case you can provide them with the link to the applicable FAQ section which details the steps to change their own email: Applicant FAQ Recommender FAQ Reviewer FAQ Alternatively, you can change it for them. To change a user's email address: Click on the user's name in the top right corner of the page Select My Account Go to My Profile Edit the Name and Email address accordingly When you save the profile, an email will be sent to the new email address and the user will need to confirm the change before it is reflected. NOTE: Please make sure the new email doesn't already have an account within SurveyMonkey Apply. If there is already an existing account under that email, you won't be able to easily change the email using these steps. Instead, the user will need to log in under the new email address as a new account. How do I troubleshoot issues for my users? As an administrator on the site, you will likely receive questions from your users in regards to how to navigate various sections of the site. To assist your users with their questions you can refer to our helpful troubleshooting articles for each type of user: Troubleshooting Applicant Issues Troubleshooting Reviewer Issues Troubleshooting Recommender Issues How do I change a user's password? As an administrator of SurveyMonkey Apply, unfortunately, you do not have the direct ability to change a user's password on their behalf. If a user contacts you wanting to change their password, you can provide them with the following link: General Account FAQ How do I assume the role of a User Assume Role from Manage Users Go to Manage Users Locate the user in the list of users in your site Hover your cursor over the user and click on the More Options icon in the far right column Click Assume Role Assume Role through the User's Profile Go to Manage Users Click on the Name of the User Click on the More Options icon in the top right corner Click Assume Role If you are in the Full-Screen view of the profile: Click Actions Click Assume Role For more information on assuming the role of an applicant, you can refer to How to Assume the Role of a User . How do I get back to my administrator role after assuming the role of a user? To exit the Assume Role feature: Click on the Return to Admin button in the top left side of the screen How do I Activate/Deactivate a User? Activate Users When an applicant has been added manually to the site they won't be active until their email has been verified and their account has been activated. One way to activate their account is to send an invite to the user , however, you can also activate the account manually as an administrator. Activate Individual Users Go to Manage Users Hover your cursor over the user you wish to perform an action on Click on the More Options icon Click Activate Activate Users in Bulk Go to Manage Users Select the Users you wish to perform an action on Click Actions Click Activate Deactivate Users In some cases, you may wish to restrict certain users from accessing your site. If this is the case, we would recommend deactivating a user as opposed to deleting them from the site. Deactivating users allows you to restrict access, but maintains any data that they may have submitted, whether it be applications, recommendations, or reviews. Deactivate Individual Users Go to Manage Users Hover your cursor over the user you wish to perform an action on. Click on the More Options icon Click Deactivate Deactivate Users in Bulk Go to Manage Users Select the Users you wish to perform an action on. Click Actions Click Deactivate Application FAQs How do I change the Application IDs? As described in How to Create a Program - Applications you can customize how Applications are given IDs. When you change the ID for the program, the ID for any application already created will not be changed retroactively. However, if you wish to change the Application ID format for any newly created applications: Go to the Program Settings of the program you wish to make the change for Go to the Applications tab Select or Unselect to include a Prefix on the ID Select or Unselect to Randomize application ID numbers How do I change the way the Applications are titled? As described in How to Create a Program - Application you can choose whether you wish to set the Application Title/Name to be the Application ID, or to a custom title given by the applicant. By default, this will be set to Application ID. However, to change this: Go to the Program Settings of the program you wish to make the change for Go to the Applications tab Select or Unselect Require applicants to name their applications depending on how you wish the Applications to be named. How do I limit the number of applications my applicants can create? As described in How to Create a Program - Application you can choose how many applications an applicant can create per program. In order to set a limit: Go to the Program Settings of the program you wish to make the change for Go to the Applications tab Select or Deselect Allow applicants to apply more than once If you select this option to allow the applicants to apply more than once to the program, click Limit Number of Applications to and enter a value. Can I extend the deadline for specific users? SurveyMonkey Apply does not offer the ability to extend a deadline for only specific users. Any deadline set on the program , stage or task , will apply to all applications that have applied to that program. However, for alternative steps, you can refer to our article on How to Manage/Edit Applications after a Deadline How do I withdraw an application for an applicant? Alternatively, you can delete the application as an administrator by moving the application to the Trash through Manage Applications. For more information, you can refer to How to Move Applications to Trash . If an Applicant contacts you for assistance in withdrawing their application you can provide them with the steps provided in the Applicant FAQ in order to have them withdraw/delete the application themselves. How do I reactivate an Archived or Trashed Application? If an application has been Archived or Trashed you can choose to reactivate it in the site on behalf of the application. Activate an Archived Application Go to Manage Applications Change the status filter to Archived Applications Select the application(s) you wish to reactivate Select More Select Unarchive Activate a Trashed Application Go to Manage Applications Change the status filter to Trashed Applications Select the application(s) you wish to reactivate Select More Select Restore This will return the application to the state it was before the application was archived or Trashed. How do I permanently delete applications? Applications can only be permanently deleted from a site if they are first marked as trash. For this reason, the action of permanently deleting an application can only be carried out from the trashed applications page within Manage Applications. To permanently delete an application: Go to Manage Applications If the applications are Active, first move the applications to the trash Access your trashed applications from the status filter drop-down menu. Select the applications that need to be permanently deleted Select More Select Delete Permanently You will be provided with the warning "Are you sure you want to permanently delete the selected applications?" Click YES to confirm your deletion WARNING! This action cannot be reverted. Permanently deleting an application will remove it indefinitely from your site. How do I reopen an application? To reopen an application after it has been submitted: Go to Manage Applications Select the application you wish to reopen Click Workflow Click Reopen This will reopen the application and allow the applicant to resubmit. TIP! Use this step if you have moved an application back to the application round to allow for the applicant to edit a task. Once they have completed editing their task they will be able to resubmit their application. If you as an admin would like to modify an application you can refer to How to Edit a Task on Behalf of a User . How do I edit information on behalf of an Applicant? For more information on editing information on behalf of an applicant, you can refer to How to Edit a Task on Behalf of a User . How do I Award/Decline an Application? Award an Application Go to Manage Applications select the application(s) you wish to award --OR-- Go to the Administrator Application View Click Decision Click Award Enter the amount that will be allocated to the application(s) Optional: Select if the applications should move stages immediately Optional: Set whether or not the applicants are required to accept or decline the award . NOTE: You will also be able to set a Decision Deadline for them which will be a soft deadline for when they need to make the decision. Optional: Determine if the decision will be visible to applicants in their application. You can choose to show this at a later date (see below). Set notifications and emails to notify the applicants of the decision. Decline an Application Go to Manage Applications select the application(s) you wish to award --OR-- Go to the Administrator Application View Click Decision Click Decline Optional: Determine if the decision will be visible to applicants in their application. You can choose to show this at a later date (see below). Set notifications and emails to notify the applicants of the decision. How do show/hide an award decision from Applicants? After you have awarded your applications you can choose to Hide or Show the Decision to the applicants in their portal. Go to Manage Applications select the application(s) you wish to award --OR-- Go to the Administrator Application View Click Decision Select whether to Hide or Show the decision How do I hide/show an Applicant's application? Show Applicant's Application through Manage Applications Go to Manage Applications Select the applications that you wish to hide Click More Click Hide from Applicant Show Applicant's Application through the Admin Application View Go to the Admin Application View of the application you wish to hide Click More Click Hide from Applicant Show an Application to an Applicant Through Applications Go to Manage Applications Select the applications that you wish to show. Click More Click Show Applicant Through the Admin Application View Go to the Admin Application View of the application you wish to show Click More Click Show Applicant How do I remove a recommendation from an application? If you wish to clear a recommendation from an application: Go to the Admin Application View of the application Go to the Applications tab Locate the recommendation If the recommender wishes to be completely removed, click on the More Options icon beside the Request, and click Reset Task --OR-- If the recommender wishes to remain as the recommender but wants to you to clear their form, click on More Options beside the form, click Delete Reviewer FAQs How do I make applications anonymous to reviewers? If you wish to make your applicants to your reviewers in the reviewer panel: Go to your Workflow Access the Review Stage Configurations Under the Visibility tab, disable the option for "Personal applicant information". This step will need to be taken for each review stage if applicable. Click to Save the stage. This setting will hide any personal information linked to the account of the applicant (First Name, Last Name, Email). This will have no effect on the name of the application. This will not hide the custom name of the application, if applicable, or any personal information provided within a form. To ensure anonymity, set applications in your program to be identified by the application ID, as opposed to a custom name. For more information, refer to How do I change the way the Applications are titled? under Application FAQs Site and Program FAQs How do I add/change the Logo/Favicon on my site? As described in General Settings: Overview , you can update the logo and favicon image within your site. In order to change one of these images: Go to Settings Click on General Scroll down to the Theme section Click on Browse beside the image you wish to add/change Select and open the image from your computer Click Save How do I change my Site Name? To can edit the name of your site as it appears on your Homepage: Go to Settings Click General Under Site Details, edit the Site Name Field Click Save How do I add a Custom Domain? For detailed information on adding a Custom Domain, see How to Apply a Custom (Vanity) URL . How do I change the Administrative Contact Information? When users have a question, they can click on the information (i) icon within their account to contact the Primary Administrator (also referred to as the Site Owner) To change the Primary Administrator: Go to Settings Click Administrators Click on the More Options icon beside the administrator you wish to make the Primary Admin Click Set as Primary Administrator Note: This change can only be made by the current Primary Administrator. Administrators will need to have accepted their invitation to become Primary Administrator. An administrator with a pending invite can't be set as the Primary Administrator. How do I access Stage Configurations? If you need to make edits to a stage you can do this by entering the Stage Configurations. The configurations will vary depending on the stage type you are trying to edit. However, the steps to access the configurations will be the same. In order to access the stage configurations: Go to your Workflow Click on the Name of the stage --OR-- Hover your cursor over the stage and click on the More Options icon and then click Edit How do I hide a program from applicants? If you are looking to launch your program, but aren't quite ready to show your applicants, or if you have a launched program and don't want to receive any more applications, you can hide your program. To hide a program from the Applicant Portal: Go to the site dashboard Select the More Options icon in the top right corner of the program card Select Hide from applications You will notice a new icon Hidden from Applicants appear in the top right corner of the program card . This indicates that the program is hidden from applicants in the Applicant Portal. I'm approaching or have passed the plan limits, what should I do? Based on your site package, you will have specific plan limits on the site. These limits are soft limits and won't restrict you when managing your site. However, when your site approaches renewal our Customer Success team will set up a conversation to discuss increasing your limits, if necessary. For the Applicant and Reviewer limits, our CSM team will take into consideration Active Users from that subscription period. Therefore if an applicant hasn't created an application during the subscription period, they won't be considered. If you would like to discuss increasing your plan limits, reach out to our customer success team at smapplycsm@surveymonkey.com See below for more in-depth definitions on each limit: Plan Limit Definitions Plan Limit Definition Programs Launched A Program that has activity within the subscription period. Activity is considered applications created or submitted, follow up tasks completed, or reviews completed. Applicants An Applicant associated with (owner of) an application that has activity within the subscription period. Application activity includes creation, editing, or ranking. NOTE: This total is based on the User accounts, and not on the total applications they've created. One user may have three applications, therefore they would be considered once in this total. Reviewers A Reviewer that reviews 1 or more applications within the subscription period. Plan Limit Definition Programs Launched A Program that has activity within the subscription period. Activity is considered applications created or submitted, follow up tasks completed, or reviews completed. Applicants An Applicant associated with (owner of) an application that has activity within the subscription period. Application activity includes creation, editing, or ranking. NOTE: This total is based on the User accounts, and not on the total applications they've created. One user may have three applications, therefore they would be considered once in this total. Reviewers A Reviewer that reviews 1 or more applications within the subscription period. Title: Setting a Cutoff Date & Time
Text: Setting a Cutoff Date & Time | SurveyMonkey Help Log in SurveyMonkey In this article Response Limits Help Sending Surveys Collector & Response Options Setting a Cutoff Date & Time SurveyMonkey Setting a Cutoff Date & Time Response Limits You can edit the collector options to automatically close a collector (stop collecting responses) at a certain date and time. If you have multiple collectors, you need to set a Cutoff Date and Time for each one separately. To set a Cutoff Date and Time: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Click the name of the collector and access the collector options . You may need to click Show advanced options . Turn on Cutoff Date and Time . Choose a date and time in the future. Click Edit "survey closed" message . Once the date and time has passed, anyone who tries to access the survey will see this closed message . TIP! Collectors are ways to send your survey. Each collector type works a little differently, so they all have different sets of options to choose from when you set them up. If you don't see this particular option in the collector type you're using, review the info on this page, and be sure to check out the help article about that collector type . Response Limits If you're using both Response Limits and a Cutoff Date and Time, whichever comes first will close the collector. Title: How to Lock/Unlock Applications
Text: How to Lock/Unlock Applications | Apply Help Log in Apply In this article What Does Locking/Unlocking Applications Do? Manually Locking/Unlocking Applications Help Monitor Manage Applications How to Lock/Unlock Applications Apply How to Lock/Unlock Applications What Does Locking/Unlocking Applications Do? Manually Locking/Unlocking Applications While your application is launched and you are accepting applications, it may be necessary to lock an application to prevent a user from continuing to work on tasks. This article covers how to lock and unlock applications within your site. What Does Locking/Unlocking Applications Do? The ability to lock and unlock applications allows administrators to stop applicants from continuing with their application until further notice. An application lock can be applied to or removed from applications individually, in batches, or through the use of automations. Locked applications can only be unlocked by an automation or administrator. Some general use cases follow: Case 1 - Resolve a Workflow Issue After a program has been launched your applicants may bring issues to your attention that were not caught during testing. By manually locking all active applications temporarily you can halt further progress until the program workflow issues have been resolved. Case 2 - Verify an Application While monitoring applications you may find that an applicant has answered eligibility questions correctly, but are not truly eligible to apply based on responses collected within their application. By locking the application it will give the administrator a chance to reach out to the applicant and verify their information and eligibility before allowing them to progress in the application process. Case 3 - Lock Applications Based on Form Responses In some cases, the eligibility quiz may not be the most logical place for eligibility type questions. Using automations, applications can be locked based on specific responses given within a form. Manually Locking/Unlocking Applications Lock Applications To manually lock application(s): Go to Manage Applications . Select the application(s) to lock from further editing. Select More . Select Lock . Unlock Applications To manually unlock application(s): Go to Manage Applications . Select the application(s) to unlock and allow editing again. Select More . Select Unlock . Using Automations to Lock/Unlock Applications Applications are commonly locked based on a response given within a form task. Instead of monitoring answers to these questions and manually locking applications that have given a particular response, you can use an automation to perform that action for you. Locking an Application Based on a Form Response Unlock an Application when moved to a New Stage Locking an Application Based on a Form Response Example: An application form contains a question asking how many years the student has been in College/ University, in order to proceed the applicant will need to response one year and above. WHEN TO APPLY Source Event Target Application Task A Task has been Edited after Completion Application Form CONDITIONS Match ALL conditions Application Form How many years have you completed in College/ University? is exactly Under one year DO Action Source Action Application Lock the Application Unlock an Application when moved to a New Stage Example: This example shows how to unlock the application when it is moved to a new stage. In this example, select applications are manually locked by an administrator while they verify the application material. If changes need to be made the administrator will move the application to a new application stage titled Applicant Follow-Up and the automation would perform the unlock action automatically. WHEN TO APPLY Source Event Target Application Application has changed state Applicant Follow-Up CONDITIONS Not required for this scenario DO Action Source Action Application Unlock the application Related Articles July 2025 August 2025 June 2025 English Company SurveyMonkey About Us Jobs Blog Help SurveyMonkey Help GetFeedback Help Market Research Help SurveyMonkey Audience Help SurveyMonkey Contribute Help Wufoo Help Apply Help Support Site Status Unsubscribe Contact Us Email Opt-In Policies Legal Center Privacy Policy Cookies Notice California Privacy Notice Copyright © 1999-2025 SurveyMonkey BBB credentials logo TrustedSite logo

Title: Custom Roles
Text: Custom Roles | SurveyMonkey Help Log in SurveyMonkey In this article Roles Permissions Managing Roles and Permissions Assigning roles Filtering by role Help Teams & Enterprise Enterprise Features Custom Roles SurveyMonkey Custom Roles Roles Permissions Managing Roles and Permissions Assigning roles Filtering by role ENTERPRISE FEATURE : If you're interested, contact sales . If you already have an Enterprise account, contact your Customer Success Manager (CSM). The seat and role on a team controls what account permissions you have and how you work together with your team. Admins can create custom roles that will give team members a more customized experience and will cater to specific types of seats on your Team. Custom roles can be used to provide more Admin support, give Users access to certain features or to limit permissions on the team. Roles and Permissions Roles Here's a basic overview of the default roles that can be assigned to seats on your Team. Role Description Primary Admin The Primary Admin is in charge of billing, and role assignments. There is only 1 Primary Admin per team. Admin Admins get most of the same permissions as the Primary Admin, including the ability to manage divisions, libraries, and roles. User Users can create and share surveys using all the Enterprise features and tools. They can be assigned to one division and can create and share surveys using the assets in their library. They don't have permission to manage the team or divisions. The Primary Admin role can't be assigned to others on the team, if you need to change your Primary Admin, see Manage Seats on your Enterprise Team . Permissions The Primary Admin can pick and choose permissions from the areas below to create a custom role. Each area will have several permissions or administrative functions that can be selected, and the created custom role may have a variety of permissions spread across all areas. Admin Role When selecting Admin to start your custom role from, you can see both general and, team and account management permissions to assign. Team and Account Management Permissions Manage users Invite people to join the team and manage existing seats from the My Team section. Team-wide setting Set default options and permissions for the entire Enterprise team. Manage Team Credits (Audience) Purchase and transfer credits from the Manage Credits tab in Enterprise Settings . Team Surveys View and manage all surveys on the team Team Library Manage library shared assets including images, documents, templates, themes, and questions. Division Management * Manage divisions for different departments, offices, clients, cost centers, or any other groups you want to manage separately or give unique branding assets. Advanced access and permissions View and export team activity log. Delete responses in any account. Remove offline devices . * Only available for Enterprise plans that have Divisions as an add-on User Role If you select User to start from, you can only see and choose from general permissions. General Permissions Survey design Manage user access to create and edit surveys. Collect responses Select the collector types available for this user. Analyze results Manage user access to view, analyze and share data. Managing Roles and Permissions The Primary Admin will be able to create new roles and assign them to seats on the team. Once an Admin custom role is set up to allow management of roles and permissions, they will also be able to create and assign roles. Creating a New Role You can create as many custom roles as you need with a range of permissions. Go to My Team Click Settings Select Roles and permissions Click + Create role Choose a role to start from: Admin User Enter the Role name and Description (optional) Click Create Duplicating a role If there is a Custom Role that you have already customized and want to build from, you can duplicate it. All options configured in the permissions areas will carry over to the copied version. Once duplicated, you can then edit the name and permissions. From the Roles and permissions page, find the role you want to duplicate and click the 3 dots ( ... ) Choose Duplicate Edit the Role name , Description , and permissions . Click Save . Editing a Custom Role Once a custom role has been created, you are able to change the role and its permissions. All changes will automatically be updated to those within that custom role. Find the role you want to change and click the 3 dots ( ... ) Choose Edit permissions . Review the Role name , Description , and permissions and make changes. Click Save . TIP! Default roles can only be viewed or duplicated . Deleting a Custom Role To better manage your custom roles, you can delete them when they aren't needed anymore. Deleting a custom role is permanent, it can't be restored. From the Roles and permissions page , find the role you want to remove and click the 3 dots ( ... ) Choose Delete. When you are sure you want to proceed, select Delete role . When you delete a custom role, any users with that custom role will be reassigned to the starter default role. Assigning Roles Now that custom roles are set up, you can start allocating seats on your teams to those roles. There are two ways in which you can assign a role, by selecting each seat individually or by CSV imports for multiples team members at a time. Individually Assigning a Custom Role Go to My Team . Click Manage Users Select the user Click on Change next to role Choose a new user role from the dropdown. Click Save . Assigning Multiple Custom Roles To adjust multiple roles and seats at once, follow the guidance for Importing Users by CSV . For the Role column, find the right role in the list below. Then, in your CSV file, use the CSV term listed: Role CSV Term Custom Admin name admin Custom Power User name regular Filtering by role Admins can filter the team to easily see who on the team has default and custom roles. Go to My Team . Click Manage Users . Under Filters, select the Roles dropdown. Select Role Click Apply filters When a filter is applied, the default roles are first listed at the top, followed by custom roles. Title: Changing the SurveyMonkey Footer
Text: Changing the SurveyMonkey Footer | SurveyMonkey Help Log in SurveyMonkey In this article Making the Footer Grey Hiding the Footer Use the Default SurveyMonkey Footer Help Creating Surveys Themes & Format Options Changing the SurveyMonkey Footer SurveyMonkey Changing the SurveyMonkey Footer Making the Footer Grey Hiding the Footer Use the Default SurveyMonkey Footer The "Powered by SurveyMonkey" footer appears by default at the bottom of your survey design, email invitation messages, and embedded surveys. Depending on your SurveyMonkey plan, you can make the footer grey to blend in with your survey, or hide the footer completely. Making the Footer Grey Greyscale Footer Paid feature Log in to see if this feature is included in your plan. Log in Sign up free You can make the SurveyMonkey branding at the bottom of your survey grey, so it blends in with your survey theme. To make the footer grey: Go to the Design Survey section of your survey. Click Style . In the Settings tab, click Footer . Select Subtle . Hiding the Footer Hide Branding (Survey Footer) Paid feature Log in to see if this feature is included in your plan. Log in Sign up free To hide the footer, you need to turn it off in each of your surveys, messages, or embedded surveys individually. There isn't a universal account setting that can turn the footer off in all places or for all surveys. Survey Design You can hide the SurveyMonkey branding from the bottom of your survey design. To hide the SurveyMonkey footer: Go to the Design Survey section of your survey. Click Style . In the Settings tab, click Footer . Select None to hide the footer. TIP! To add your own footer to the bottom of each survey page, add additional text into your survey at the end of each page. You can add extra spacing to the top of the text so it appears lower down the page. Email Invitations Hide Branding (Email Invitation) Paid feature Log in to see if this feature is included in your plan. Log in Sign up free You can hide the SurveyMonkey branding or remove the [FooterLink] from the footer of your email invitations . To hide the SurveyMonkey footer: When composing your message, click Edit in the upper-right corner of the message preview. At the bottom of the message, check the box to Hide SurveyMonkey branding . Click Save . Embedded Surveys If you're using a Website Collector to embed your survey on your website, you can hide the SurveyMonkey branding that appears in the bottom border of the survey widget. To hide the SurveyMonkey footer: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Click the name of your Website Collector. Click Back until you get to Step 1 of 3: Design Theme . Toggle Hide SurveyMonkey Branding on. Click Review Options . Your changes save automatically and you don't need to re-install the code. Shared Data Pages You can hide the SurveyMonkey branding from your shared data page . Use the Default SurveyMonkey Footer If you want to use the default footer, or need to add the default footer back to your survey to send it, these steps will help. To use the default SurveyMonkey footer: Go to the Design Survey section of your survey. In the left sidebar, click Style . Click Footer . Select Default to add the footer back to your survey. TIP! If your plan doesn't include the ability to to change the footer, you'll need to use the default footer to be able to send your survey. Learn more about what happens when you change plans . Related Articles Scoring Your Survey Measure Customer Satisfaction (CSAT) with SurveyMonkey Accepting Payments with PayPal English Company SurveyMonkey About Us Jobs Blog Help SurveyMonkey Help GetFeedback Help Market Research Help SurveyMonkey Audience Help SurveyMonkey Contribute Help Wufoo Help Apply Help Support Site Status Unsubscribe Contact Us Email Opt-In Policies Legal Center Privacy Policy Cookies Notice California Privacy Notice Copyright © 1999-2025 SurveyMonkey BBB credentials logo TrustedSite logo

Title: Question & Page Randomization
Text: Question & Page Randomization | SurveyMonkey Help Log in SurveyMonkey In this article Video Overview Question Randomization Page Randomization Help Creating Surveys Applying Logic Question & Page Randomization SurveyMonkey Question & Page Randomization Video Overview Question Randomization Page Randomization Using randomization can help reduce order bias and improve the quality of your data. One way to do that in SurveyMonkey is by using Question or Page Randomization to change the order in which people taking your survey see the questions. Video Overview Question Randomization Question Randomization lets you change the order of any questions on a page in your survey. You can apply it to a specific set of questions, or all questions on the page. Adding Question Randomization To turn on Question Randomization: Go to the Design Survey section. Click Logic . Click Question Randomization . From the Select Page menu to choose the correct survey page and click Next . For Format , Choose from the following options: Randomize questions: questions will appear in a random order for each person taking your survey. Flip questions: on average, half of the people taking your survey will see the question order flipped. For example, 3, 2, 1 or of 1, 2, 3. For Questions Affected , apply to All questions on page or only Selected questions . Click Apply to save. (Optional) Repeat the steps to apply Question Randomization to other survey pages. TIP! Use answer randomization to flip, sort, or randomize choices for an individual question. Removing Question Randomization To turn off Question Randomization: Go to the Design Survey section. Click Logic . Click Question Randomization . From the Select Page menu, choose the page you added randomization to. For Format , select No Randomization . Click Apply to save. (Optional) Repeat the steps to remove Question Randomization from other survey pages. If you have Skip Logic or Question & Answer Piping applied to your survey, using Question Randomization may lead to unexpected behavior. Page Randomization Page Randomization lets you rotate, flip, or randomize pages in your survey—all pages or a specific set of pages. Adding Page Randomization: To turn on Page Randomization: Go to the Design Survey section. Click Logic . Click Page Randomization . For Format choose from the following options: Randomize pages : pages will appear in a random order for each new person taking your survey. Flip pages : on average, half of the people taking your survey will see the page order flipped. For example, 3, 2, 1 or 1, 2, 3. Rotate pages : the page order depends on what the previous person saw—the first page they saw is the last page the next person will see. For example,1, 2, 3, 4, 5, then 2, 3, 4, 5, 1, then 3, 4, 5, 1, 2. For Pages Affected apply randomization to All pages in the survey or Selected pages . Click Apply . TIP! Block Randomization let's you randomize pages by group. Removing Page Randomization To turn off Page Randomization: Go to the Design Survey section. Click Logic . Click Page Randomization . For Format select No randomization . Click Apply to save. If you have Skip Logic or Question & Answer Piping applied to your survey, using Page Randomization may lead to unexpected behavior. Title: Choosing a Merchant for Your Payment Form
Text: Choosing a Merchant for Your Payment Form | Wufoo Help Log in Wufoo In this article Explore Your Options Supported Currencies Choosing Between PayPal Merchants Checks Help Integrations Payment Integrations Choosing a Merchant for Your Payment Form Wufoo Choosing a Merchant for Your Payment Form Explore Your Options Supported Currencies Choosing Between PayPal Merchants Checks There's lots to consider when choosing the merchant that's right for you. Once you choose the merchant you want, see Collecting Payments for instructions on enabling payments on your form. Explore Your Options Use the table below to explore the merchant side, and the Wufoo side, of every payment integration we offer. Use the Merchant Website column to explore the pricing and features of the merchants you're interested in using. Use the Wufoo Documentation column to get a better understanding of how to set up the integration, and what the form experience will look when people fill out your payment form. Integration Merchant Website Wufoo Documentation Stripe Stripe » Stripe Integration Square Square » Square Integration Stripe Subscription Billing Stripe Subscription Billing » Stripe Subscription Billing Integration Braintree Braintree » Braintree Integration PayPal Payments Standard PayPal Payments Standard » PayPal Standard Integration PayPal Payflow Pro PayPal Payflow Pro » PayPal Payflow Pro Integration Authorize.net Authorize.net » Authorize.net Integration USA ePay USA ePay » USA ePay Integration TIP! Read our blog post on How to Choose a Payment Processor for more tips on choosing the merchant that works best for you. Supported Currencies Use the table below to compare the currencies supported by each merchant. Supported Currencies per Merchant Currency Authorize.net Braintree Freshbooks PayPal Payflow Pro PayPal Standard PayPal Website Payments Pro Stripe Square USA ePay US Dollar ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ Euro ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ Pounds Sterling ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ Australian Dollar ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ Brazilian Real ✅ ✅ ✅ Canadian Dollar ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ Czech Koruny ✅ ✅ ✅ Danish Kroner ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ Hong Kong Dollar ✅ ✅ ✅ Hungarian Forint ✅ ✅ ✅ Israeli New Shequel ✅ ✅ ✅ Japanese Yen ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ Malaysian Ringgit ✅ ✅ ✅ Mexican Peso ✅ ✅ ✅ New Zealand Dollar ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ Norwegian Kroner ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ Philippine Peso ✅ ✅ ✅ Polish Zloty ✅ ✅ ✅ Singapore Dollar ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ South African Rand ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ Swedish Kroner ✅ ✅ ✅ ✅ Swiss Franc ✅ ✅ ✅ Taiwan New Dollar ✅ ✅ Thai Beht ✅ ✅ ✅ Choosing Between PayPal Merchants Wufoo integrates with 3 different PayPal solutions: PayPal Standard - If you're looking for a more basic payment solution, we recommend PayPal Standard, which you can set up in minutes. PayPal Website Payments Pro - If you're located in the United States, Canada, or Great Britain, with large volumes of monthly payments, and you want people to pay on your website, we recommend PayPal Website Payments Pro. Do keep in mind that this requires that you have a Premier or Business PayPal account, and the application can take a couple of days to process. PayPal Payflow Pro - If your company is not American, Canadian, or British, or if you would like to use your own merchant account, we recommend taking a look at our PayPal Payflow Pro integration, which offers seamless integration and a comparable feature set to Website Payments Pro. Compare PayPal Payments Standard and PayPal Website Payments Pro » Checks While Authorize.net is the only Payment Merchant that allows people to pay by eCheck, you can set up your form to make it easy for people to send you paper checks in the mail by using Page Rules. Title: Viewing Entries in the Entry Manager
Text: Viewing Entries in the Entry Manager | Wufoo Help Log in Wufoo In this article Using the Entry Manager Searching and Filtering Entries Trouble Viewing Entries Help Entries and Reports Viewing Entries in the Entry Manager Wufoo Viewing Entries in the Entry Manager Using the Entry Manager Searching and Filtering Entries Trouble Viewing Entries The Entry Manager gives you a quick overview of all entries submitted to your form. You can view all entries in the datagrid directly, search entries by keyword, or filter entries by field or keyword. TIP! Set up notifications to get an alert each time someone fills out your form. Using the Entry Manager To browse the Entry Manager: Log in and go to Forms . Select the Entries icon. At the bottom of the page, click any entry in the datagrid to view it. Use the arrows to navigate between pages of entries. Managing the Datagrid The datagrid shows the individual entries collected for your form in a table. To sort entries by specific fields, click the column header. You can display additional fields by clicking the + symbol in the upper righthand corner of the datagrid. If you want to display more entries per page, create a report with a datagrid widget. Searching and Filtering Entries There are two ways to search entries: To do a simple search of all fields, type a keyword in the search bar and press enter on your keyboard. To do an advanced search to filter results, click the magnifying glass icon in the search bar, then create a search condition to target specific entries by keyword. Filtering Entries To filter within the Entry Manager: Select +Filter at the top of the datagrid. Select the Field or Entry Info you want to filter by. Select a condition. Enter the detail you want to filter for. Select Apply . You can filter by multiple fields and entries by clicking the + icon below the filter menu. By default, this links your filters with And logic. If you want to to use Or logic instead, click And to change it. To edit or delete your filter, click the three dots icon next to My Filter at the top of the datagrid. Filters are saved using your browser's storage. If you clear your cookies or login on a different browser, you'll need to recreate the filter. Trouble Viewing Entries A date filter might be applied that’s only showing you today’s entries. Uncheck the Today’s Entries box at the top of the data grid. If you’re in the new experience, you’ll need to click the tab that says All . If you’re still having trouble, please contact us . Title: Getting Feedback on Surveys and Results
Text: Getting Feedback on Surveys and Results | SurveyMonkey Help Log in SurveyMonkey In this article Getting Feedback on Your Survey Preview Getting Feedback on Your Survey Results Posting Comments Viewing and Managing Comments Commenting Actions and Descriptions Comment Notifications Video Overview Help Analyzing Results Getting Feedback on Surveys and Results SurveyMonkey Getting Feedback on Surveys and Results Getting Feedback on Your Survey Preview Getting Feedback on Your Survey Results Posting Comments Viewing and Managing Comments Commenting Actions and Descriptions Comment Notifications Video Overview You can invite others to give feedback on your survey design by opening a review session (Teams only), sharing your survey preview link or sending an invite to comment. Once you collect survey responses, you can use a shared data page to invite others to give feedback on your survey results. Getting Feedback on your Survey Preview Sharing Your Survey Preview You can share your survey preview by copying the preview link or sending an email invitation asking for feedback. Anyone can test your survey and those signed into a SurveyMonkey account may be able to post comments. Only the survey owner can invite people to the preview by email and turn commenting on or off to gather feedback. To share your survey preview: Go to the Design Survey section. Select Add Collaborators . There are a couple of ways to share the preview with others: By email: Enter email addresses, and select SEND . In a link: Copy and paste the preview link by selecting COPY . You can also copy and share the URL from the address bar. If you’re on an Enterprise plan, you can tag teammates in comments by @mentions or share surveys with others and give them permission to collaborate on the survey’s design. Starting a Review Session TEAM PLANS : This feature is currently only available for Team plans. Visit our Plans and Pricing page to upgrade. You can share your survey preview by starting a review session and copying the preview link. Anyone, with or without an account, can test your survey and post a comment. Only the survey owner can invite people to a review session and turn commenting on or off to gather feedback. To share your review session: Go to the Design Survey section. Click the Share icon in the upper-right corner to open a review session page. Switch the toggle on to start a review session: The review session ends in 10 days from when you started it. You can Restart the session back to 10 days, once the counter is down to 9 days or less. Toggle off t o close a review session. The share link will no longer be active. A new link is generated if you open a new review session. Click Copy Share out the review session link for feedback and comments. You can also tag teammates in comments by @mentions . When you share a review session link with someone with a SurveyMonkey account, the survey is shared with them. People With Access TIP! Reach out to the survey owner to extend your review session access. When you open a review session, you can share out the link to anyone—even those who don't own a SurveyMonkey account (Guests). The level of survey access someone has depends on whether you're both on the same team, or if you, or they have their own account. Who Access permissions Is the survey shared? Guest Comment only No Logged in Comment only ✅ Team member Comment only* ✅ *Team users are able to change survey access permissions for others on your team. Guests will be asked for their name when opening the review session link. Everyone with access to the review session can see comments made, and are able to reply to them. Getting Feedback on Your Survey Results Once you have survey responses, you can create a dashboard or shared data page so others can view your data and give feedback on survey results. When commenting is turned on, reviewers can post comments on the results of each survey question. Only the survey owner can invite people to the shared data page by email and turn commenting on or off to gather feedback. To create and share a dashboard, read our article about Results Dashboards . To invite people to your shared data page: Go to the Analyze Results section of your survey and create a shared data page . On the shared data page, copy and share the link at the bottom of the page or click the Invite icon in the upper-right corner to share by email—click Invite in the dropdown, enter email addresses, and click Send . Return to the Invite dropdown and select the toggle to turn commenting on or off. If you're on a team plan, you can share surveys with others and give them permission to create their own shared data page and export results. When you select Invite in the dropdown, commenting automatically turns on. If you don't want people to comment, click the invite dropdown and turn commenting off after sharing your survey results. Posting Comments You need a SurveyMonkey account to post comments on a survey preview , results dashboard , or shared data page . If you don’t have one already, you can sign up for free. [Teams only] Anyone, with or without a SurveyMonkey account, can post a comment in a review session. To post a comment: Open the survey preview, dashboard, or shared data page. In the upper-right corner, click the Comment icon to display these icons next to each question. Click the Comment icon next to any question to open the commenting sidebar. Click + COMMENT to add a new comment. Click Post to save. Anyone can reply to comments on the survey preview or shared data page, as long as commenting is on. Survey takers won’t see comments when they’re taking the live survey. TIP! Collaborate on your survey design by tagging teammates directly in comments. Viewing and Managing Comments Viewing Comments Anyone can view your survey preview or the shared data page. However, viewers need to sign in to a SurveyMonkey account to view comments on a survey preview or shared data page. [Teams only] Everyone with access to the review session can see comments made, and are able to reply to them. Click the Comment icon next to any question to display comments for that question. TIP! If you aren't the survey owner, you may need to take the survey preview to see comments to questions that aren’t on the first page. Managing Comments Anyone can reply to comments, or edit and delete their own comments from the survey preview or shared data page. Only survey owners can delete, resolve, or unresolve other people's comments—expand a section to learn more about managing comments. Expand | Collapse Design Survey section To manage comments: Go to the Design Survey section. Hover over the Comment icon next to a question and click a Comment button to open the comments sidebar. Add a comment, Reply, Edit, Delete, Resolve, or Unresolve comments. TIP! Use the question dropdown at the top of the comments sidebar to navigate to other questions with comments. Survey preview To manage comments: Go to the Preview & Score section. Click the Comments icon in the upper-right corner to open the preview in a new window. Click on the Comment icon next to a question to open the comments sidebar. Add a comment, Reply, Edit, Delete, Resolve, or Unresolve comments. TIP! We recommend managing your comments in the Design Survey section where you can edit your survey as you review your comments. Shared data page To manage comments: Go to the Analyze Results section. Open your shared data page. Click on the Comment icon next to a question to open the comments sidebar. Add a comment, Reply, Edit, Delete, Resolve, or Unresolve comments. Commenting Actions and Descriptions Action Description + Comment Anyone can add a comment to a survey preview. Anyone logged into a SurveyMonkey account can add a comment on survey results. Edit Anyone can change and resave their own comments. Delete Anyone can delete their own comments. Survey owners can delete any comment. It isn't possible to delete a comment that's marked Resolved. To delete it, click Resolved to unresolve it first. Resolved Survey owners can click Unresolved to change the comment’s status to Resolved. This status can help survey owners to keep track of which comments have already been reviewed and acted on. Unresolved Survey owners can click Resolved to change the comment’s status to Unresolved. Tag others [ Teams only] Team members can type @ and select a user on their team for commenting on Survey designs. Survey owners can then share their survey with those tagged members. Comment Notifications Survey Owners You'll get an email notification for each new comment or reply to a comment on your survey or your shared data page. Commenters You’ll receive an email notification when you’re invited to comment via email, or tagged by @mentions if you’re on a team plan. After you post a comment, you’ll get an email when people reply to comments you've left or if your comment is resolved by the survey owner. TIP! Check out the Notification Center to see collaboration messages from the last 30 days. Title: Release Notes – March 2025
Text: Release Notes – March 2025 | SurveyMonkey Help Log in SurveyMonkey Help What's new Release Notes Release Notes – March 2025 SurveyMonkey Release Notes – March 2025 Release Notes - March 2025 User experience enhancements When logged in, easily sort surveys , in either ascending or descending order, by title, modified date or response count on your homepage. You can also sort within a folder, search results or after applying a filter. Choose between column and grid layouts for your dashboards using the Layout option under Dashboards and Crosstabs. Integrations Connect your survey data to Slack, Microsoft Teams, or Excel online. Find these new apps in the Connect Apps tab. Available to all English customers. Not available to EU data center customers. Enterprise administration features View ‘SSO status’ and ‘Join date’ of users in the User Report page. Go to your survey dashboard Create roles with custom permissions and assign them to end users.
