Title: How to Manage your Salesforce Integration
Text: How to Manage your Salesforce Integration | Apply Help Log in Apply In this article How to Rename your Salesforce Integration How to Manually Sync with Salesforce Single Program Sites Multi-Program Sites How to Refresh your Salesforce Schema How to Delete your Salesforce Integration How to Enable Email Notifications for Errors Help Advanced Features How to Manage your Salesforce Integration Apply How to Manage your Salesforce Integration How to Rename your Salesforce Integration How to Manually Sync with Salesforce Single Program Sites Multi-Program Sites How to Refresh your Salesforce Schema How to Delete your Salesforce Integration How to Enable Email Notifications for Errors How to Rename your Salesforce Integration You may need to rename your Salesforce integrations to help differentiate between them. To rename your Salesforce integration: Access the Salesforce Integration section of the site Click the name of your Salesforce integration. On the integration page, click on the More Options icon at the top of the Integration. Click Rename The Salesforce Settings dialogue will open. Enter in a new name in the text response field. Click Rename How to Manually Sync with Salesforce Single Program Sites To manually sync with salesforce if you only have one program in your site: Access the Salesforce Integration section of the site Click the name of your Salesforce integration. On the integration page, click on the More Options icon at the top of the Integration. Click Sync with Salesforce Manual Syncs will update existing records in SF - this is helpful for retroactive fixes/updating information such as Reviewer scores. There are no limits on the number of manual syncs you can do. However, keep in mind the API calls that could be made with this. Deactivate all actions you do not want to run when doing a manual sync to help limit the API calls as much as possible. Multi-Program Sites WARNING! We do not recommend to use manual syncs when you have multiple programs, as a manual sync is not program specific. All actions will sync for all applications. The below information is applicable if you only have one program within your SM Apply site. Sometimes the Salesforce integration isn’t added to the Apply site until after some Apply records/data have already been created. If this is the case, you can perform a manual sync that will apply all active Salesforce actions to all the existing objects in the system. This includes automations that are active. For example, if you have Salesforce actions that will map an Application owner’s name to a Salesforce Lead name, any existing applications will sync to new Lead objects in Salesforce. To specifically run a manual sync on an unsuccessful action: Access the Salesforce Integration section of the site Click the name of your Salesforce integration. Click View Logs Locate the action in the logs Click Rerun How to Refresh your Salesforce Schema During the integration set up, we pull in all the Salesforce objects and fields in your account. These objects/fields are then available when you set up your Salesforce integration actions. After the initial setup, our integration syncs once a day. So when a new field/object added to Salesforce outside the sync time, you’ll have to do a sync to see it. We call this “refreshing your Salesforce schema”. To refresh your Salesforce schema: Access the Salesforce Integration section of the site. Click the name of your Salesforce integration. On the integration page, click on the More Options icon at the top of the Integration. Click Refresh schema In the Salesforce Settings dialogue, press the Refresh Schema button Once the refresh is complete, the new fields and objects will be available How to Delete your Salesforce Integration WARNING! Deleting the Salesforce integration will remove the connection from your SurveyMonkey Apply site. The action logs for the integration will erase. Any automation actions pointing to the integration will no longer sync with Salesforce. To delete your Salesforce integration: Access the Salesforce Integration section of the site Click the name of your Salesforce integration. On the integration page, click on the More Options icon at the top of the Integration. Click the Delete button. Click Save How to Enable Email Notifications for Errors When enabled, SM Apply sends a daily digest of sync errors that happened in the past 24 hours. If no errors have occurred, no email will send. The email will send daily around 7AM EST to the Salesforce account user, and include a link to the action log. To enable or disable daily error notifications: Access the Salesforce Integration section of the site Click the name of your Salesforce integration. On the integration page, click on the More Options icon at the top of the Integration. Click Email Notifications Click Add Recipient Enter the email address of the recipient that should receive the notification. NOTE: If you wish to add multiple recipients, click Add Recipient for each. When you have added all recipients, click Save Related Articles July 2025 August 2025 June 2025 English Company SurveyMonkey About Us Jobs Blog Help SurveyMonkey Help GetFeedback Help Market Research Help SurveyMonkey Audience Help SurveyMonkey Contribute Help Wufoo Help Apply Help Support Site Status Unsubscribe Contact Us Email Opt-In Policies Legal Center Privacy Policy Cookies Notice California Privacy Notice Copyright © 1999-2025 SurveyMonkey BBB credentials logo TrustedSite logo

Title: SurveyMonkey Apply Data & Privacy
Text: SurveyMonkey Apply Data & Privacy | Apply Help Log in Apply Help FAQs and Troubleshooting Troubleshooting Guides SurveyMonkey Apply Data & Privacy Apply SurveyMonkey Apply Data & Privacy Overview SurveyMonkey takes the privacy and security of your data very seriously. As part of our ongoing commitment to ensuring your information is secure within SurveyMonkey Apply, we have updated our policies and capabilities to meet the requirements of applicable privacy regulations the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) . Depending on your location, as a SurveyMonkey Apply site administrator, you may be required to respond to requests from data subjects who ask to exercise their privacy rights. Organizations using our services the controller/business owner of the data they collect through their site and have the ability to access , modify, and delete data on behalf of their users when requested. For more information, see Administrator Responsibilities . SurveyMonkey Apply also collects information on users as part of daily business activities - for instance, when we receive a support request, sign a contract, or send newsletters and other marketing information. We are the controller/business owner of this data and any requests that are made we will handle and fulfill. Data Rights & Roles Data Rights Depending on your location and/or the location of your users, your users may be entitled to exercise the following rights: Term Definition Right of Access Find out what kind of personal information is held about you and receive a copy of this information. Right of Rectification Ask for your information to be updated or corrected. Right to Data Portability Receive a copy of the information which you have provided under contract so that you can provide that information to another organization. Right to Restrict Use Ask for your personal information to stop being used in certain cases, including if you believe that the personal information about you is incorrect or the use is unlawful. Right to Object Objecting to use of your information (where a party is processing it on a legitimate interest basis) and to have your personal information deleted. Right to Erasure/Deletion In certain circumstances, you may request to have your personal information deleted. Data Roles Organizations using our services may be data controllers under GDPR or businesses under CCPA for the data they collect, while SurveyMonkey, as a service provider just processes that data for you. SurveyMonkey controls/is the business owner of very limited data about users—we may use personal data like cookie data and IP address for specific purposes as described in our Privacy Policy. For individuals like applicants, reviewers, recommenders, and site visitors , SurveyMonkey is the data controller/business owner of personal data like name, email address, and digital identifiers like a cookie data or IP address, among other things. We describe in detail the data we collect and how we use it in our Privacy Policy . For further information on identifying your data controller see our Privacy Policy under the section “Who is my data controller”?. Administrator Responsibilities Site administrators are responsible for the data they collect through their site and have the ability to access, modify, and delete data on behalf of their users when requested. Depending on your location and the location of your users, you may receive and need to fulfill the requests below. Below are ways that site administrators can fulfill these types of requests made by their users: 1. "Right of Access" requests Site users have the ability to request to see all the information available on them within the site. Users may contact the administrator directly or may submit a request through SurveyMonkey Apply’s form . In either scenario, Site administrators can export a user’s data from the User Profile: Go to the User Profile Click on Data Access Export This file will contain all information submitted by the user on the site in JSON format. We would recommend that after providing the JSON file for the user, the administrator delete the file from their records. This will only contain personal information that has been submitted directly to SurveyMonkey Apply by the user. Any additional information stored on systems outside of SurveyMonkey Apply will need to be sent to the user as well. NOTE: When a request is submitted through SurveyMonkey Apply, SurveyMonkey Apply will review our records for any data we are the controller of and send this separately to the subject within 30 days. 2. "Right of Rectification" requests Administrators have full control over the information they collect from their administrator portal (for example user data, applications, reviews, recommendations.) and can modify the information on behalf of the user who requested the change. Edit Tasks and Form Responses on Behalf of Users Edit Account Information on Behalf of Users 3. "Right to Data Portability" requests As discussed in "Right of Access" , when requested, administrators can provide users with a JSON file of all collected data within the site so the user can provide the data to another data controller. 4. "Right to Restrict Use" requests Users may not want their data to be deleted but can object to anything being used in the processing of their data (for example they believe something to be inaccurate). Administrators may be contacted to prevent their data from being used for decision making. Data Subject Potential methods for Data Controllers to Restrict use Applicants Unassign applications from the reviewer(s) Hide application from an applicant Send application to the trash Move to a holding stage Reviewers Unassign them from applications Delete their reviews Hide the contents of their reviews from applicants and/or other reviewers Recommenders Delete their recommendation Hide the contents of their recommendation from applicants and/or reviewers 5. "Right to Object" requests This will vary depending on the nature of the objection and the information that is being objected to. Administrators have full control over the information stored on their sites and will have the ability to make modifications or delete data to address the request. 6. "Right to Erasure" / Data Deletion requests Users may contact a site administrator directly to ask to be deleted from their site. Administrators can find the user through the Manage Users area of the administrator portal and can remove the user from their site which will permanently delete any information associated with that user on that site. Please see, How to Delete a User from a Site . This will remove the user from the specific site. What SurveyMonkey Apply will do: When such a request is made, SurveyMonkey Apply will automatically redact any identifiable information from the user after 14 days . The User will appear on the site as a "Removed User." An email notification will be sent to the organization of the site as the data controller and to SurveyMonkey Apply to review and delete any additional information stored on the user outside of the SurveyMonkey Apply Platform. What a Site Administrator should do: Review the site and ensure that if any additional data not provided by the user was added and contains personal data, for example, data entered by co-applicants/administrators, metadata fields, reviewer comments that you capture this in the request - SurveyMonkey Apply is not responsible for this. NOTE: If you wish for us to suspend deletion while you communicate with this user regarding their request, please contact our support team within 14 days of the date of the request and you can then take over communications with this user directly. If you do not contact our support team within 14 days we will initiate the deletion process and this user’s data will be deleted thereafter. WARNING! Once SurveyMonkey Apply begins the process of deleting a user’s account, this cannot be undone. What happens in SurveyMonkey Apply when an Erasure /Data Deletion request is fulfilled: Data Subjects What Happens Applicants All data provided by the applicant will be redacted All uploaded files will be deleted All review and recommendation data will be redacted NOTE: Review scores generated from the reviews will remain Reviewers All qualitative reviews and responses will be redacted from the system NOTE: Scores generated from the reviews will remainAll uploaded files will be deleted Recommenders All recommendations provided will be redacted from the systemAll uploaded files will be deleted Administrators as Data Subjects Site Administrators are data subjects for any personal data they submit to SurveyMonkey Apply, including Account Information and any requests sent to the Support & Services team for assistance. Depending on the location of the Site Administrator, you may have certain rights to make the privacy requests below. 1. Making a "Right of Access" request Administrators can make a request for their data from SurveyMonkey Apply by submitting this form . SurveyMonkey Apply will review our records and any personal data we have stored will be forwarded to the administrator within 30 days. The primary administrator of the site, if different than the one making the request, will be notified in the event they have data stored outside of the system. The primary administrator will be responsible for forwarding this information over to the administrator requesting access. 2. Making a "Right of Rectification" request For any of the data that SurveyMonkey Apply provides to the administrator, the administrator can contact our SurveyMonkey Apply Support team directly for us to modify their data. 3. Making a "Right to Data Portability" request When an administrator makes a request for their data, if SurveyMonkey has anything on the administrator, we will forward it to them in a format that will be portable. See “Making a Right of Access” request above. 4. Making a "Right to Restrict Use" request In order to make a request to restrict the use of your data, please contact our SurveyMonkey Apply Support team . 5. Making a "Right to Object" request In order to make a request to object the use of your data, please contact our SurveyMonkey Apply Support team . 6. Making a "Right to Erasure" / Data Deletion request If you are a primary administrator on a SurveyMonkey Apply site, please contact our support team if you’d like to delete your account and data. If you are not a primary administrator, you will need to complete the following form. Applicants, Reviewers, and Recommenders as Data Subjects If you are an Applicant, Reviewer, or Recommender on the site, and depending on your location, you may be able to exercise the rights as listed below: 1. Making a "Right of Access" request In order to make a "Right of Access" request, you will need to fill out the following form . Upon filling out this form, the administrators for the sites you have been a member of will be contacted. We will recommend that they review their records and forward any personal identifiable data they have stored on you, but SurveyMonkey is not responsible for requiring that the sites deliver any data for which they are the controller. The SurveyMonkey Apply team will also receive a request and will review our records and any personal information for which we are your data controller, will be sent to you. Requests sent by email will be directed to filling out this form as we need to ensure the person making the request is a valid user in our system. 2. Making a "Right of Rectification" request If you would like to make a "Right of Rectification" request, you will need to contact the specific data controller with the change you would like to make. Any change related to your application, review, or recommendation within the SurveyMonkey Apply site, you will need to contact the administrator . For any data SurveyMonkey is the controller of, for example, help requests sent to support , you can contact our SurveyMonkey Apply Support team. 3. Making a "Right to Data Portability" request Similar to making a "Right of Access" request, you can complete the form to request your data. The site administrators and SurveyMonkey Apply will compile any data stored on you and provide it in a format that will be portable. 4. Making a "Right to Restrict Use" request If you would like to make a "Right to Restrict Use" request, you will need to contact the specific data controller. For example, any request related to your application, review, or recommendation within the SurveyMonkey Apply site, you will need to contact the administrator. For any data SurveyMonkey is the controller of, for example, help requests sent to our support team, you can contact our SurveyMonkey Apply Support team . 5. Making a "Right to Object" request If you would like to make a "Right to Object" request, you will need to contact the specific data controller. Any request related to your application, review, or recommendation within the SurveyMonkey Apply site, you will need to contact the administrator. For any data SurveyMonkey is the controller of, for example, help requests sent to support , you can contact our SurveyMonkey Apply Support team. 6. Making a "Right to Erasure"/ Data Deletion request If you wish to remove yourself and permanently delete your data from a specific site you will need to contact the site administrator. They will be able to remove all data stored on you within the site they own. If you are a member of multiple SurveyMonkey sites and wish to delete your SurveyMonkey Apply account and all of your data, you will need to complete the following form. Title: Managing AI Feature Access
Text: Managing AI Feature Access | SurveyMonkey Help Log in SurveyMonkey In this article How AI Feature Access Works Managing AI Feature Access How Your Data is Processed Help Your Account Managing Your Account Managing AI Feature Access SurveyMonkey Managing AI Feature Access How AI Feature Access Works Managing AI Feature Access How Your Data is Processed SurveyMonkey provides AI and machine learning features to help you create better surveys, gather higher quality data, and spot insights quicker. Team and Enterprise admins can control what features their teams have access to at any time. Here are the features that Teams and Enterprise admins can manage access to: AI features to create a survey, which includes: Build with AI Importing surveys with AI Response Quality Sentiment Analysis Analyze with AI Thematic Analysis Data security and privacy are built into the design of our AI and machine learning features. Team and Enterprise Primary Admins can manage their teams' access to AI and machine learning features as needed. You can learn more about how our features process your data to decide if these features are right for you. How AI Feature Access Works Your AI feature access depends on your plan type: For Basic and Individual accounts , access to AI and machine learning features will be on , simplifying the process to access our features. Your data is only processed by the feature if you choose to use it. If you don’t want to use these features, you can still use SurveyMonkey to create, send, and analyze your surveys as you always have without AI and machine learning. For Teams and Enterprise accounts , Primary Admins will manage access to individual AI and machine learning features for their teams. Access may be on or off by default, depending on your plan. Learn how to adjust these settings . Some AI features may only be available on certain plan types, depending on where your data is stored . Managing AI Feature Access Feature availability depends on your plan type and where your data is stored. You’ll only see settings for the features you have access to. Expand the dropdowns below to learn how to manage feature access for your account. Team plans - Primary Admins Primary admins can manage the AI features their team has access to. To manage AI feature access for your team: Select My Team , then select Team Summary . Find AI and machine learning (ML) feature access , then select Edit . Use the toggle and checkboxes to manage access to AI and machine learning features. Enterprise plans - Primary Admins Primary admins can manage the AI features their team has access to. To manage AI feature access for your Enterprise team: Select My Team , then select Settings . Select AI and machine learning (ML) feature access . Use the toggle and checkboxes to manage access to AI and machine learning features. Teams and Enterprise plans - Non-Admins Reach out to your team’s Primary Admin to request access to a feature. Your Primary Admin controls access to AI features for your entire team. Basic and Individual plans Access to AI features is always on so you can use them with ease. Your data is only processed by the feature if you choose to use it. If you don't want to use these features, you can create, send, and analyze your surveys as you always have. Accessing New Features As we develop advanced AI features, we will add these capabilities to your available permissions. When new AI feature permissions become available, we’ll notify admins on Teams and Enterprise accounts before we make the feature available. Access to new features may be on or off by default, depending on your plan type and existing settings: For Basic and Individual accounts , any features you have access to will be ON by default so you can use them with ease. Your data is only processed by the feature if you choose to use it. For Teams and Enterprise accounts : If an admin previously allowed access to all AI features, access to new features will be ON by default. If an admin previously turned off access to one or more AI features, access to new features will be OFF by default. Teams and Enterprise admins can manage access to these features during and after the notice period. How Your Data is Processed Transparency is one of our guiding AI principles. We’ve outlined below how our AI and machine learning features process your data when you use them. Feature Description AI features to create a survey ( Build with AI and importing surveys with AI ) This setting turns on features that help you build and improve your survey. These features allow SurveyMonkey customers to create surveys assisted by generative AI, utilizing the Azure OpenAI or OpenAI service. To provide survey creation features, your survey prompts and an encrypted user ID are sent to the Azure OpenAI or OpenAI Service. These third party providers do not use this data to train their models. Sentiment Analysis Sentiment Analysis uses our proprietary machine learning models to classify text responses as positive, negative or neutral. Response Quality Response Quality uses our proprietary machine learning models to scan your survey data and flag low-quality responses. Analyze with AI Analyze with AI uses the Azure OpenAI service or OpenAI to deliver insights. When you use Analyze with AI, your survey data, including survey title, survey questions, and answer options are sent to the Azure OpenAI service or OpenAI to generate insights about your survey. Any questions or prompts you enter are shared with OpenAI or Azure OpenAI. Individual survey responses and metadata submitted to your survey aren’t shared with the Azure OpenAI service or OpenAI, and your content isn’t used to train these third party providers’ models. Thematic Analysis SurveyMonkey's Thematic Analysis feature uses a self-hosted Anthropic model in a secure data environment to analyze and group your responses. The feature uses your question text, response text, and response ID. Your survey data remains private and secure. Anthropic does not have access to your data and your data is not used to train their AI models. We also mask common data types, like phone numbers and social security numbers, to reduce exposure of potentially sensitive data. Title: Deleting a Survey
Text: Deleting a Survey | SurveyMonkey Help Log in SurveyMonkey Help Managing & Sharing Surveys Organizing & Copying Deleting a Survey SurveyMonkey Deleting a Survey When you delete a survey, the entire survey and all its responses are permanently deleted. Deleting a survey is permanent. Once a survey is deleted, it can't be restored. To delete a survey: Go to Home . Click the three dots ( ... ) to the right of the survey. Click Delete . Review the details. Click Delete . Deleting Shared Surveys You can only delete surveys that you own. When you delete a survey that is shared with others, it's also deletes the survey from their accounts. Learn more: Sharing Surveys Related Articles Can I merge surveys or survey results? Title: How to Add Translations to a Form
Text: How to Add Translations to a Form | Apply Help Log in Apply In this article How to Translate a Form within the Form Builder How to Translate a Form within the Form Builder What if I don't translate my Form? Help Build Forms How to Add Translations to a Form Apply How to Add Translations to a Form How to Translate a Form within the Form Builder How to Translate a Form within the Form Builder What if I don't translate my Form? This article will outline how to add translations to your form so that users can choose which language to view and complete the form in. How to Translate a Form within the Form Builder Within the Form Builder, each language will have its own translated version of the form. When creating the form, by default you will be able to create it in English, however, you may wish to toggle between the different languages available in order to write the translated text. To toggle to another language: Click on the Language icon Select the Language you wish to translate the form in Once you have switched to the new language, you will see the questions appear in the current translated version of the form. Therefore if a user was to toggle the form language, the text that appears within the form builder for that language is what would be displayed to them. If you have not yet translated the form , the default question numbers will appear. In order to translate the form: Go through each question and add the translated text to the Question Title, Description, Choice/ Variable Labels, etc. Ensure that each question has been translated to suit your needs. Save your form. WARNING! When translating your form DO NOT change the structure of the form (eg. Add, Remove, or Rearrange Choices or Variables etc.) The structure of the form is the same throughout all languages on the form and any structural changes made to one language will affect all languages of the form and can affect your collected data. For more information, you can refer to How to Safely Make Changes to a Live Form . How to Translate a Form through the Translation Upload Translating the form text within a form can be a long and tedious task if you are trying to translate a large form or multiple forms within your site. You can make translations to the site in Bulk through the Translation section of the site. To translate a form through the Translation Upload: Go to Settings Click More Click Translations Download Translation Template. Within the downloaded CSV you will see a row for each of the questions within the site with the current English Text. Within the additional language column, you can add all of your translations within this CSV. Once you have completed your translation, upload the back to the site under the corresponding language. Check your form to ensure that all of the text within the form has been updated correctly For more detailed steps in regards to uploading a translation CSV please refer to Translations - Overview . What if I don't translate my Form? If you have multiple languages within your site your forms will also be available to your applicants in those languages. As mentioned previously, if you have not yet translated the form, the default question numbers will appear. Here is an example of an untranslated form: English French What is your favorite color? - Red - Blue - Green - Yellow - Purple Question 1 - Choice 1 - Choice 2 - Choice 3 - Choice 4 - Choice 5 As the French translation has not been updated yet, it will appear with the question numbers to the applicants which can cause confusion to your users filling out the form. Title: How to Apply a Custom (Vanity) URL
Text: How to Apply a Custom (Vanity) URL | Apply Help Log in Apply In this article Why Use a Vanity URL Applying Your Vanity URL Applying Your Vanity URL in SM Apply Help Features and Settings General Settings How to Apply a Custom (Vanity) URL Apply How to Apply a Custom (Vanity) URL Why Use a Vanity URL Applying Your Vanity URL Applying Your Vanity URL in SM Apply A vanity URL is a custom URL that redirects to the SurveyMonkey Apply web address of your site. This article covers how to apply a vanity URL to an SM Apply site to make your site URL easy to remember and share. Adding a Custom URL is only available for Enterprise clients. Why Use a Vanity URL A vanity URL acts as a mask and will remove the smapply domain from your sites web address. Preferably a vanity URL is short, easy to remember, and allows you to keep your brand consistent. A vanity URL must be purchased from a domain registrar. In most cases, you will want to contact your IT department to handle the configuration required for associating your vanity URL to your domain name as updates to DNS settings are required. Applying Your Vanity URL Using a vanity URL will require some changes to your DNS settings in order for your browser to match the new URL with your SM Apply site. This process will vary depending on the domain registrar you are using, but most registrars will have extensive documentation on their unique process. Generally, these steps consist of: Choosing a vanity URL name. Accessing the DNS settings of your domain. Adding a CNAME that points to smapply.io. The DNS configuration must have a CNAME pointing to your SM Apply site URL (example: <yoursite>. smapply.io ) for the domain to direct your users successfully. Please note that most registrars do not allow CNAME records on the root domain, so you will need to use a subdomain in order to configure this correctly. The use of a root domain with an apex record pointing to an Apply IP address is not supported and will result in users being unable to access your site when IP address changes occur. WARNING! It can take up to 48 hours for these changes to propagate which will force you to wait before adding your vanity URL to SM Apply. Applying Your Vanity URL in SM Apply In your site go to Settings Click on General Under the Site Details section, click the Add Custom Domain button. Enter your custom domain Select Save If the CNAME has not been added successfully or has not yet been recognized the error message “your domain is not a valid domain” will be displayed after selecting save. Once you have added your custom domain you will have the ability to add additional custom domains, if necessary. Title: Combining or Hiding Answer Choices
Text: Combining or Hiding Answer Choices | SurveyMonkey Help Log in SurveyMonkey In this article Combine Answer Choices Hide Answer Choices with No Responses Help Analyzing Results Charts & Data Tables Combining or Hiding Answer Choices SurveyMonkey Combining or Hiding Answer Choices Combine Answer Choices Hide Answer Choices with No Responses You can combine or hide answer choices in a chart for closed-ended question types with a single answer choice allowed. Combine Answer Choices To combine or hide answer choices: Go to the Analyze Results section of your survey. Scroll to the chart you want to hide answer choices from. Click the answer choice from the data table below the chart. Select either Exclude from total or Hide and recalculate . We'll recalculate the data for you. (If you don't see the option, the feature isn't available for the question type.) If combining, select the answer choices and rename the label. You can also filter by combined answer choices. To uncombine or unhide answer choices, click the appropriate answer choice and select Uncombine data or click Show beneath the data table. Combining and hiding answer choices only affects the display of your charts—it doesn't affect the raw data or survey design. These combined labels can't be used to create filters, compare rules, or show rules. Hide Answer Choices with No Responses Hide answer choices that didn't receive any responses from your chart. If you hide zero-response answer choices, they won't appear in PDF or PowerPoint exports of summary data. To hide answer choices that didn't receive any responses: Go to the Analyze Results section of your survey. Scroll to the chart you want to hide answer choices from. Select Customize , then go to the Display Options . Select Zero-response answer choices . The following question types aren't supported: Best/Worst Scale, Matrix, Matrix Dropdown, NPS, Ranking, Slider, Star Rating Related Articles Get Quick Insights with Analyze with AI Analyze Multiple Surveys Together Thematic Analysis English Company SurveyMonkey About Us Jobs Blog Help SurveyMonkey Help GetFeedback Help Market Research Help SurveyMonkey Audience Help SurveyMonkey Contribute Help Wufoo Help Apply Help Support Site Status Unsubscribe Contact Us Email Opt-In Policies Legal Center Privacy Policy Cookies Notice California Privacy Notice Copyright © 1999-2025 SurveyMonkey BBB credentials logo TrustedSite logo

Title: How to Set Up Time-based Automations
Text: How to Set Up Time-based Automations | Apply Help Log in Apply In this article Specific Date & Time Events Program Open and Close Date & Time Events Stage Open and Close Date & Time Events Task Deadline Events Help Build Automations How to Set Up Time-based Automations Apply How to Set Up Time-based Automations Specific Date & Time Events Program Open and Close Date & Time Events Stage Open and Close Date & Time Events Task Deadline Events Within SurveyMonkey Apply you can enable your automations to be activated based on a specific date. With these types of Automations, you can send emails to your applicants, move the applications between stages, hide/show tasks, and much more based on a specific date in your site. Specific Date & Time Events If you wish to fire an automation on a specific Date & Time that you select: Create an Automation Set the Source of the Activation to Time-based Event Select the Specific Date & Time as the Event Enter the Date that you wish for the automation to fire Enter the Time that you wish for the automation to fire Specify the target in which the actions must be carried against. See Understanding Targets Optional: Set additional conditions on the automation to limit who the automation is activated for. For example, Application is in Stage. Set the action that should occur based on the Activation and Conditions set. NOTE: Times will be based on your sites Timezone Program Open and Close Date & Time Events If you wish to fire an automation on the open or close date of a Program: Create an Automation Set the Source of the Activation to Time-based Event Select either Program open Date & Time or Program close Date & Time as the Event , depending on when the automation should be fired. Specify the target in which the actions must be carried against. See Understanding Targets Optional: Set additional conditions on the automation to limit who the automation is activated for. For example, Application is in Stage. Set the action that should occur based on the Activation and Conditions set. Stage Open and Close Date & Time Events If you wish to fire an automation on the open or close date of a Stage: Create an Automation Set the Source of the Activation to Time-based Event Select either Stage open Date & Time or Stage close Date & Time as the Event , depending on when the automation should be fired. Select the Stage you wish to reference the Date & Times for. Specify the target in which the actions must be carried against. See Understanding Targets Optional: Set additional conditions on the automation to limit who the automation is activated for. Set the action that should occur based on the Activation and Conditions set. Task Deadline Events If you wish to fire an automation on a Task Deadline: Create an Automation Set the Source of the Activation to Time-based Event Select Task Deadline as the Event Select the Task you wish to reference the Date & Times for. NOTE: If you wish to set a deadline based on a Review task you will need to select Stage Open and Close Date & Time Events (link) Specify the target in which the actions must be carried against. See Understanding Targets Optional: Set additional conditions on the automation to limit who the automation is activated for. Set the action that should occur based on the Activation and Conditions set. Understanding Targets Target Description Application This target will fire for all Active applications that meet your conditions. Reviews This target will fire for applications that have a completed review. If you have conditions on the automation the system will then check to ensure the application also meets your conditions. Recommendations This target will fire for applications that have a completed recommendation. If you have conditions on the automation the system will then check to ensure the application also meets your conditions. Title: Activity Log Reports
Text: Activity Log Reports | Apply Help Log in Apply In this article How to Create an “Activity Log” report Admin Permissions Help Analyze Reporting Activity Log Reports Apply Activity Log Reports How to Create an “Activity Log” report Admin Permissions During the lifecycle and when a program has been completed, many customers have a requirement to maintain archived activity log data for quick reference, auditing purposes, and quality control. Instead of combing through the existing logs within SurveyMonkey Apply, Administrators can now export the data from the site for external storage and review if required. How to Create an “Activity Log” report Click Reports (located in the navigation bar at the top of your SMA Admin Dashboard) Click + Create in the top right-hand corner Give your report a name Select “Activity Log” as the data to include Select the date range you’d like to include in the report from the dropdown at the top of the report building (by default, reports will generate the last 7 days of data). Select the columns you'd like to include in the Report Click Save or Save & Export to immediately pull the information. Admin Permissions Please note that due to the nature of this report type, Activity Log Reports can only be viewed by the Admin that created it. This is to ensure only Admins with specific access can target application data pertaining to individual programs. Title: Automation FAQ
Text: Automation FAQ | Apply Help Log in Apply In this article Name automations for easier identification Organize automations into Folders Tracking Automation Logs Activate an Automation Deactivate an Automation Duplicate an automation Delete an Automation The Automation didn't fire Help Build Automations Automation FAQ Apply Automation FAQ Name automations for easier identification Organize automations into Folders Tracking Automation Logs Activate an Automation Deactivate an Automation Duplicate an automation Delete an Automation The Automation didn't fire Name automations for easier identification It is recommended that automation titles follow a predetermined format for organization and efficiency, in case changes need to be made at a later date. Common formats are: "The Action: Brief Summary of the Automation" OR "Activation -> Action" For example, if an automation is used to move an application to another review stage based on a response in a ranking form, the automation could be named: "Move: Approved Application to Follow-Up Review" OR "Upon Approval - > Move to Follow-Up Review Stage" This title allows any administrator within the site to search and modify the automation easily should any changes be made to the program's process in later cycles. The main purpose of this formatting is to allow you to organize and manage your automations. TIP! If your automation performs multiple actions, be sure to include both actions in your title to help you find it later. An example of this would be "Move & Email: Application Form Completed." Organize automations into Folders When many automations have been added to a single program, it is easy to become overwhelmed when trying to locate a specific automation. It is recommended to make use of Automation Folders to help with their organization. Adding folders with titles such as "Move," "Emails," and "Date Activation" are some examples based on actions your automations will perform, but you may find that it is more practical to name folders following the custom application labels or statuses you have created for your programs. To create a new folder from the Automations page: Select the Folders icon Select Create New Add a name for the Folder Select OK To add an automation to a folder from the Automations page: Mark the automation Select Folders Select the folder that best describes your automation NOTE: Automations can only be associated with one folder at a time. Tracking Automation Logs To view a searchable log of previous instances where automations have fired, administrators can select the View Logs icon from the Automations page. This can be helpful for troubleshooting applications that did not follow the process as expected and to determine if an automation fired/misfired for an application. The log will display: the title of the automation the activation that caused the automation to fire the date and time it fired the title of the application the automation is Related to the name of the actor who caused the automation to fire. For more in-depth information, refer to Automation Logs . Activate an Automation When an automation is created it must be ACTIVE in order for it to fire. Program Automations Page To activate an automation from the Automation Page: Select the automation you wish to activate Select the Actions icon Select Activate Stage Automations Page To activate an automation from the Stage Automation page: Select the automation you wish to activate Select the Actions icon Select Activate Within the Automation To activate an automation from within the automation: Click on the Toggle at the bottom of the page Save your Automation Deactivate an Automation Program Automations Page To deactivate an automation from the Automations Page: Select the automation you wish to deactivate Select the Actions icon Select Deactivate Stage Automations Page To deactivate an automation from the Stage Automation page: Select the automation you wish to deactivate Select the Actions icon Select Deactivate Within the Automation To deactivate the automation within the automation: Click on the Toggle at the bottom of the page Save your Automation Duplicate an automation Duplicating an automation can be time efficient especially when an automation is very similar, but has slightly different rules from the parent automation. Duplicate a Single Automat ion Hover your cursor over the automation you wish to duplicate and select the Ellipses icon Select Duplicate Duplicate Multiple Automations Select the automations from the table Select Actions Click Duplicate Delete an Automation Hover your cursor over the automation you wish to duplicate and select the Ellipses icon within the Actions column Select Delete Confirm deletion WARNING! Deleted automations cannot be restored. The Automation didn't fire If you notice that an automation hasn't fired as expected for an application, check that the following points apply: The application was submitted after the automation was created. If you've recently created the automation, it will not work retroactively. The application meets the conditions . If the conditions are based on form responses, ensure that all applicable conditions are being met at the time the automation. This is the most common reason that an application hasn't fired. The automation is active . Title: Automate with Quick Actions in Connect
Text: Automate with Quick Actions in Connect | SurveyMonkey Help Log in SurveyMonkey In this article Quick Actions What’s the difference between apps with quick actions and integrations? Navigating the Connect Apps tab Manage your Quick Actions Help Integrations Automate with Quick Actions in Connect SurveyMonkey Automate with Quick Actions in Connect Quick Actions What’s the difference between apps with quick actions and integrations? Navigating the Connect Apps tab Manage your Quick Actions The Connect apps section of your survey is the place to connect your survey data to your business apps to automate data sharing, collaborate smarter, and save time. Automating with quick actions helps to improve information sharing, iterate on survey feedback, and save time. Quick Actions Quick actions are simple automations that connect SurveyMonkey responses to popular business apps, like: Post notifications to Slack or Microsoft Teams to share targeted data with the right people, as responses roll in. Posting to these apps can help surface new ideas, channel feedback, or escalate something so teams can take action faster. Export responses to Excel or Google Sheets to share in-the-moment data with your team, which you can merge with other key data for deeper insights. Data selection and filtering When setting up quick actions, you can choose whether to act on all response data or target responses when a respondent selects a specific answer. Targeting the response data helps you channel the right survey data to the right people, making your quick action more relevant, usable, and efficient. What’s the difference between apps with quick actions and integrations? You can find all apps with quick actions in Connect apps , along with some integrations. The lightweight quick actions let you easily automate useful tasks, like creating notifications for visibility, further analysis, or prompt follow-up action. Setting up quick actions could improve your team’s collaboration and amplify your impact, all within SurveyMonkey. Only some integrations are accessible from Connect apps, but all integrations are available in the SurveyMonkey App Directory . You may need to install these integrations outside of SurveyMonkey. There are 200+ pre-built integrations helping you connect with popular CRMs, marketing automation tools, and BI platforms. Navigating the Connect Apps tab From the Connect apps Discover tab, search or browse the quick actions or explore some integration offerings. Select Manage to monitor or edit any quick actions you’ve already set up. Managing your Quick Actions Within the Connect apps space, you can manage and monitor all your actions, in one place. Selecting the green toggle will deactivate the action, but remain listed as a connected app that you can tap to re-activate. You can select the three dots menu (...) to edit a quick action’s set up, or Delete or Reauthenticate the app. If you want to manage an integration you previously installed, select the SurveyMonkey App Directory ’s tile that’s specific to that integration. Title: How to Rename a Stage
Text: How to Rename a Stage | Apply Help Log in Apply Help Build Workflow and Stages How to Rename a Stage Apply How to Rename a Stage When a program is created, a stage called “Application Stage” is created by default. You may wish to change the name of this stage or future stages you implement. In order to rename your stage Go to your Workflow Click on the Name of the stage to access the stage configurations. Click on Settings Edit the Title field Save your changes Related Articles July 2025 August 2025 June 2025 English Company SurveyMonkey About Us Jobs Blog Help SurveyMonkey Help GetFeedback Help Market Research Help SurveyMonkey Audience Help SurveyMonkey Contribute Help Wufoo Help Apply Help Support Site Status Unsubscribe Contact Us Email Opt-In Policies Legal Center Privacy Policy Cookies Notice California Privacy Notice Copyright © 1999-2025 SurveyMonkey BBB credentials logo TrustedSite logo

Title: How to Move a Program to Trash
Text: How to Move a Program to Trash | Apply Help Log in Apply In this article How to Move a Program to Trash How to Revert a Deleted Program What Happens When a Program has been Deleted Help Build Programs How to Move a Program to Trash Apply How to Move a Program to Trash How to Move a Program to Trash How to Revert a Deleted Program What Happens When a Program has been Deleted If a program was set up but it is no longer relevant as a program in your site, you may wish to delete it. In this article, we will walk you through how to delete a program, how to revert a deleted program, and what happens when a program has been deleted. How to Move a Program to Trash How to Move a Single Program to Trash If you wish to d elete a single program from your site: Go to your Site Dashboard Click on the More Options icon within the program tile Click Move to Trash How to Move Programs to Trash in Bulk If you wish to d elete a multiple programs from your site: Go to your Site Dashboard Switch to List View Select the program(s) you with to delete Click on Actions Click Move to Trash How to Revert a Deleted Program If a program is deleted accidentally or you simply wish to activate the program again you can revert the deleted program to active. In order to do so: Go to your Site Dashboard Click on the Programs Filter in the top right corner. This will either display Active Programs , Launched , or Not Yet Launched depending on your view Select Trashed Find the program you wish to revert Click on the More Options within the program tile Click Revert What Happens When a Program has been Deleted Once you have deleted a program it will be grouped under the Trashed filter of the Site Dashboard. Once the program is Trashed, it will still exist within the site and you will be able to revert it to its original state if necessary. However, you will not be able to access any settings or submitted data when it is in the Trashed folder. Title: How to Push Attachments to Salesforce
Text: How to Push Attachments to Salesforce | Apply Help Log in Apply Help Advanced Features How to Push Attachments to Salesforce Apply How to Push Attachments to Salesforce If the selected Salesforce object type supports it, and if it is a Push action, you will be able to specify any file attachments that should be synced. File attachments are synced separately from the fields themselves, and the newly created Attachment object in Salesforce will be linked to the created record. In order to push an attachment to Salesforce Go to your Salesforce Integration Click on the name of the Integration Click to Edit or Add a new Action: Creating a Salesforce Action Scroll to the bottom of the Push Action settings under File Attachments Sync attachments as a new Salesforce record. This section will only appear for Salesforce objects that can accept an attachment. You can add one or all attachment types to the Salesforce object. Select the Attach File task that you wish to be pushed as an attachment You won’t be able to see your attachments in Salesforce until you enable the Notes and Attachments panel. Additionally, an attachment being edited will NOT activate a SF action in any case (created, edited or submitted). The upload task will need to be marked as Complete. Title: Post Responses Automatically in Slack
Text: Post Responses Automatically in Slack | SurveyMonkey Help Log in SurveyMonkey In this article Connecting SurveyMonkey and Slack to share responses in Slack Automated Responses in Slack Manage Your Slack Connections Help Integrations Post Responses Automatically in Slack SurveyMonkey Post Responses Automatically in Slack Connecting SurveyMonkey and Slack to share responses in Slack Automated Responses in Slack Manage Your Slack Connections Connect your SurveyMonkey account with Slack so you can automatically post survey responses in public or private Slack channels, in real time. You can set up the workflow so all responses post to Slack or set conditions based on a specific set of responses to target notifications and encourage the right people to take action. Connecting SurveyMonkey to Slack is helpful for initiating action to follow up with customers or employees to improve trends based on their responses to your survey, or to share feedback to offer transparency to your team or just to the right people. Automating responses in Slack is only possible for Complete responses . Connecting SurveyMonkey and Slack to share responses in Slack You can set up automations so survey responses post in Slack. To set up your survey to send Slack messages with your survey responses: Select a survey from Home . From the Connect Apps tab, locate Slack under the Discover tab. Select the quick action, Post to channel . If it's the first time you're posting to a channel, select Connect to link your SurveyMonkey account to Slack. Select Allow to give SurveyMonkey access to your Slack workspace. Select or search for the Slack Channel you want to post responses to. (Optional) Enter an Optional Message to send along with the response in Slack, to provide context. (Optional) Turn on the toggle to Link to response , if you want to include a link to SurveyMonkey.com within your post. (Optional) Select + next to Include survey data if you want to select to 5 questions to display with your Slack post. Select + Add more data and select a question. Repeat as desired, then select Apply. (Optional) To target specific responses, rather than post for all responses, select + Target specific responses . Select Add filter . Select your Criteria questions and answer. Select Add . To add additional filters, select + Add new filter and repeat the last 3 steps. Select Apply . Select Activate . An overview of all Slack quick actions you set up are available in the Manage tab within the Connect apps tab. Select a toggle to disable or enable a quick action. Or, you can select the three dot menu ( …) to Edit action , Manage connection , or Delete an automation. TIP! Feel free to create multiple workflows to deliver to various channels or use filters to customize the information getting sent to Slack. Condition Limitations When you add a filter to a quick action, most questions are available to filter by, except: Date/Time Click map Text Image File upload Text A/B Image A/B Accepting payments via Stripe or PayPal Automated Responses in Slack Any new responses matching your Send when filter criteria post to your channels in real time. The message you set up displays and may have a link to view the individual response, which opens a Shared data page in a new tab. Manage Your Slack Connections You can view and manage your connected apps and actions from the Manage tab, under Connect Apps. You can Manage connections to either Reauthenticate , which refreshes your existing connection, or Delete the individual users' installation of the app. In order to fully remove the SurveyMonkey app from your Slack workspace, a Slack Admin is needed. They can Remove app from the app listing's Configuration tab . To manage your Slack quick actions, you can also select the toggle to turn an action on or off, or click the … to Edit action or Delete it permanently. Title: Make a Payment Task
Text: Make a Payment Task | Apply Help Log in Apply In this article How to Create a Make a Payment Task Task Settings PayPal Settings Stripe Settings Authorize.net Settings Help Build Tasks Make a Payment Task Apply Make a Payment Task How to Create a Make a Payment Task Task Settings PayPal Settings Stripe Settings Authorize.net Settings The Make a Payment task requires a user to pay a fee to be considered for the program. This article will discuss how to create a Payment task in your site and the different payment processors that can be used in SurveyMonkey Apply. NOTE: Apply's platform allows you to collect payments from your applicants using third-party payment processors. Some of these payment processors may require Strong Customer Authentication (SCA) under the EU Payment Services Directive (PSD2) . People in Europe who submit payment through their application may need to provide additional authentication. It's not possible to disable this authentication when payment processors require it. How to Create a Make a Payment Task To create a Make a Payment Task in your site: Go to your Workflow Click on the Name of the stage to access the stage configurations Click on the Tasks tab Click on the Plus + icon Select Make a Payment Complete the task settings as listed below Task Settings Settings Description Title This is the name of the task that will be visible to your applicants within their task list. Payment Source Select the payment processor you wish to use to receive a payment in the site: - PayPal - Stripe - Authorize.net For more information on the information required for each payment processor please see the corresponding section below. Instructions This description is shown to applicants who complete this task. Specifying instructions is optional. When checked, the Visual Editor is displayed which allows the content to be formatted accordingly. This description will be visible to your applicants within the application underneath the task. Optional Make your task Optional. By default, your task will be required to complete. If you wish to allow your applicants to proceed without completing the task you can set the task to be optional. Deadline Set a deadline on your task. Decide if you wish to prevent applicants from completing the task after a certain date. Prevent Editing Enabling this setting will mean that applicants will not be able to edit the task once they have fully completed it. Prerequisites The tasks you set as Prerequisites will need to be completed in the site before this task becomes available. A common example of this is if you wish to force your applicants to complete a Basic Information form task before another task becomes available. TIP! Select "Hide task until prerequisites are met" if you wish to make it clear to your applicants that they need to complete the prerequisite first. Set who can edit this task Determine who this task is to be edited by: - Applicants & Collaborators - Applicants Only - Collaborators Only Applicants refer to the owner/ creator of the application and Collaborators refers to any additional users added as members to the application. If set to Applicant Only or Collaborator Only, the task will still be visible to the other user type, however, it will not be editable. PayPal Settings Settings Description Client ID This ID will be provided to you on your PayPal account. Secret This key will be provided to you on your PayPal account. Payment Currency Enter the Currency that you wish to accept. The currencies available are limited to the ones provided in the drop-down within the task. Amount Enter the amount that you wish your applicants to pay. Must be greater than 1. Processor fees will apply. Please DO NOT include the $ sign or any equivalents in this value. For more information in regards to the setup of PayPal you can refer to their documentation here: www.paypal.com/ca/smarthelp/home Stripe Settings Settings Description Publishable Key This token will be provided to you on your Stripe account. You can input your Publishable in this field to link the payment task to your Stripe account. Secret Key This token will be provided to you on your Stripe account. You can input your Secret Key in this field in order to link the payment task to your Stripe account. Payment Currency Enter the currency that you wish to accept. The currencies available are limited to those provided in the drop-down within the task. Amount Enter the amount that you wish your applicants to pay. Must be greater than 1. Processor fees will apply. Please DO NOT include the $ sign or any equivalents in this value. For more information in regards to the setup of Stripe you can refer to their documentation here: stripe.com/docs Authorize.net Settings Settings Description API Login ID This ID will be provided to you on your Authorize.net account. It will be an 8 character ID. For more information in regards to this, you can refer to Authorize.net's support article . Transaction Key This ID will be provided to you on your Authorize.net account. It will be a 16 character ID. For more information in regards to this, you can refer to Authorize.net's support article . Payment Currency Enter the Currency that you wish to accept. The currencies available are limited to the ones provided in the drop-down within the task. Amount Enter the amount that you wish your applicants to pay. Must be greater than 1. Processor fees will apply. Please DO NOT include the $ sign or any equivalents in this value. For more information in regards to the setup of Authorize.net you can refer to their documentation here: support.authorize.net To set up your Authorize.net account: 1. Log into the Merchant Interface. ( https://account.authorize.net/ ) 2. Click Account from the main toolbar. 3. Click Response/Receipt URLs under Transaction Format Settings. 4. Click Add URL. 5. Enter your Response URL, which would be your Site's URL 6. Click Submit. Title: How to Authenticate your Custom Email Sender Address
Text: How to Authenticate your Custom Email Sender Address | Apply Help Log in Apply In this article Advantages of Authenticating your Email Email Authentication: Overview What to do if you're not sure what to do How to Enable Email Authentication How to Configure Email Authentication Configuration Help Features and Settings Emails How to Authenticate your Custom Email Sender Address Apply How to Authenticate your Custom Email Sender Address Advantages of Authenticating your Email Email Authentication: Overview What to do if you're not sure what to do How to Enable Email Authentication How to Configure Email Authentication Configuration If DKIM Email Authentication hasn't been enabled on your site yet, contact our support team for more information. To determine if this has been enabled, the default No Reply email visible in your settings should be noreply@mail.smapply.net . If it isn't noreply@mail.smapply.net , please contact our support team. Advantages of Authenticating your Email Currently, when you send emails from SurveyMonkey Apply they are being sent from the smapply.io email address. By authenticating your custom email sender address, emails will be sent from your organization's email address. As your email address is more likely to be recognized by your applicants and reviewers, your email is more likely to be received and not get caught in spam filters. Email Authentication: Overview Email Authentication uses two DNS records to verify that we can send emails on behalf of your domain. The first, DKIM, uses a TXT Record to validate the email address and is required to use the custom email address on the site. Without a verified DKIM you will not be able to select your custom email address from the list of email addresses and it will be marked as unverified. The second record is a CNAME and is only required if you want the Return-Path header to align with your sender email address. The CNAME should be added for the subdomain that you have configured your custom email address to use. For example, if your sender email address is apply@ mail.siteurl.com , the CNAME record should be created for mail.siteurl.com with the value shown in the Value field, which will mark the Return-Path as also mail.siteurl.com . While this isn’t required, it is a best practice to enable this as some receiving mail servers may check the Return-Path to see if the sender’s domain matches the Return-Path domain in an effort to prevent phishing. Once you have added the DNS records, click Verify to verify the email address. The system will verify that the records exist on the domain, and if they are valid, a verified icon will appear on the DNS Records section as well as under the Verification Status column on the Email Settings page. NOTE: The DNS Records may take up to 48 hours to propagate for your domain, so if it does not verify the first time you try, please wait and try verifying again later. What to do if you're not sure what to do When attempting to set up this process, it is highly recommended to send this information to your IT department/individual to assist you with updating your email domain settings. If your organization doesn't have someone knowledgeable in configuring DKIM or you just aren't able to make changes to your email settings, we would not recommend using a Custom Email Sender. Instead, it is best to use the system's default email address noreply@mail.smapply.net . You can, however, update the name that the email is received from. In the Email settings of your site instead of it being "SurveyMonkey Apply" < noreply@mail.smapply.net > you can set it up as "Your Organization Name" < noreply@mail.smapply.net > so that your recipients still know the email is coming from you. How to Enable Email Authentication To enable Email Authentication if this functionality isn't available, please contact our support team . How to Configure Email Authentication Before you Start NOTE: Administrative access to your domain’s DNS records is required to complete the configuration, so if you do not have administrative access, please contact your organization’s IT department to ensure you will be able to make the following changes. When adding a Custom Email Address to a site with Email Authentication enabled, it is recommended that you use a subdomain for the email address as this will allow you to align the Return-Path field with your domain as well. While this helps to improve email deliverability by having the return-path email address match the domain of the sender address, unfortunately, it will also mean that you can’t use a real email address as your Custom Email Address since a CNAME would affect access to your real organization’s site. If you wish to use a real email address to configure Email Authentication you can, however, you will not be able to configure the CNAME and emails sent from your site will have the default return-path used instead. Configuration To use Email Authentication : Click Add Custom Email on the Email Settings page Enter your custom email address as well as a name for it and click Add & Continue The next step requires administrative access to your domain name to add the required DNS records. The Edit custom email address box will be shown and includes the values for the DKIM and CNAME records that should be added to authenticate the email address. The DKIM record is required, while the CNAME is optional if you wish to align your Return-Path email address with your sender address. Title: Dropdown Question
Text: Dropdown Question | Apply Help Log in Apply In this article How to Add a Dropdown Question Help Build Form Question Types Dropdown Question Apply Dropdown Question How to Add a Dropdown Question The choices in this question will appear in a dropdown format. The user may select one answer from options that appear in a dropdown list. How to Add a Dropdown Question Within your form, click on the Questions tab. Under Basic Questions, double-click or click and drag the Dropdown question to add it to your form. Optional: Add an Identifier to your question Enter the Question Title Optional: Add a Description Add your Choices. Set the Choice Settings Set the +Display settings Set the +Options settings i. Decide if the Variable will be Required or Optional. NOTE: You can add the Choices individually by clicking Add or by clicking the Bulk button. You can add the variables in a list within the Bulk Editor . You can also Add Other Choice which will automatically add a choice with an additional text response field to collect more information. Choice Settings Choice Setting Description Static Choice This option can be used with question randomization logic. When this logic is applied, a question choice with static choice enabled will remain in the same location for every user. TIP! If you have an "Other" choice and wish to Randomize or Alphabetize your choices, this will ensure that Other is always at the bottom of the list. Score Scoring allows you to assign a value to each choice. This is commonly used in Advanced Reviewer Forms . Choices will have Default Scoring applied automatically. Display Settings Display Description Display side-by-side Display this question side by side with another question. This will need to be enabled on the other question as well. Append to previous question This question type appends to the question before it to make it appear that they are connected within the form. NOTE: Any Branching Logic , such as to hide or show the previous question, will also apply to this question. However, the requirement settings won't be. If it is meant to be hidden it will need to be included in the branching logic as well. Width You can adjust the width based on a percentage of the size of the page. By default, the value is 100% to make it fit the page size. Options Settings Options Description Optional Enabling this will make the question Optional. When a user enters the form, if the question is Optional they will be able to proceed and complete the form without providing a response to this question. Randomize choices Selecting this option randomizes the choices within the Dropdown upon each form refresh. Alphabetize choices Choices within your Dropdown will appear in alphabetical order (A-Z). TIP! Use this if you are going to be adding choices to your form after already collecting data. This will allow you to maintain your alphabetical order without jeopardizing your data. Refer to How to Safely Make Changes to a Live Form for more information. Initial Value Allows you to specify pre-populated answers to questions in your form. By default, this option is blank "---". Blank Choice The initial value displays, indicating that a selection wasn't made. This will not count towards a response if selected. Title: File Won’t Upload
Text: File Won’t Upload | SurveyMonkey Help Log in SurveyMonkey Help Site File Won’t Upload SurveyMonkey File Won’t Upload If you're having trouble adding an image to your survey design, or uploading a file to your team Library , ensure that your file meets these requirements: Type Size Format Image 2MB or less JPG, PNG, or GIF Logo 2MB or less JPG, PNG, or GIF Document 16 MB or less DOC, DOCX, or PDF Reducing the File Size If your file exceeds the size limit, review these tips for reducing the file size. Images If the image you want to add to your survey design is too large to upload, you can host the image on a third-party site and add it to your survey by entering the URL. You can't add logos or Library images via URL. If your logo file is too large, edit the image to reduce the file size: Crop the image to remove any excess space around the perimeter. Resize the image. Images with smaller dimensions have smaller file sizes. Compress the image. Be aware that compressing the image may affect clarity. Documents If the DOC file you need to upload to the Library is too large, edit the document to reduce the file size: Compress all images in the document. Remove hidden data Save the file as a PDF to take up less space. If the PDF file you need to upload to the Library is too large, edit the document to reduce the file size: Compress the file. There are several free online tools you can use to do this. If your PDF is very long, split up the document into a few separate files and upload each one to the library. Title: How to Contact Us
Text: How to Contact Us | Apply Help Log in Apply In this article Immediate Answers Email Support Phone Support Help FAQs and Troubleshooting How to Contact Us Apply How to Contact Us Immediate Answers Email Support Phone Support Immediate Answers For the fastest answers, browse or search our Help Center. Just enter a search term or browse by topic at the top of this page—chances are, we have an article that addresses your issue. Email Support Email support is available 24/7 for all customers, including Administrators, Applicants, Reviewers and Recommenders. To contact support: Go to the Home Page or log into your account (recommended). Click on the Information (i) Icon in the top right corner. In the drop-down menu: - If logged in, click Contact Support - If logged out, click Fill in a Support Request Form Select the option that best describes your request. Click Request Support if the suggested articles don’t address your request and fill out the additional fields. Submit your request. If you’re an Administrator, you can also request Phone Support. Phone Support Phone support is available to Administrators on Enterprise and Enterprise Plus plans. Request a phone call between Monday to Friday from 8AM - 5PM Eastern Time. If you’re on a Basic plan we’re happy to assist you over email. Our support team will review your request and if we’re able to answer by providing steps over email, we’ll do that first. Otherwise, the team will reach out at the number provided as soon as possible. To request a call: Log in to your Administrative Account. Click on the Information (i) icon in the top right corner Click Contact Support Select “What can we help you with? ” from the dropdown menu Select the area of the product your request is related to and review the suggested articles that display. Click Request Support if the suggested articles don’t address your question. Add a Subject line and a 100-character or less description of the problem Include the following details to help our support better answer your questions: Issue details: Add a description of what’s happening and where it’s happening in your site (for example, Manage Users, Manage Applications, or Reviewer portal). Users involved: E-mail addresses or names of the affected individual(s) for us to troubleshoot. Affected applications: At least one example, if applicable, will help us in cases where applicants have multiple applications. Automations involved: If applicable, trigger names and/or direct links to triggers. Expected resolution: What are you expecting should happen, or what is it that you’d like to happen? Select the checkbox "I would like to request a call back" Provide a number where you can be reached. Submit your request.
