Title: Setting Up SurveyMonkey as a Vendor
Text: Setting Up SurveyMonkey as a Vendor | SurveyMonkey Help Log in SurveyMonkey In this article Download a Vendor Form Remittance Advices Our W-9 Quotes Help Payments & Billing Invoices & Receipts Setting Up SurveyMonkey as a Vendor SurveyMonkey Setting Up SurveyMonkey as a Vendor Download a Vendor Form Remittance Advices Our W-9 Quotes If you need to set SurveyMonkey up as a vendor or supplier for your organization before making a payment , review the documents and instructions below. As we transition back to our iconic SurveyMonkey brand, our documents will display the name SurveyMonkey Inc. Download a Vendor Form We offer standardized vendor forms to make it easy for you to establish SurveyMonkey Inc. as a vendor within your company or organization. Find and download the form that best matches your company's location in the table below. Our company's legal name differs between vendor forms because SurveyMonkey Inc. has different international entities. Billing Country Vendor Form to Download SurveyMonkey Entity United States Download SurveyMonkey Inc. US Vendor Form » SurveyMonkey Inc. Australia Download SurveyMonkey Australia Vendor Form » SurveyMonkey Europe UC Canada Download SurveyMonkey Canada Vendor Form » = SurveyMonkey Europe UC Mexico Download SurveyMonkey Mexico Vendor Form » SurveyMonkey Europe UC United Kingdom Download SurveyMonkey UK Vendor Form » SurveyMonkey Europe UC Rest of World Download SurveyMonkey Europe International Vendor Form » SurveyMonkey Europe UC Need to make a payment? SurveyMonkey's bank details are on your open invoice. Purchase Orders You can add a purchase order number to a SurveyMonkey invoice. Organizations find this helpful for administrative purposes, but please note it doesn’t constitute our acceptance of the purchase order terms and conditions, and any such terms are void. Purchase orders aren’t valid forms of payment. In order to activate your account, you’ll need to pay using one of the accepted payment methods listed on the invoice. Adding a purchase order number Expand | Collapse Upgrading From a Free Plan To add a purchase order number on the checkout page: Go to the Billing Details section. Click Optional Business Information. Fill in the Purchase Order Number field. Renewing or Upgrading a Paid Plan If you currently pay by invoice, you can add a purchase order number to your account: Go to your Billing Details . Check your next billing date. If it’s more than 45 days away, the number you add will be included on your renewal invoice. Scroll to the Payment Information section. Add or update your purchase order number. If you need to add a purchase order number for an upcoming payment but don’t see this option in your account, pay by invoice instead. Adding a Purchase Order Number to an Invoice We can add a purchase order to an invoice that’s already been issued, as long as it hasn’t been paid—just contact us with the purchase order number and your SurveyMonkey invoice number. Remittance Advices For a payment to be correctly applied to your account, you'll need to include the transaction number from your invoice on the payment itself. You can submit a remittance advice for your records, but we may be unable to match it to your payment. If you didn't include the transaction number on a payment, wait the standard payment processing time for your payment method and contact us with proof of payment . Our W-9 SurveyMonkey Inc. Tax ID Number: 37-1581003 Download our W-9 form » If you have issues accessing the linked PDF, please contact us . We can fax or email you a copy. To make a payment , follow the instructions on your invoice. We don’t accept payments at the address listed on our W-9. Quotes If you'd like to upgrade your account to an annual plan, you can get a document to use as a quote by creating an invoice —a payable document that includes your plan, price, billing details, and more. To create an invoice: Sign in to your account. Choose the plan you want. On the checkout page, choose Invoice . Enter your billing details and click Confirm —this won't charge you. Get the invoice from your Transaction History . Once you're ready to pay, detailed payment instructions are listed at the bottom of the invoice. Related Articles Contact Information for Payments Billing Currency Why was I charged again? Title: Administrator Application View: Overview
Text: Administrator Application View: Overview | Apply Help Log in Apply In this article The Administrator Application View Layout How to Access Administrator Application View The Application List Application Short Summary Application Management Actions Summary Tab Application Tab Review Tab Notes Tab Decision History Tab Help Monitor Administrator Application View: Overview Apply Administrator Application View: Overview The Administrator Application View Layout How to Access Administrator Application View The Application List Application Short Summary Application Management Actions Summary Tab Application Tab Review Tab Notes Tab Decision History Tab Administrators have a unique view to help manage applications for a program within the site. This view displays all applicant information, application material, completed reviews, and notes specific to an application. This article provides an overview of this view and describes the various actions that can be carried out here. The Administrator Application View Layout The layout of the administrator application view has been designed with efficiency in mind to display the application and all associated materials in one convenient pane. This layout consists of the following areas: The Application List The Application Short Summary Application Management Actions And four main navigation tabs: Summary Application Reviews Notes View application specific data such as the list of collaborators working on the application, the status of the application, application custom fields, and more. View the status and task completion of specific tasks. View completed reviews of the application Write and review applications notes Once you have made a decision (Award or Decline Application) a fifth navigation tab will be added for Decision History . How to Access Administrator Application View Access the View Using the Search Tool To access this view as an administrator from the search tool: Search for application title or ID using the Search tool Select the title of the application Or: Search for the name of the applicant using the Search tool Select the title of the application Access the View From Manage Applications Go to Manage Applications . Search for the application. Select the Application Id. Access the View From Manage Users Go to Manage Users . Locate the user the application belongs to. Select the applicants name to display the User Profile . Select the Applications tab within the profile. Select the Application ID. The Application List The application list is located on the left hand side of the screen within the administrator application view. This is a complete list of the applications that meet the filter you have applied to the manage application table. Navigation To jump to a specific application, select the application title from the list using the scroll bar within the list to see applications further down the list. Administrators can also navigate through the list by using the arrows < > located directly above the download icon on the right hand side of the page. This section will be displayed as Application 1 of x. Application Short Summary The short summary consists of vital information to quickly identify an application with as little information as possible. Within the short summary an administrator will find: the applicant owner's name the application ID (completely unique to an application) the current stage the application is in the custom status you have applied to the application, if applicable. Application Management Actions Directly under the application short summary are various icons that allow an administrator to update an application quickly and efficiently: Award Applications Decline Applications Move Applications Add/ Remove Labels Apply/Remove Status Email the Applicant Download an Application More Actions Award Applications Applications can be awarded directly from the admin application view. To award an application: Select the Award button Optional: Update the stage and status of the application Select Next Optional: Send an email or dashboard alert to the applicant to let them know they've been awarded Review your selections Select Award Applications Decline Applications If an application has not met the requirements to receive an award, it can be declined from the admin application view. To decline an application: Select the Decline icon Optional: Add a note Optional: Update the stage and status of the application Optional: Send an email or dashboard alert Select Decline Application and confirm Move Applications Applications can be moved to other stages from this screen. This prevents the administrator from needing to navigate away from the application view to update where the application lies in your process. To move an application from the admin application view: Select the Move Stage icon Select the stage to move the application to Automations that fire based on an application moving to a new stage could fire based on this action. You may want to review your site program automations before completing this action. Add/Remove Labels Labels of an application can also be managed from this screen. To add or remove a label: Select the Label icon Add/remove selections for available labels to update the application labels Apply/Remove Status Click Status Select the status you wish to apply for the stage they are currently in. You can also Create a new status for the stage the application is in. Email the Applicant If an applicant needs to be contacted directly regarding their application, the email can be sent using the email action located within this screen directly above the Notes tab. The icon is identified by the mail symbol. To send an email from this view: Select the Email icon Add your subject title Add any required attachments by selecting Choose File Add your message or select the Email Templates icon to use an existing template for your message The recipients list will be populated to include all owners and collaborators of the application. If needed, add more recipients by selecting Add Extra Recipients . Select Send Immediately or customize the send date by selecting On and adding the date and time to send the email Select Send Now . If a future date has been selected, selecting Schedule Email will line up the email to send the day that was chosen and the time selected. TIP! To remove any collaborators or extra recipients from receiving the message, select the 'x' icon next to a recipients' name. Download an Application To keep a copy of the application and any required material a download feature has also been added to this screen. To download an application: Select the Download icon Customize the download settings Select Download Learn more about choosing your download settings . More Actions There are also a few additional actions you can take on the application from within this section: Show the Application to the Applicant Hide the Application from the Applicant Lock the Application Unlock the Application Archive the Application Unarchive the Application Move to Trash Restore from Trash Summary Tab The summary is one of the four main tabs within this view that aim to separate the various components of an application. Four headings within this tab aim to relay application owner information and application status data: Description Applicants The application owner and all collaborators will be found here. Administrators can navigate to a user's profile by selecting the name of the user within this section. Details This section is dedicated to displaying details of the application related to its status including when the application was last edited, first submitted, labels associated with the application, and more. Custom Fields Custom application custom fields for the application are displayed here. These fields are editable, but can also be updated through data imports or automations. Workflow This section provides the admin a quick visual of where the application currently lies within the program's workflow. This is presented by outlining the application's current stage and presenting a star next to the stage number. Application Tab This tab will display all program tasks and identify whether the task has been completed for the application you are viewing by providing a Complete or Incomplete status. To view a task completed for that application simply select the task name or any hyperlinked uploads. The Jump to icon allows administrators to quickly navigate to a specific task to avoid having to navigate through the complete task list. When a task is selected from the list the page will automatically scroll the page to the specific task within the list. There are numerous actions that can be completed within this tab: Reset a Task Hide or Show Tasks Approve/Decline External Tasks Reset a Task This action cannot be reverted. Resetting a task will clear all collected responses including uploaded files, collaborator requests, etc. completed by the applicant. To reset a task: Locate the task from the task list. Select the More Options icon. Select Reset Task . You will be asked "Are you sure that you want to reset this task?" Click Yes . Hide or Show Tasks Tasks that are hidden/shown from the applicant will update the visibility of the task in the applicant's task list. Tasks that are required will no longer be considered required for that applicant if the task has been hidden. To hide or show a task from an applicant: Locate the task from the task list. Select the More Options icon. Select Hide task from applicant or Show task to applicant . You will be asked "Are you sure that you want to hide/show this task from the applicant?" Click Yes . Only one option will be available at a time. The option will be updated once the task has been hidden or shown to the applicant. As an example, if the only option available is to show the task then that signals that the task is currently hidden from the applicant. Approve/Decline External Tasks External tasks can also be approved from this view. Once the applicant has completed the external task, an administrator will be given two choices within the details of the task titled Confirm Incomplete and Confirm Complete. If the icons are not visible then you will need to expand the task by selecting the down arrow located directly to the right of the More Options icon. Review Tab This tab will display all review stages in your workflow and identify whether the task in that stage has been completed by the assigned Reviewer(s) by providing a Complete or Incomplete status. This status will appear underneath the name of the assigned Reviewer. To view a review task completed for that application simply select the task name or any hyperlinked uploads. Only In Progress or Completed Reviews will be displayed here. Reviews that have not been started yet will not appear. Jump to a specific review by selecting the icon and the desired review task. This reduces the amount of navigation for administrators by scrolling the page directly to the review task within the completed review list. Administrators can reset a task by locating the review task from the task list, selecting the More Options icon, then selecting Reset Task. Resetting a task will clear the reviewers entire review. This action cannot be reverted. Notes Tab Review completed notes, add a new note, or communicate with assigned reviewers via email. All shared notes added by fellow administrators and site reviewers will be visible here. For more information on this feature, see Notes . Decision History Tab Once you have made a decision on whether the application should be Awarded or Declined, the details of the decision will be recorded in this tab. Description Decision Displays "Awarded" or "Declined" based on the decision selected Value Only applicable to Awarded Applications, add/edit the value that you wish to give to the application Date Displays the Date/ Time the decision was made Related Articles July 2025 August 2025 June 2025 English Company SurveyMonkey About Us Jobs Blog Help SurveyMonkey Help GetFeedback Help Market Research Help SurveyMonkey Audience Help SurveyMonkey Contribute Help Wufoo Help Apply Help Support Site Status Unsubscribe Contact Us Email Opt-In Policies Legal Center Privacy Policy Cookies Notice California Privacy Notice Copyright © 1999-2025 SurveyMonkey BBB credentials logo TrustedSite logo

Title: Field Types
Text: Field Types | Wufoo Help Log in Wufoo In this article Standard Fields Fancy Pants Fields Help Build a Form Field Types Field Types Wufoo Field Types Standard Fields Fancy Pants Fields Fields are the building blocks of forms—they let you collect data from the people who fill out your form. There are lots of field types you can add to your form so you collect the right kind of data, in the right format. You can add fields from the Form Builder. Standard Fields Standard Fields usually don't have any built-in validation—they're simple, flexible fields that accept a wide range of inputs from people filling out your form. Single Line Text Paragraph Text Number Multiple Choice Dropdown Checkboxes Section Break (This field doesn't collect data—it adds a section header and paragraph text to your form) Page Break (This field doesn't collect data—it adds a new page so you can split your form into multiple pages) Fancy Pants Fields Fancy Pants Fields are already set up to accept specific types of data from people filling out your form. These fields are either formatted or validated to collect certain types of data, in a consistent format. In some cases, using the right Fancy Pants field also ensures that your data is presented in the most useful way in the Entry Manager. Name Address Email Phone Price Rating Date Time Website Likert File Upload Related Articles DocuSign Field Building a Form Getting Started with Wufoo Company SurveyMonkey About Us Jobs Blog Help SurveyMonkey Help GetFeedback Help Market Research Help SurveyMonkey Audience Help SurveyMonkey Contribute Help Wufoo Help Apply Help Support Site Status Unsubscribe Contact Us Email Opt-In Policies Legal Center Privacy Policy Cookies Notice California Privacy Notice Copyright © 1999-2025 SurveyMonkey BBB credentials logo TrustedSite logo

Title: Limiting Answers to a Specific Range
Text: Limiting Answers to a Specific Range | Wufoo Help Log in Wufoo Help Build a Form Field Settings Limiting Answers to a Specific Range Wufoo Limiting Answers to a Specific Range The Range setting lets you apply a range or limit on the answers a field will accept. For Single Line Text and Paragraph Text fields, you can set a minimum and maximum word count or character count. For Number fields, you can set a minimum and maximum range of values, or number of digits. To apply a range of accepted answers: Log in and go to Forms . Click the form you want to edit. Click a Single Line Text, Paragraph Text, or Number field to open the Field Settings. In the Range section, add a minimum and maximum number. In the dropdown menu, select the unit you want the range to apply to (Words, Characters, Value, Digits). Click Save Form . To make it easy for people fill out your form correctly, we automatically add instructional text under the field to reflect the range you defined. If you set a character or word limit, we show a counter that indicates how many words or characters are remaining. If someone enters an answer outside of the range you define, we'll show them an error message when they submit the page. The error message is updated to reflect the range as well, so the person taking your form will know exactly how to fix their answer. Title: Manage Users: Overview
Text: Manage Users: Overview | Apply Help Log in Apply In this article How to Access Manage Users Role Tabs Customize Columns in the User Table Applying Filters Searching For Users Manage Users Actions Video Overview Help Monitor Manage Users Manage Users: Overview Apply Manage Users: Overview How to Access Manage Users Role Tabs Customize Columns in the User Table Applying Filters Searching For Users Manage Users Actions Video Overview Manage Users acts as your hub for all things related to users within your site including Applicants, Reviewers, and Recommenders. This article will provide an overview of what the Manage Users section looks like, as well as different actions you can take from this section that can be useful to you as an administrator of the site. How to Access Manage Users The Manage Users screen is used to locate users with your site either individually or by identifying a relationship between users by applying filters. From here, administrators can view user profiles, change the role of a user, export user data, and much more. See the Actions section for more details. To access Manage Users: Click on the Manage Users icon in the top right corner of your screen. Role Tabs Whenever you enter Manage Users you are presented with a list of users within your site. At the top of the page are four tabs representing the user roles of SM Apply. Selecting one of these tabs provides a quick breakdown of the number of users in the Role selected. Each tab will also show different columns associated with the Role selected. For example, the Reviewer tab displays a progress bar relating to reviews completed. The tabs available in Manage Users are: Role Description All Users The All Users tab will display all users that exist in your site no matter which role they belong to. By default, there is basic information that is displayed for each user. Applicants Applicants are the users in your site who will be applying to your award or program. They will have access to the applicant tasks you have created for your program. Within each program, you can also set-up application labels to further sort and distinguish your applicants Reviewers Reviewers are the users that will be assigned to rank and review the applications created by your applicants. They will have access to tasks within the Simple and Advanced Review stages , depending on the stages they are assigned to . Recommenders In some cases, you may require applicants to gain a referral or recommendation for their application. Applicants can use the “Get a Recommendation” task to invite a recommender to their application. This will automatically create an account for that user and add them to the recommender role. These users will have access to the recommender task that is associated with the "Get a Recommendation" task completed by the applicant. Customize Columns in the User Table Along with the default columns details above, you have the ability to Add and remove columns from the table, which will allow you to customize the information displayed to suit your needs. Add Columns to the User Table Click the Columns button located beside the search bar. Select the Column(s) you wish to add. Column Description ID Display the Unique ID given to the user when their account is created within Apply. Language Display the Default Language that this user is using to access the site. Timezone Display the timezone that the user has selected for their account. Custom Fields Add your Role-targeted Custom Fields fields as additional columns. Depending on which Role tab you are in (All, Applicant, Reviewer, or Recommender) will alter which Role-targeted custom field will display. Remove Columns from the User Table To remove columns from the table: Click the Columns icon. Remove any selection of columns that you no longer want to be included in the table. Select Done to refresh the table. Adding a column to your table will only add it to the user tab you are currently viewing. For example, if you add the ID to All Users, it will not automatically be added to the other tabs Applying Filters You have the ability to filter your users to locate and report on users within your site. See How to Filter Users for more information. Searching For Users There are multiple ways to locate user profiles within your site. For more information on locating users, see How to Search for Users . Manage Users Actions How to Perform Actions Available Actions How to Perform Actions Within the Manage Users section there are various actions that you can take on your users. You can perform these actions either individually or in bulk: Perform Actions on Individual Users Hover your cursor over the user you wish to perform an action on. Click on the More Options icon. Select the Action you wish to perform. Perform Actions in Bulk Select the Users you wish to perform an action on. Click Actions . Select the Action you wish to perform. Available Actions Actions that can be performed in Manage Users requires the selection of the Actions icon. Available actions and their descriptions follow. Action Description Change Role Update the role of a user profile. Add the user to a new role or remove the user from an existing role. Activate Activate a user's profile. This prevents this user from having to activate their profile using the confirmation link sent to their email inbox. Deactivate Deactivate a user's profile. Allows administrators to restrict access to the site from certain users. Send Invite Send an entry URL to the email address used for the username. The user will be prompted to either create a password (new account) or provide the password for their existing account. Export Export user data in the form of a report. Delete Delete a user profile from your SM Apply site. Title: SurveyMonkey App FAQs
Text: SurveyMonkey App FAQs | SurveyMonkey Help Log in SurveyMonkey In this article General Account Create Sending Surveys Analyzing Surveys Managing Surveys Taking Surveys Help Site SurveyMonkey App FAQs SurveyMonkey SurveyMonkey App FAQs General Account Create Sending Surveys Analyzing Surveys Managing Surveys Taking Surveys General What features are included in the SurveyMonkey app? You can use the app to create new surveys, or monitor existing surveys. The app includes the following features: Edit Create a survey from scratch, a template, or Build with AI Add, edit, or delete questions Add prewritten questions from our Question Bank Add descriptive text or images Choose to show or hide the survey title, page title, question numbers, or exit link Change the survey language Change the theme colors Move questions Add or delete pages Send Send web link collectors via your mobile email client, Facebook, Twitter, or text. Or, just copy the link from the app to distribute in other ways Allow multiple responses per device Use kiosk mode to collect responses directly on your device Analyze View pie charts, donut charts, or bar graphs of your results Filter responses Show or hide certain questions Browse individual responses Share responses Managing surveys Use folders Delete surveys Clear responses Open or close surveys Manage new response alerts View each survey's response count, completion rate, and the date and time of the most recent response Account Authenticating your account (Android only) If you're having trouble authenticating your account on your Android device, you may need to change your default browser to Chrome for the authentication process to complete. Check your phone manufacturer’s website for more info on how to change your default browser. Upgrading Your Account (iOS only) You can upgrade to a Standard monthly or Standard annual plan within the SurveyMonkey app. If you are interested in upgrading to an Advantage, Premier, or Enterprise plan, you can from our desktop site . Upgrading to Standard activates paid features such as unlimited questions and unlimited filters. You can also access the full set of Standard features when you access SurveyMonkey on our desktop site . To upgrade in the app: From the Home screen, tap the three lines icon to access the menu. Tap Upgrade . Tap either the Monthly or Annual option to go to the iTunes Store. Complete your purchase in the iTunes store. You can only upgrade one account for your Apple ID. If you need to upgrade additional accounts, please do so on our desktop site . Upgrading from Standard to a Higher Plan If you've already purchased a Standard plan through the iOS app and would like to upgrade your account to a higher plan type, please contact support . Since in-app purchases are handled by iTunes billing rather than SurveyMonkey, our support team needs to help you upgrade your account. Upgrading Your Account (Android only) You can no longer upgrade your account in-app for Android devices. To make changes to your plan, you can upgrade your account on the desktop site . Once you upgrade, you can download the app in Google Play, and log in with your SurveyMonkey username and password. SurveyMonkey and Privacy Rights SurveyMonkey is complying with applicable privacy regulations like the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA). Our features can help you to comply when using SurveyMonkey. SurveyMonkey account holders within or outside of the EU may be required to respond to requests from people who ask to exercise their privacy rights. Learn more about SurveyMonkey and Privacy Rights . Canceling Auto Renew (Android only) You can cancel auto-renewal on the My Account page: Log into your account at www.surveymonkey.com Click your username in the upper right corner. Click My Account . Click the Billing Details tab. Under Billing Profile , click Cancel next to Auto-renew. Click Cancel Auto-Renew . The account will downgrade to the free Basic plan at the end of the billing period. If your account is HIPAA-enabled, the account will instead go into a suspended state at the end of the billing period. See SurveyMonkey's cancellation policy for more information on canceling your account. Canceling Auto Renew (iOS only) I purchased my paid plan through the SurveyMonkey app. If you wish to cancel auto-renewal, you can manage your subscription through the Apple App Store: http://support.apple.com/kb/ht4098 I purchased my paid plan on the SurveyMonkey website. If your purchased your paid plan on the SurveyMonkey website, you can cancel auto-renewal on the My Account page: Log into your account at www.surveymonkey.com Click your username in the upper right corner. Click My Account . Click the Billing Details tab. Under Billing Profile , click Cancel next to Auto-renew. Click Cancel Auto-Renew . The account will downgrade to the free Basic plan at the end of the billing period. If your account is HIPAA-enabled, the account will instead go into a suspended state at the end of the billing period. See SurveyMonkey's cancellation policy for more information on canceling your account. Adding and Managing Team Members If you are an admin for a SurveyMonkey team plan you can use your mobile app to add and manage users on your team. SurveyMonkey team plans let you collaborate on surveys with other users. If you don’t have a team plan, learn how to create one and read more about how team billing works . From your Home screen you can use the Team Status panel to: Add new users to your team View how many seats you’ve used and how many are available View the number of active users on your team View the number of users whose invites are pending From the Team Update panel you can see how many invites haven’t been accepted and send invite reminders. To invite a new user: Either tap Add Users from your Home screen or tap a from the My Team screen. Enter an email address for the user you want to invite. Tap Send Invitation . If you haven’t already purchased a seat, you’ll be asked to confirm the purchase. You’re billed team overages for each invitation sent that exceeds the number of seats available on the team. Tip! You can use the web app to create and manage a team sign up page . From the My Team page you can manage and view your team’s members. Tap on a Pending user to: Resend their invitation email Copy their invitation link Cancel the invitation Tap on an Active user to: Reassign their account along with all of the surveys and data contained within it to another user. You’re not charged for reassigning accounts. Permanently delete their account along with all of the survey and data contained in it. This frees up a seat on your team. Changing Your Username, Email, or Password To change your username, contact email, or password: From the Home screen, tap the Account icon. Tap the field you want to update to change it. Create Expand | Collapse Move, Copy, or Delete Questions or Pages Questions To move, copy, or delete a question: On the Edit screen, tap the settings icon in the upper right corner. Tap Copy, Move, or Delete . To move a question: Tap and hold the three lines next to the question you want to move, and drag and drop the question into the desired position in the survey. To copy a question: Swipe left on the question you want to copy, and tap Copy. To delete a question: Swipe left on the question you want to delete, and tap Delete. Pages To move a page: On the Edit screen, tap the page numbers at the bottom of the screen. Tap and hold the page number you want to move. Drag the page to the desired position. To delete a page: On the Edit screen, tap the page count at the bottom of the screen and select the page you want to delete. Tap the page count at the bottom of the page again and select delete. Changing the Survey's Theme and Display Options The SurveyMonkey app offers some ability to change the look and feel of your survey. You can choose from a selection of pre-made color themes, and configure a few display options to show or hide certain elements of the survey, like the survey title or question numbers. NOTE: You can't customize themes on the SurveyMonkey app. Please log into your account on our desktop site to customize the name, colors, and typography of your survey theme. To change a survey's theme: On the Edit screen, tap . in the upper right corner. Tap Color Themes . Tap the preferred color scheme to apply it to your survey. To show or hide the survey title, page title, or question numbers: On the Edit screen, tap the Settings icon in the upper right corner. Tap Display Options . Tap the toggle next to each survey element to show or hide that element. If the toggle is green (on), that element shows to survey takers when they take your survey. If the toggle is white (off), that element is hidden from survey takers. Tap Save . Adding and Editing Questions To add a question to a survey: On the Edit screen, tap the circled Plus icon. Tap the question type you want to add. Enter the question text and answer choices. Tap Save . To edit a question: On the Edit screen, tap the question you want to edit. Make your changes. Tap Save . You can currently add the following question types on the SurveyMonkey app: Multiple Choice Dropdown Comment Box/Paragraph Matrix/Rating Image Text You can edit all question types with the app, except A/B Tests (Random Assignment). To access all available question types and options, log into your account at www.surveymonkey.com. Creating and Previewing a Survey for Mobile As you create your survey, keep in mind that many of your survey takers may take the survey on their phone or tablet. It's important to consider how the survey appears on a mobile screen, and how that can affect mobile completion rates. When creating a survey for mobile survey takers: Use simple multiple choice question types. Be as clear and concise as possible; avoid long descriptions. Limit the number of answer options so that all choices are visible on the screen at the same time. Limit your use of the Comment Box/Paragraph question. Open-ended question types have a negative impact on mobile survey completion rates. Distribute questions over multiple, short pages, rather than creating just a few, long pages. If you add an image, keep in mind that mobile users' limited network download speed can cause the image to load slowly. Preview the survey on your own mobile device before sending it to survey takers. To preview your survey: On the Edit screen, tap the Settings icon in the upper right corner. Tap Preview & Test . Fill out the survey as though you were a survey taker. This helps you confirm that the design is set up correctly, and help you find any parts of the survey you may want to edit or fix. You can read more about the data behind these tips on our blog: How to Keep Your Survey Takers Happy on Mobile (English only) Sending Surveys Expand | Collapse Run Your Survey in a Loop with Kiosk Mode With Kiosk Mode you can turn your device into a survey taking station. When Kiosk Mode is running, your survey runs in a loop, returning to the beginning of the survey each time a response is collected. In order to run a survey using Kiosk Mode, the survey needs to be set to Allow Multiple Responses . To run a survey in kiosk mode: Click the Surveys icon. Select the survey you want survey takers to take. Tap Send . Turn on Multiple responses per device . Tap Kiosk Mode . Select whether you want to Continue without Screen Lock or Continue with Screen Lock . With screen lock on, your SurveyMonkey password needs to be entered into the device to exit Kiosk mode. To exit Kiosk mode: Tap the X in the top corner of your survey Tap Close Kiosk Mode . If you have Screen Lock on, you’ll also be prompted to enter your SurveyMonkey password. Sending Your Survey to Survey Takers You can send a web link collector to survey takers using the SurveyMonkey app or collect responses directly on your device. To send a survey link: Tap the Surveys icon. Tap the survey you want to send. Tap Send . If there are multiple collectors on the survey, you’re prompted to choose an existing web link collector. Select from the following options for sending your survey: Tap the Survey Link and choose Copy Link or Open in Safari . Send via Email - Create an email message in your default mail client. The survey link is included in the body of the message. This is different than SurveyMonkey's email collector which allows you to send and track survey takers using SurveyMonkey's mailer. To use SurveyMonkey's email collector, log into our desktop site . Send via Text - Send your survey link to others via SMS or iMessage. Share to Facebook - Share your survey link on Facebook. Share on Twitter - Share your survey link on Twitter. If your survey takers are using a shared computer (e.g. in a computer lab), or if each of your survey takers needs to submit multiple surveys, tap the toggle next to Multiple responses per device to allow multiple responses per device. To collect responses on your device: Tap the Surveys icon. Tap the survey you want to send. Tap Send . Select Kiosk Mode to collect responses directly on your device. Once the Kiosk Mode survey is completed, you can choose to either Return to Start to enter a new response, or Close Kiosk Mode to return to the app. The Kiosk Mode options control whether or not your SurveyMonkey password is required to return to the app: Continue without Screen Lock - You’re able to return to the SurveyMonkey app without having to enter your SurveyMonkey password. This option is ideal if you are using Kiosk Mode to manually enter your own responses. Continue with Screen Lock - You need to enter your SurveyMonkey password in order to return to the app. This option is ideal if you plan to collect responses in a setting where the survey takers are using your device. Analyzing Surveys Expand | Collapse Sharing Your Results You can create a Shared Data link to share your results online. To create a Shared Data link: Tap the Surveys icon. Tap the survey whose results you want to share. Tap Analyze . Tap the Three dots icon in the upper-right corner. Tap Share Data . Tap Add Link to create a new page or tap an existing share link to edit it. Configure the settings at the bottom of the screen. Choose an option for sending the share link. You can also tap the link itself to Copy link or Open it in your mobile browser. Log in to your account on www.surveymonkey.com to access more Shared Data settings. Disabling or Deleting Share Links When someone tries to access a disabled or deleted share link, they see a message that the shared data is unavailable. To disable a share link: On the Share Data page, tap the shared data link you want to disable. Under Settings, tap the toggle next to Status: Enabled . This turns the status to Disabled . You can tap the toggle again to reactivate the link at any time. To delete a share link: On the Share Data page, swipe left on the shared data link you want to delete. Tap Delete. Viewing and Filtering Survey Responses You can view a summary of your survey results or browse individual responses. To view a summary of your survey results: Tap the Surveys icon. Tap the survey whose results you want to view. Tap Analyze . You can change the chart type shown for a question by tapping on it. If you have a Net Promoter Score question in your survey, your score is be presented on a gauge chart. You cannot change this chart type in the app. Tapping on a question also lets you create a filter on your results. Paid customers can filter survey results for closed-ended questions. Mobile filters create a quick view of your data and cannot be saved. To use saved filters, login to your SurveyMonkey account on our desktop site . To browse individual responses: On the Analyze screen, tap the Respondents icon at the top of the screen. Choose the individual response you want to view from the list. From there, you can tap the arrows to browse through the other responses. Managing Surveys Expand | Collapse Managing Survey Alerts If you have Survey Alerts turned on, we send you push notifications and emails when you receive new responses. You can turn survey alerts off for individual surveys. If you turn off push notifications for the SurveyMonkey app, you will no longer receive email alerts. There are two kinds of survey alerts: All Surveys : Receive alerts when you get your first response to a new survey and on days you get responses to any active survey. New Surveys Only : Only receive alerts when new surveys get their first response. To manage survey alerts: Tap the Profile icon. Tap New Responses under Notifications. Select which kind of alerts you want. Tap Done . To turn survey alerts on or off for an individual survey: Tap the Surveys icon. Tap the survey whose results you want to view. Toggle New Response Alerts under Settings. Closing a Survey to Stop Collecting Responses To stop collecting responses, you must close all collectors on the survey. If there are any open collectors on the survey, the overall survey status remains open. To close a collector: Tap the Surveys icon. Tap the survey whose results you want to view. On the Summary page, you can close your survey by changing the survey status: If there is only one collector, tap the toggle next to Survey Status Open . If there are multiple collectors, tap Status: Open . Tap the toggle next to the collector(s) you want to close. When survey takers try to access the survey through a closed collector, they see a closed survey message. If you need to edit or customize the closed survey message, you can login to your SurveyMonkey account on our desktop site . TIP! To re-open the collector, tap the Closed status. Taking Surveys Taking Surveys with SurveyMonkey Contribute SurveyMonkey Contribute is no longer available in the SurveyMonkey app, but you can still access your account at contribute.surveymonkey.com . If you want to take surveys on your mobile device, download the SurveyMonkey Rewards app for iOS or Android. SurveyMonkey Rewards lets you take surveys to earn gift cards or donate to your favorite charity. Related Articles SurveyMonkey Rewards FAQs SurveyMonkey Anywhere FAQs File Won’t Upload English Company SurveyMonkey About Us Jobs Blog Help SurveyMonkey Help GetFeedback Help Market Research Help SurveyMonkey Audience Help SurveyMonkey Contribute Help Wufoo Help Apply Help Support Site Status Unsubscribe Contact Us Email Opt-In Policies Legal Center Privacy Policy Cookies Notice California Privacy Notice Copyright © 1999-2025 SurveyMonkey BBB credentials logo TrustedSite logo

Title: Indexing your Form Fields for Calculations
Text: Indexing your Form Fields for Calculations | Apply Help Log in Apply In this article How to Set Up your Question Variable Question Identifier Index Indexing a Single Column Question Indexing a Single Cell Index an Entire Column Index a Range of Cells Indexing a Multi-Column Question Index a Single Cell Index the Entire Column Index the Entire Row Index a Range of Cells Indexing the Score of a Question Help Advanced Features Indexing your Form Fields for Calculations Apply Indexing your Form Fields for Calculations How to Set Up your Question Variable Question Identifier Index Indexing a Single Column Question Indexing a Single Cell Index an Entire Column Index a Range of Cells Indexing a Multi-Column Question Index a Single Cell Index the Entire Column Index the Entire Row Index a Range of Cells Indexing the Score of a Question Grid Indexing is the process of referring to a specific cell within a grid in order to use that value in your Advanced Expression Piping formula. This article will walk through how SurveyMonkey Apply will index the cell within the grid or column. This indexing will be used through the rest of the How To articles for the AEP functions. How to Set Up your Question Variable When setting up your advanced expression piping variable you will need to set up the Reference to the question that you are looking to use in the formula. A question variable consists of two parts: The Identifier of the Question + The Index to the specific cell(s)/row/column of that question Where the format of the question variable could be either: identifier[index] identifier.index Question Identifier A question identifier is used to target a specific question within a form and is required for AEP. Question identifiers within a single form must be unique in order for the expression to reference the intended cell successfully. Index The index will always be a numerical value to determine the placement of the cell/row/column within the question. Indexing will always begin at 0 for the first cell, in the first row and column. Question 1 (q1) Column 1 Row 1 [0] (Start here!) Row 2 [1] Row 3 [2] Indexing a Single Column Question If you have set up a Single Column Question the questions numerical index will increment from top to bottom. There are three index options available to you with single-column grid questions: Indexing a Single Cell In some cases, you may wish to reference a single cell in your table. For example, you only want to pull the response given in row 3. Below is an illustration of the Index: Question 1 (q1) Column 1 Row 1 [0] Row 2 [1] Row 3 [2] Again, the index always begins with [0] where the index of Row 1/ Column 1 = [0], Row 2/ Column 1 = [1], etc. Therefore, to reference the single cell in Row 3 , our question variable will be q1[2] . Index an Entire Column Since there is only one column in this question. If you wish to total the entire question, you can just use the identifier, and this will automatically include all cells within the question. Index a Range of Cells In some cases, you may want to index more than just one cell, but not an entire column. Therefore, we allow the ability to index a range of cells at once. In order to index a range our question variable will be: identifier[Lower:Upper] TIP! The lower value (first value) is inclusive, therefore this is where the range will start. However, the upper value (second value) is exclusive , therefore the range will end with the cell prior. Question 1 (q1) Column 1 Row 1 [0] Row 2 [1] Row 3 [2] Using the example above: To index Row 1 and Row 2: q1[0:2] To index Row 2 and Row 3: q1[1:3] Since the lower value is exclusive , we reference the last cell [2] + 1 = [3] to ensure all cells including the final cell is included in the range. If the index stated q1[1:2], the final cell placed at row 3 column 2 would not have been included in the range. Indexing a Multi-Column Question Indexing in a Multi-Column Question, is slightly different than a Single Column question , in that the index values increment from Left to Right, Top to Bottom . This section will walk through how to set up your indexing if using a Multi-Column question . Index a Single Cell In some cases, you may wish to reference a single cell in your table for example you only want to pull the response given in Row 1/ Column 2. As mentioned previously, the indexing will always be a numerical value beginning at 0. Below is an illustration of the Index: Question 2 (q2) Column 1 Column 2 Column 3 Row 1 [0] [1] [2] Row 2 [3] [4] [5] Where the index of Row 1/ Column 1 = [0], Row 1/ Column 2 = [1], Row 2/Column 3 = [3] etc. Therefore, if we want to reference the single cell in Row 1/ Column 2 , our Question Variable will be q2[1] . If we want to reference a single cell in Row 2/ Column 3 , our Question Variable would be q2[5] . Index the Entire Column If we want to reference all values in a column, for example to find the SUM of the column, we can do so by simply indexing the column. The format for this is slightly different than a single cell and is formatted as: identifier[:columnindex] The colon (":") before the index in this case states that we are referencing the whole column. Again, the index will begin at [0]. This is very similar to Single-Column grids, however now we have multiple columns to reference from. Question 2 (q2) Column 1 [:0] Column 2 [:1] Column 3 [:2] Row 1 Row 2 Therefore, if we want to reference the entire Column 2 , our Question Variable will be q2[:1] . Index the Entire Row If we want to reference the values in a row, for example find the Average of the row, we can do so by indexing the row. The format for this is slightly different than a single cell and the column reference: identifier[rowindex:] The colon (":") after the index in this case states that we are referencing the whole row. Again, the index will begin at [0]. Question 2 (q2) Column 1 Column 2 Column 3 Row 1 [0:] Row 2 [1:] Therefore, if we want to reference the entire Row 2 , our Question Variable will be q2[1:] Index a Range of Cells In some cases, you may want to index more than just one cell, but not the entire table. Therefore, we allow the ability to index a range of cells at once. In order to index a range our question variable will be: identifier[Lower:Upper] The Lower value is inclusive therefore this is where the range will start, however the Upper value is exclusive, therefore the range will end with the cell prior. Question 2 (q2) Column 1 Column 2 Column 3 Row 1 [0] [1] [2] Row 2 [3] [4] [5] For this example, if we want to index Row 1/ Column 1 to Row 2/ Column 2 , our question variable would be q2[0:5] If we wish to index Row 1/Column 2 to Row 2/ Column 3 , our question variable will be q2[1:6]. Indexing for a multi-column grid goes from left to right, top to bottom, it is only possible to index a range by cells. You will not be able to only index a range within a single column. For example, if there are 3 rows, you cannot index only Row 1/Column 2 and Row 2/Column 2 using range indexing. Indexing the Score of a Question Within ranking forms , you are able to add point values to form choices that are allocated to the total score of the application when the reviewer makes the selection. In the case that we need to later reference the score given to a particular question we can do so by using the following format: identifier.score The identifier will vary depending on the question that is selected and ".score" signals that we are trying to extract the score from that specific question. Consider an example where 2 multiple choice questions have custom scores allocated to each choice within the question. These questions have been labelled with the identifiers q3 and q4 respectively. We can extract the scores given to the final review score of the application using the question variables: q3.score q4.score This can come in extremely handy in the case where you are looking to pull the SUM or Average (AVG) of reviewer questions within a single form, or if you would like to display and/or report on scores from specific sections of a review form. Related Articles July 2025 August 2025 June 2025 English Company SurveyMonkey About Us Jobs Blog Help SurveyMonkey Help GetFeedback Help Market Research Help SurveyMonkey Audience Help SurveyMonkey Contribute Help Wufoo Help Apply Help Support Site Status Unsubscribe Contact Us Email Opt-In Policies Legal Center Privacy Policy Cookies Notice California Privacy Notice Copyright © 1999-2025 SurveyMonkey BBB credentials logo TrustedSite logo

Title: Campaign Monitor
Text: Campaign Monitor | Wufoo Help Log in Wufoo In this article Mapping Form Fields to Campaign Monitor Integration Errors Help Integrations Other Integrations Campaign Monitor Wufoo Campaign Monitor Mapping Form Fields to Campaign Monitor Integration Errors PAID FEATURE: Integrations are only available on paid plans . Campaign Monitor offers everything a designer needs to run successful email marketing campaigns for themselves and their clients. This integration can automatically add a new contact to your campaign list whenever contact information is collected through a Wufoo form. Let some sign up for a mailing list through your Wufoo form or collect your email subscriber’s contact information. Form Requirements In Wufoo, make sure to include a single Checkboxes field that let’s users opt-in to your mailing list and an Email field . Optionally, your form can also collect a name and any custom fields you’re using in Campaign Monitor Adding the Integration Log in and go to Forms To the right of the form, If you're using legacy Wufoo, click Edit then click Add integrations . If you're using the new Wufoo experience , click the . More icon then click Integrations . Select Campaign Monitor from the dropdown menu and click Add Integration . In the new box that appears, click Connect to Campaign Monitor . Make sure your browser is not blocking popups from Wufoo. Log into your Campaign Monitor account and click Allow Access . In the integration setup panel, leave SurveyMonkey selected in the Client List and click Next . Select the Campaign Monitor campaign list you want to add contacts to from the Client List dropdown. Select your form’s opt-in field from the Only send if choice is checked dropdown. Click Match Fields and select how your form’s fields should map to data in Campaign Monitor. For example, select the field where people will enter an email address from the email dropdown. Read more about mapping fields to Campaign Monitor below. Click Save . TIP! Avoid spamming your users by setting up Confirmed Opt-In (double opt-in) in Campaign Monitor. Mapping Form Fields to Campaign Monitor Default Fields Campaign Monitor subscriber lists have 2 default fields that will appear in the mapping window: Email: The email address of the subscriber (required) Name: The name of the subscriber (optional) Custom Fields You can also map your form’s fields to any Custom fields you are using in Campaign Manager. Custom fields can store additional contact information such as a subscriber’s address, city, country, phone number or other relevant data such as interests, birthdays or answers to a survey. Campaign Monitor Custom Fields may be no greater than 250 characters in length. We suggest you match them up to Wufoo single line text fields because they have a 255 character limit. Wufoo Multiple Choice, Dropdowns and Checkboxes choices must match their Campaign Monitor counterparts. This means, for example, that a Radio Field on the Wufoo side must have all the same options as the Multi-Value Custom Field field in Campaign Monitor and a custom field that accepts predetermined values, for example, Country or US States, should only accept those same values on the matching Wufoo field. An integration submitted with a mismatch of these options will result in empty values in your Campaign Monitor custom field. Integration Errors We'll send you an automated email you if we notice any errors with the integration. Error Description 204 Email Address exists in Suppression List If you’ve previously suppressed this address you can’t resubmit it through the API until you remove it from the suppression list. Any Other Error Code Undocumented error, please contact support. Title: Use CSS to Style Your Survey
Text: Use CSS to Style Your Survey | SurveyMonkey Help Log in SurveyMonkey In this article Creating a Custom CSS Theme Updating a Custom CSS Theme Customizing Page Elements General Properties Page Title Survey Title Survey Page Question Title Question Body Button Error Page Layout Help Teams & Enterprise Use CSS to Style Your Survey SurveyMonkey Use CSS to Style Your Survey Creating a Custom CSS Theme Updating a Custom CSS Theme Customizing Page Elements General Properties Page Title Survey Title Survey Page Question Title Question Body Button Error Page Layout ENTERPRISE FEATURE: If you're interested, contact sales . If you already have an Enterprise account, contact your Customer Success Manager. Enterprise Primary Admins can add CSS to create a custom survey theme to brand the look of your survey. You can create a custom theme to make global style changes. Use the text formatting toolbar to make style changes unique to a specific survey question. Creating a Custom CSS Theme Primary Admins can add CSS for a custom survey theme that matches your visual assets, fonts, colors, and style preferences. To add a new Custom Theme to the library: Select My Team from the main navigation and select Library . Select + New Item (Add item). Choose CSS Theme. Select Copy code and paste in your preferred CSS editing tool. Make customizations to the code and then see a preview by adding it to the box under Customize theme and selecting Generate preview . Select Save . TIP! Preview your Custom CSS theme before sending out your survey. Using Survey Preview to see your CSS Custom Theme You can see exactly how your Survey looks with the Custom CSS theme applied by using Survey Preview: Create a Custom CSS theme and save. Open a new SurveyMonkey window or tab. In the new window or tab, go to Design Survey . Apply the Custom CSS theme to your Survey. Go to Preview Survey . You will now see the Custom CSS theme applied to your survey. TIP! Refresh the page every time you make a change in the CSS Custom theme. Make sure to click Save before you refresh. Updating a Custom CSS Theme Once a Custom CSS theme has been saved, only the Primary Admin can edit or change the page elements. To edit a Custom Theme: Select My Team from the main navigation and select Library . Select ... and click Update . Choose CSS Theme. Select Copy code and paste in your preferred CSS editing tool. Make customizations to the code and then see a preview by adding it to the box under Customize theme and selecting Generate preview . Select Save . Team members can't change or edit individual elements of a survey with a Custom CSS theme applied. Customizing Page Elements Here are the page elements you can customize with CSS. General Properties CSS Property String Value Font Family Your organization may have a preferred Font Family. Currently you can only use fonts listed in CSS Web Safe Fonts . Font Size A number eg. 32px Color Use a color picker to generate your color's RGBA value. Background Color Will either be a HEX code or RGBA value. Page Title You can add Page Titles to the different pages in your survey to keep it nice and organized. #pageTitle { color: rgba(0,0,96,1); background-color: #A1F3FB; font-family: National2; font-size: 24; font-style: NORMAL; font-weight: REGULAR; text-decoration: NONE; } TIP! Use a color picker to generate your color's RGBA value , or hex code . Changing the font style CSS Property Possible Values font-style INHERIT INITIAL ITALIC NORMAL OBLIQUE Changing the font weight CSS Property Possible Values font-weight BOLD LIGHT MEDIUM REGULAR ULTRALIGHT Changing the text decoration CSS Property Possible Values text-decoration NONE UNDERLINE Survey Title The survey title will appear at the top of each survey page as your respondents take the survey, unless you choose to hide the title. #surveyTitle { color: rgba(0,0,96,1); font-family: National2; font-size: 26; font-style: NORMAL; font-weight: BOLD; text-decoration: NONE; } Changing the font style CSS Property Possible Values font-style INHERIT INITIAL ITALIC NORMAL OBLIQUE Changing the font weight CSS Property Possible Values font-weight BOLD LIGHT MEDIUM REGULAR ULTRALIGHT Changing the text decoration CSS Property Possible Values text-decoration NONE UNDERLINE Survey Page The background color that appears behind the questions in your survey. The survey background color will only show if you haven't added a background image. #surveyPage { background-color: rgba(137,230,243,1); } #surveyPageSecondaryColor { background-color: rgba(84,213,231,1); } TIP! Use a color picker to generate your color's RGBA value. Question Title You can customize how the question text will look in a variety of question types . #questionTitle { color: rgba(0,0,96,1); font-family: National2; font-size: 22; font-style: NORMAL; font-weight: LIGHT; text-decoration: NONE; } Changing the font style CSS Property Possible Values font-style INHERIT INITIAL ITALIC NORMAL OBLIQUE Changing the font weight CSS Property Possible Values font-weight BOLD LIGHT MEDIUM REGULAR ULTRALIGHT Changing the text decoration CSS Property Possible Values text-decoration NONE UNDERLINE Question Body You can customize what the answer choices will look like to respondents, as well as question types that use a highlight color when selected. For example, a Multiple Choice question . #questionBody { color: rgba(0,0,96,1); font-family: National2; font-size: 18; font-style: NORMAL; font-weight: LIGHT; text-decoration: NONE; highlight-color: rgba(31,216,234,1); } Changing the font style CSS Property Possible Values font-style INHERIT INITIAL ITALIC NORMAL OBLIQUE Changing the font weight CSS Property Possible Values font-weight BOLD LIGHT MEDIUM REGULAR ULTRALIGHT Changing the text decoration CSS Property Possible Values text-decoration NONE UNDERLINE Button People taking your survey use these buttons to navigate through a survey. When a respondent clicks the Next or Done button on each page of the survey, responses are saved and submitted . #button { font-family: National2; font-size: 15; font-weight: REGULAR; } Changing the font weight CSS Property Possible Values font-weight BOLD LIGHT MEDIUM REGULAR ULTRALIGHT Error Error messages are shown to respondents if they leave a required question blank, or if their answer doesn't meet the required range or limit. #error { font-size: 16; font-style: NORMAL; font-weight: LIGHT; text-decoration: NONE; } Changing the font style CSS Property Possible Values font-style INHERIT INITIAL ITALIC NORMAL OBLIQUE Changing the font weight CSS Property Possible Values font-weight BOLD LIGHT MEDIUM REGULAR ULTRALIGHT Changing the text decoration CSS Property Possible Values text-decoration NONE UNDERLINE Page Layout You can use the page layout to choose how and where your background color or image is displayed. #pageLayout { layout: banner; opacity: 0.0; } TIP! Set the opacity to 100 to have a solid background color. Title: Does each respondent get assigned a response ID?
Text: Does each respondent get assigned a response ID? | SurveyMonkey Help Log in SurveyMonkey Help Analyzing Results Does each respondent get assigned a response ID? SurveyMonkey Does each respondent get assigned a response ID? Each submitted response is assigned an ID number, called a Respondent ID . To view the Respondent ID, export your results. The numbers in the Analyze Results section show the order the responses were submitted in. However, this is not a unique number to the respondent. It is unique to the actual response itself: It does not mean that the same person will receive the same ID number if s/he submits a 2nd response. The new response will be assigned its own unique number. Title: Asana Integration
Text: Asana Integration | Wufoo Help Log in Wufoo In this article Adding the Integration Linking Fields Common Questions Help Integrations Other Integrations Asana Integration Wufoo Asana Integration Adding the Integration Linking Fields Common Questions The Asana integration is now run by Wufoo. If you’ve already been using the integration, please follow the steps below to reintegrate your forms. Paid Feature: Integrations are only available on paid plans. With the Asana integration, you can create forms to gather requests, bug reports, applicant information, and more. The integration lets you feed your form data directly into an Asana project to take action. Before setting up the integration, be sure to: Build a form Create a “home” project in Asana where form responses will be recorded TIP! This integration currently only supports single-page forms. Multi-page forms can sometimes result in data being cut off due to API limitations. Adding the Integration If you’re already using the Asana integration, please follow the steps to reintegrate your forms to Asana. If this is your first time ever using the Asana integration, you can follow the steps to integrate your form for the first time. To integrate your form with Asana for the first time: Log in and go to Forms . To the right of the form select the . More icon and choose Integrations . In the + to Another Application menu choose Asana . Select the Add Integration button. Enter your Personal Access Token (PAT) and select Next . Choose your Asana project and select Next . Check the box to Import Files as Attachments if needed, and Agree to the terms . Select Match Fields . To reintegrate your forms with Asana: Log in and go to Forms . To the right of the form select the . More icon and choose Integrations . If you see an existing Webhook for Asana, click the red ❌ to remove the current integration. Otherwise, move on to the next step. In the + to Another Application menu choose Asana . Select the Add Integration button. Enter your Personal Access Token (PAT) and select Next . Choose your Asana project and select Next . Review your PAT and chosen form, select Manage Form and Task Fields . Linking Fields From the Link project fields to form page, link Wufoo form fields to Asana task fields . All form fields will be included in your task description. To link fields to tasks: Under the Task Fields section, select the Task Name and set additional options. This field is translated to the task name in Asana. For the Task Due Date , select a Date field to be the task’s due date. If the field is left blank, the task will not have a due date. In the Task Assignee drop-down, set an assignee for the task that corresponds with an Email field in your form. Add any Task Followers that are tied to email field(s) in your form. If the field is left blank, no collaborators will be added. If the person is not already part of the organization, they will not be added as a collaborator. Where applicable, choose a Task Priority , CustomMultiSelect , CustomNumber , and CustomText . Select Save . Custom Field Type Description MultiSelect MultiSelect custom fields can be mapped to Checkboxes fields in Wufoo. Number Number custom fields can be mapped to any Number field in Wufoo. Text Text custom fields can be mapped to any Single Line Text , Paragraph Text , Multiple Choice , Dropdown , Name , or Email field in Wufoo. The choices in your Wufoo form must correspond exactly with the names of the choices in your custom field. TIP! Email addresses linked to any email fields entered in the Wufoo form need to correspond with an existing email in your Asana workspace. Common Question s I want to edit form fields that appear in the task description All form fields will be included in the description and can’t be edited. If any field is left blank, the title of the field will still appear in the description, but without any value beneath it. I want to download the attached files Wufoo allows you to attach files to the form submissions, and the integration can optionally import these files and add them as attachments on the task in Asana. This link to download the file will always appear in the task description. I want to make one of my email fields a follower If you specify an email field to add as a follower, you can request that the follower be invited to the Organization if they are not already part of it. In this case, the email address entered in the chosen field will receive an invitation to Asana when the integration processes the submission, but only if the email address's domain matches your Organization’s domain. They will then join your Organization as a member . Title: Advanced Automation Settings
Text: Advanced Automation Settings | Apply Help Log in Apply In this article Explaining Automation Advanced Settings How to Enable Advanced Settings Help Build Automations Advanced Automation Settings Apply Advanced Automation Settings Explaining Automation Advanced Settings How to Enable Advanced Settings Advanced settings can be enabled to alter the behaviour of your automations when an activation is met. This article explains the purpose of these settings and how to enable them for your new and existing automation. Explaining Automation Advanced Settings The advanced settings within an automation are available and optional. If advanced settings are not used, automations will fire immediately and infinitely. Setting Function Limit Set the limit for the maximum number of times this trigger will fire within the site. This is not per application . If you set the limit to 1, this trigger will only ever fire once within the site and not once per application. Priority When you select Control when this automation will run : Set a priority for the automation so that if another automation fires off of the same activation, one of the automations will always fire before or after the other. The higher the number, the higher the Priority. If priority is used, it should be enabled and set for all automations using that same activation. Delay When you select Control when this automation will run : Enable to delay the action from occurring when the activation and rules have been satisfied. Hours and Days are available as intervals to create the delay. Once the delay expires, the actions will be performed. You can also select to check the conditions again after the delay has occurred, to ensure the conditions are still met when the action occurs. How to Enable Advanced Settings Enable Advanced Settings for a New Automation Advanced settings are enabled while editing an automation. If an automation is brand new you will begin this process by first creating a new automation. To enable advanced settings while editing an automation: Select Show Advanced Settings Enable required settings and configure the required limit, priority or delay Set the Activation , Conditions , and the Actions Select Save Activate the automation when ready Editing Advanced Settings of an Existing Automation Over time, your process may change requiring editing of certain features within your site. Existing automations can be updated at any time, but will not perform actions retroactively. To edit the advanced settings of an existing automation: Enter the automation to make changes Select Show Advanced Settings Enable and configure desired settings (limit, priority or delay) Set the Activation , Conditions , and the Actions Select Save WARNING! Editing an automation while a site is live can affect other automations within your site. Be sure to review your current process before making any changes to an existing automation.
