Title: How to Import your Historical Data
Text: How to Import your Historical Data | Apply Help Log in Apply Help FAQs and Troubleshooting Troubleshooting Guides How to Import your Historical Data Apply How to Import your Historical Data The SurveyMonkey Apply team offers a service that allows you to import your historical data into your Apply site. Once your programs and sites have been set up, we'll provide you with a template to populate with your historical data. When your data is ready, we'll review your requirements, validate your data, and then import it. Below you’ll find details outlining the requirements and options for populating the template we provide if you wish to import your historical data. If you have any questions about importing your data or are interested in requesting this service, reach out to your Account Executive or submit a request to be contacted . Import template Primary Columns E-Mail (required) - Refers to the email address of the application owner. First Name (required) - First name of the application owner Last Name (required) - Last name of the application owner Organization Name (required) - If the application is associated with an organization, the name of the organization must be provided here. Organization ID (required) - If the application is associated with an organization that already exists on your SurveyMonkey Apply site, the organization ID must be provided so that we can uniquely identify which organization to assign the application to. If the organization does not exist on your site and you wish to add the organization as part of your import, include the text ‘New’ in this column to create the organization and assign the application to it. Multiple Applications ID - This is a string of numbers and/or letters that will uniquely identify the application within your program. You can specify the ID during the import or the system will automatically assign one if none are provided. If you intend to update the data of existing applications for your program, the unique ID of the application must be specified otherwise a new application will be created for the applicant. Application State (required) - This defines how the system should handle the application once imported. Options include: Normal : The application will be visible to applicants Locked : The application is visible to applicants but no further edits can be made by the applicant. Hidden : The application is only visible to administrators. Archived : The application is no longer visible to applicants and the application is separated from all active program applications. Administrators will still have the opportunity to unarchive or move archived applications to the “Trash”. Deleted : The application will reside in the “Trash” where it can either be deleted permanently or restored as an active application. <Form Response> - A column for each form question response will be included in the import from your program applications. Include the appropriate response in each column. Additional Columns Template Column Description Application Title A title can be assigned to each application Application Stage* Once your program is built, you can define which stage within the program workflow the application should be assigned to. If no stage is specified, the import will default to the first application stage. Application Status* These are custom statuses you can use to communicate to your applicants where their applications are at within your workflow. Your program must have statuses configured in order to include them with your import. Applications can only have one status at a time. Application Labels Labels allow you to tag applications for internal purposes. Applications can have multiple labels at any given time. <Custom Fields> If your site includes custom fields attributed to the application, you will have the option to include the data you’d like to populate with your import. <File Attachments> A column for each file you’d like to attach to an “Attach File” task within your program workflow can be included with the import. Within the column, you’ll be required to provide the path to the file from the ZIP file you will provide the SurveyMonkey team along with your template file. More details on file attachments below. For the purposes of the import, the ID for the given element within your program must be used in place of the name you have assigned it. For example, the first stage in your program is labelled “Application Stage” but the ID “112279” is what must be included in the import file. All IDs will be provided with your template file. File Attachments Warnings Fatal Errors These are the warnings that will prevent the rest of the file being validated: Invalid csv file or encoding detected. Please check the csv that was uploaded and make sure it is not an xls. - Invalid file type uploaded, only csvs are accepted - An undetectable or unknown encoding Our supported encodings are: "Latin-1", "UTF-8", "UTF-16", "CP-1252". Use a tool like Excel or Google Sheets to export to a supported encoding. This row is of a different length than the header row. There's an issue with the CSV's format. We found a row longer or shorter than the header row. We use the most common configurations of `,` as separators and `"` as delimiters. The file will need to be fixed. If it's being exported from Excel and seems fine in Excel then check the export formats and make sure it's using commas and double quotes. If this import has files you must also supply the .zip! This import has file columns but a zip was not provided Provide the zip when validating Uploaded data csv's columns do not match those from the template. There were modifications to the headers values on our identifiers. Anything at the end in (). Correct the changed headers and then re-validate. Sometimes we're provided with very large zip files. There's no size limit, however, there is an upload time limit of 10 minutes. If the zip takes longer than 10 minutes to upload then it will not allow for validation to continue as we can't get the zip. In these cases, please contact us to assist in getting the files validated. Other Warnings These are the warnings that should report out altogether. If you run into a case where one of these causes the rest of validation to stop please create a bug ticket with all necessary reproduction files and steps. Warnings will include the row number they are for. "%(SomeName)s" indicate a placeholder that will change depending on the actual values that were part of the validation warning Message Caused By Possible Solutions Found a blank value in required column 'Multiple Applications ID (usid:frcid)'. When the 'Multiple Applications ID' column is present it is a required field and it must contain a non-blank unique value. Enter a unique value into the cell Found a duplicate value in the Multiple Applications ID column. The duplicate value was: %(Duplicate Value)s A non-unique value was entered into the 'Multiple Applications ID' column. This means a prior row already had that value in the column Enter a unique value into the cell There are multiple entries for user: %(User Email)s For imports that do not allow for multiple applications per applicant this warning will appear if there are multiple rows for the same e-mail. The solutions depend on the case.If the import is meant to allow for multiple applications per applicant and the option was not chosen when the template was created, you can generate a new template with the appropriate options and transfer the data.Otherwise, solutions in the past have been fake unique e-mail or something like if the e-mail was 'jane@some-email.com' to make them unique by add something like 'jane +2 @some-email.com'. There are multiple entries for user with email: %(User Email)s See above See above Invalid status '%(Cell Value)s' in 'Application Status' column. An invalid value in the data for the Application Status column Verify the data is correct for this column. Value '%(Cell Value)s' is not a valid date format. An invalid date format in the data for a date type column. (Typically a form response to a date question) Make sure there's a valid date in the cell. Be wary of excel performing strange operations on date cells. If it looks like it's a valid date and still will not parse open up the csv in something like Notepad and verify that the tool creating the csv isn't modifying the value behind the scenes. Question: %(Question Name)s for form %(Form Name)s is not a multiple choice question. When the template was generated the question referenced was a multiple choice question, but it is no longer. Form and site modifications should be avoided from the time a template is generated to when the data is in the system. Regenerate a new template. Response '%(Cell Value)s' is not a valid choice for the question '%(Question Name)s' in the form '%(Form Name)s' The value in the cell does not match up to an actual choice for the question it is for. (Single choice/Multi choice) We require a 1 to 1 value match. i.e. `ON` is not equal to `Ontario` if it says `Ontario` in the form it must be `Ontario` in the csv Question: %(Question Name)s for form %(Form Name)s is not a single choice question. When the template was generated the question referenced was a single choice question, but it is no longer. Form and site modifications should be avoided from the time a template is generated to when the data is in the system. Regenerate a new template. Missing value for column 'State' The State column is a required column. Add a proper value for State. Invalid State '%(Cell Value)s' in 'State' column A State was provided but not a valid one. Correct the value so it matches a proper State Missing user information in one of 'E-mail', 'First Name' or 'Last Name' columns at row %(Row Number)s The columns E-mail, First Name and Last Name are required columns. Add values to the cells Missing submission title The Title column is also a required column Add a value to the Title column Missing organization name When including organizations the name is a required column if the Organization ID column is set to 'new'. Add a value to the Organization Name column Invalid organization ID '%(Cell Value)s' When including organizations the Organization ID column must either be 'new' and used in conjunction with Organization Name or must be a valid ID. Set the value accordingly. The file '%(Cell Value)s' does not exist in the zip archive provided. The file path specified in the cell cannot be found in the provided Zip Check that the file exists in the ZIP. If it does then verify that the value in the cell doesn't contain typos. Title: Subscribing to RSS Feeds
Text: Subscribing to RSS Feeds | Wufoo Help Log in Wufoo Help Sharing and Notifications Subscribing to RSS Feeds Wufoo Subscribing to RSS Feeds Log in and go to Forms . To the right of the form, If you're using legacy Wufoo, click Edit then click Add notifications . If you're using the new Wufoo experience , click the More icon then click Notifications . In the top-right corner of the page, click Subscribe to RSS Feeds. Choose New Entries or New Comments . To do both, just follow these steps twice—once for New Entries, once for New Comments. Enter your login information for the Wufoo account (your email address and password). Copy and paste the URL in the address bar into your feed reeder. Title: How to Hide/Show Tasks
Text: How to Hide/Show Tasks | Apply Help Log in Apply In this article How to Hide/Show a Task Manually How to Hide a Task How to Show a Task How to Hide/Show Using Automations Show a Task Hide a Task Hide and Show Two Tasks Help Build Tasks How to Hide/Show Tasks Apply How to Hide/Show Tasks How to Hide/Show a Task Manually How to Hide a Task How to Show a Task How to Hide/Show Using Automations Show a Task Hide a Task Hide and Show Two Tasks Within SurveyMonkey Apply, you can choose to hide or show tasks from certain applicants. You can do so manually for a specific applicant, or automatically if an applicant meets set conditions. This article will walk through how to Hide and Show tasks from applicants within the site. How to Hide/Show a Task Manually Due to special circumstances, you may need to hide or show a task within an individual application. For example, for specific reasons, you do not require an applicant to complete one of your tasks and wish for them to proceed with the application without completion of the task. In this case, you would simply Hide the task for that submission, making the task no longer required. How to Hide a Task How to Show a Task How to Hide a Task In order to hide a task within an application: Go to the Admin Application View Go to the Application Tab Click on the More Options icon beside the task you wish to Hide Select Hide task from the applicant You will be asked, "Are you sure that you want to hide this task from the applicant?" Click Yes How to Show a Task In order to show a task within an application: Go to the Admin Application View Go to the Application Tab Click on the More Options icon beside the task you wish to Show Select Show task to the applicant You will be asked, "Are you sure that you want to show this task to the applicant?" Click Yes How to Hide/Show Using Automations Show a Task Hide a Task Hide and Show Two Tasks If you wish to Hide or Show tasks on a more consistent basis, you can set up automations to perform this action. For example, depending on an applicants response to a question we may or may not require that they request a recommendation through the site. This example will walk through how to correctly Hide and Show the task based on the applicant's response. We use 2 automations complete this process in case the applicant should re-enter the application form and change their response. Additionally, we would also recommend setting up prerequisites on the task and hiding the task until the prerequisites are met: Go to your Task settings of the task being hidden/shown Click to "Enable prerequisites for this task" Select the task used for the activation as the prerequisite Enable "Hide task until prerequisites are met" This will ensure that the task will be hidden until the applicant has completed the form and selected the correct response to the question. Show a Task WHEN TO APPLY Source Event Target Application Task Task has been completed Application Form CONDITIONS Conditions to match: ALL Application Form: Do you volunteer for any charities/ organizations is exactly Yes DO Action Source Action Application Task Show a Task Task: Recommendation from Volunteer Coordinator Hide a Task WHEN TO APPLY Source Event Target Application Task Task has been completed Application Form CONDITIONS Conditions to match: ALL Application Form: Do you volunteer for any charities/ organizations is exactly No DO Action Source Action Application Task Show a Task Task Recommendation from Volunteer Coordinator Hide and Show Two Tasks If you have a case where two tasks are mutually exclusive from each other you can set up two automations similar to above, to hide and show the two applicable tasks. NOTE: For this example, we refer to the use of the Verify Charity Status task, where we have one task to verify Canadian charities, and another to verify US charities. WHEN TO APPLY Source Event Target Application Task Task has been completed Application Form CONDITIONS Conditions to match: ALL Application Form: Do you volunteer for a US or Canadian Registered Charity is exactly Canadian DO 1. Action Source Action Application Task Show a Task Task Verify Canadian Charity 2. Action Source Action Application Task Hide a Task Task: Verify US Charity Related Articles July 2025 August 2025 June 2025 English Company SurveyMonkey About Us Jobs Blog Help SurveyMonkey Help GetFeedback Help Market Research Help SurveyMonkey Audience Help SurveyMonkey Contribute Help Wufoo Help Apply Help Support Site Status Unsubscribe Contact Us Email Opt-In Policies Legal Center Privacy Policy Cookies Notice California Privacy Notice Copyright © 1999-2025 SurveyMonkey BBB credentials logo TrustedSite logo

Title: Duplicate Entries
Text: Duplicate Entries | Wufoo Help Log in Wufoo In this article Preventing Duplicate Entries Deleting Duplicate Entries Help Entries and Reports Managing Entries Duplicate Entries Wufoo Duplicate Entries Preventing Duplicate Entries Deleting Duplicate Entries Preventing Duplicate Entries There are a few settings you can use to prevent people (or bots) from submitting duplicate entries to your form. Prevent Duplicate Answers to a Specific Field Allow Only One Entry Per IP Address reCAPTCHA and Your Form Deleting Duplicate Entries If it's too late, and people have already submitted duplicate entries to your form, unfortunately there's no bulk action you can take to delete all duplicates at once. However, you can delete entries from the Entry Manager. Title: How to Add and Manage Files
Text: How to Add and Manage Files | Apply Help Log in Apply In this article What are Files? How to Add a File Making a File Accessible to Users How to Edit a File How to Delete a File File Settings How to Download Uploaded Files Help Features and Settings Pages and Files How to Add and Manage Files Apply How to Add and Manage Files What are Files? How to Add a File Making a File Accessible to Users How to Edit a File How to Delete a File File Settings How to Download Uploaded Files Files can be added as informational resources for users within your site. The access of these files can be controlled to specific roles and managed from a single area. This article explains how to add and edit files for the reference of users within your site. What are Files? Files can be uploaded to provide access to templates and other resources to users within your site. Some examples of files uploaded for applicants and reviewers are: Program Information External resource files Templates (budget, essay, etc.) Score sheets/rubrics Ranking reports Once files are added to your site a link will be generated so that a link to the resource can be created. This link can be used to create a hyperlink to display to users that when selected will begin downloading the file for the user selecting the link. To navigate to the Files page: Select the Settings icon Select Files How to Add a File To add a file: Select the Settings icon Select Files Select the Upload File icon Select the file(s) from your computer's file manager Wait for the files to complete their upload Once the file is added a unique link will be created which can then be used to create a link to the resource to provide access to the file. To copy the location of a file: Select the More Options icon Select Copy URL Making a File Accessible to Users Access to files is only available when a link has been provided to a user. This can be given as a link through a program or task description, given through email, or other means. Instead of presenting the full link of the file, you can create a hyperlink that will download the file when selected by a user. We reference this as a link to the resource. To create this link to a resource: Copy the file URL Highlight the text you wish to turn into a hyperlink. Select the Link icon from the formatting bar. Paste the file URL into the URL field Select OK See our article How to Link to Pages and Files for details on customizing hyperlinks within your site. How to Edit a File A file can be edited at any point in time. File attributes that can be edited are the title and access. To edit a file: From the Files page, select the More options icon for the file you wish to edit Click Edit Update the title or the file's access (hidden/visible) Select Save How to Delete a File Deleting a file will remove the ability for any user to access it within the site. To delete a file: From the Files page , select the More Options icon Click Delete Confirm the deletion To delete multiple files: Select the checkboxes of the files you wish to delete Select Actions Click Delete Once a file is deleted it cannot be retrieved. File Settings When adding a new file the visibility of that file will be set to visible by default. As expected, visibility determines whether members within the site will have access to the file when it is cited throughout your site. There are two options when setting this access: Visible or Hidden. Visible Files Accessible if a link to the file has been provided to your users Hidden files Will not be accessible even when the direct link has been provided to the file NOTE: Files can only be accessed by applicants, reviewers, and recommenders if they have been given the link directly or if a link to the file has been created. See Explaining the Visibility of Pages & Files for more information. How to Download Uploaded Files Once a file has been added to your site a link will need to be created to present the file to your users. When the link is selected the file will begin downloading to the user's computer for viewing. Administrators will always have access to files that have been added through the Files page. To download a file as an administrator: Go to Files Select the More Options icon of the file you wish to download Select Download If a link to the resource is not created, the file will not be accessible to any visitors to your site. Title: Downloading Entries & Reports
Text: Downloading Entries & Reports | Wufoo Help Log in Wufoo In this article Downloading, Emailing, or Printing a Single Entry Downloading Entries in Bulk Exporting Reports Common Questions Help Entries and Reports Managing Entries Downloading Entries & Reports Wufoo Downloading Entries & Reports Downloading, Emailing, or Printing a Single Entry Downloading Entries in Bulk Exporting Reports Common Questions You can download, email, or delete entries from the Entry Manager . Downloading, Emailing, or Printing a Single Entry To download, email, or print a single entry in legacy Wufoo: Log in and go to Forms . To the right of the form, click Entries . Choose All entries . At the bottom of the page, find the entry in the datagrid and select it. In the upper-right corner of the entry, click the Print button or Email button. When choosing print options, you can choose to save the file as a PDF. When emailing, separate email addresses with a comma or semicolon. Comments aren't included in exports. Managing Entries Follow these steps to download, email, or print a single entry. TIP! To find specific entries, you can filter entries before downloading, emailing, or printing. Download an Entry To download an entry: Log in and go to Forms . To the right of the form, click the Entries icon. Check the box next to the entry you want to download. Click the Download Entry icon at the bottom of the page. Choose either the .xls or .csv file format. You can also download multiple entries at once directly from the Entry Manager . Check the boxes next to the entries you want to download and click the Download Entries icon at the bottom of the page. If you select multiple entries, they'll be downloaded to the same file. Email an Entry To email an entry to someone: Log in and go to Forms . To the right of the form, click the Entries icon. Check the box next to the entry you want to share. Click the Email Entry icon at the bottom of the page. Enter the email addresses of the people you want to email. Click Email . You can also email one or more entries directly from the Entry Manager . Check the boxes next to the entries you want to email and click the Email Entries icon at the bottom of the page. When you email multiple entries, recipients get a separate email for each entry you share with them. Print an Entry To print an entry: Log in and go to Forms . To the right of the form, click the Entries icon. Click the ID of the entry you want to print. Click the Print Entry icon at the top of the entry. Downloading Entries in Bulk To download all entries in legacy Wufoo: Log in and go to Forms . To the right of the form, click Entries . Choose All entries . At the top of the datagrid, click BULK ACTIONS . In the right of the datagrid, click Export . Choose an export format: Excel (.xls), Tab Delimited (.txt), or Comma Delimited (.csv). The .xls spreadsheet works best for Microsoft Excel 2003 and later. If you have an earlier version of Excel, or use another spreadsheet software like Pages or Google Sheets, we recommend exporting the .csv format. Downloading All Entries Follow these steps to download all entries. To download all entries: Log in and go to Forms . To the right of the form, click the Entries icon. Check the box in the top left corner of the table to select all entries. Click the Download Entries icon at the bottom of the page. Choose either the .xls or .csv file format. Exporting Reports To download report data: View the report. In the upper-right corner of the report, click Export Data . Choose an export format: Excel (.xls), Tab Delimited (.txt), or Comma Delimited (.csv). The .xls spreadsheet works best for Microsoft Excel 2003 and later because it's XML based. If you have an earlier version of Excel, or use another spreadsheet software like Pages or Google Sheets, we recommend exporting the .csv format. TIP! To add the Export Data button on your report, go to your Report Settings . To control the data people can export, edit your datagrid widget settings by turning off (unchecking) the Allow User to View Columns Not Checked setting and uncheck any field that should not be seen or exported. Common Questions Why don't the fields in the datagrid in my report match the export? This depends on your datagrid widget settings , specifically whether you have Allow User to View Columns Not Checked turned off or on. To control the data people can export, turn off (uncheck) the Allow User to View Columns Not Checked setting and uncheck any field that should not be seen or exported. To hide data in the report by default, but allow people to expand the fields shown in report or export all data, turn on (check) the Allow User to View Columns Not Checked setting. Why can't I print my report? At this time, due to technical limitations on our end, you can't really print a report from your browser or save it as nice-looking PDF—the Datagrid widget won't display in full and Graph widgets are not included. We're sorry for the inconvenience! You'll need to export your data as outlined above and use Excel, Google Sheets, or another software to make a printable report. Or you can take screenshots of your report. Can I use the API or other integrations to export? You can export data from your Wufoo account into another site using one of our integrations . You can also use our API . How do I download file uploads attached to entries? To download a file upload , open an entry and click the link for the file. When you export entries in bulk, file uploads aren't automatically downloaded—but there are links to the files included in the spreadsheet so you can download them one by one. If your account downgrades to the free plan , the links will no longer be active. Title: Field Settings
Text: Field Settings | Wufoo Help Log in Wufoo Help Build a Form Field Settings Field Settings Wufoo Field Settings Field Settings are settings that you can apply to an individual field on your form—they control all sorts of things like validation, format, visibility, encryption, field size, layout and requirements for filling out the field correctly. Each field type supports a unique set of Field Settings. In any Field Type article, you'll find a full list of field settings that are available for that field—as well as more information about the additional Field Settings unique to that field type. See: Field Types To access Field Settings: Log in and go to Forms . Click the form you want to edit. Click a field on your form to open its Field Settings. Field Setting Description Field Label The text paired with each field that tells people what kind of data they need to enter. This is usually just one or two words (like "Name" or "Rate your experience"), but this could also be a longer phrase or a question. Field Type Before saving a field, you can switch the field type to change the type of data you want to collect. You can't change the field type once the field is saved. Learn more: Field Types Field Size Lets you change the size of some field types. Required Requires people to fill out the field in order to submit their entry. No Duplicates Blocks people from submitting an answer that was already by someone else in a previous entry. Range Limits accepted answers to a specific range, like word count, character count, or numerical range. Instructions for User Adds instructional text that only appears when someone is filling out that particular field—so you can add more context without cluttering your form with too much text. Randomize Randomizes the answer choices for each person taking your form. Everyone vs. Admin Only Admin-Only fields are hidden from public view, so they're only editable through the Entry Manager. Encrypted Encrypted fields are stored with additional security on our servers, so they're ideal for fields that are collecting extra-sensitive data. Placeholder Text Add grey example text to your field that disappears when people start typing, and never gets recorded in your results. Predefined Value Pre-populate default values into your form. Max Quantities Limit how many times a specific answer choice can be selected (over the lifetime of the form). Import Predefined Choices Wufoo provides lots of pre-written sets of answer choices that you can add to Multiple Choice, Dropdown, and Likert fields to save you time. You can also copy and paste your own predefined answer choices in bulk. CSS Layout Keywords Choose from a selection of keywords that adjust the layout and position of fields and text on your form, or hide certain form elements. Format Some field types have unique formatting options available. See the following articles for details: - Price - Date - Phone - Name Hide Numbers See: Likert Not Applicable See: Likert Related Articles DocuSign Field Building a Form Getting Started with Wufoo Company SurveyMonkey About Us Jobs Blog Help SurveyMonkey Help GetFeedback Help Market Research Help SurveyMonkey Audience Help SurveyMonkey Contribute Help Wufoo Help Apply Help Support Site Status Unsubscribe Contact Us Email Opt-In Policies Legal Center Privacy Policy Cookies Notice California Privacy Notice Copyright © 1999-2025 SurveyMonkey BBB credentials logo TrustedSite logo

Title: Datasource Question
Text: Datasource Question | Apply Help Log in Apply In this article How to Add a Datasource Question Options Settings Display Settings Help Build Form Question Types Datasource Question Apply Datasource Question How to Add a Datasource Question Options Settings Display Settings The Datasource question is a text response question that connects to an external list. When a participant enters a response into this question, SurveyMonkey Apply can recognize whether the answer corresponds with the list of options in the data source list. NOTE: If using a Datasource Question in your form you will not be able to create an Advanced Branching Rule based off of the responses given. How to Add a Datasource Question Within your form, click on the Questions tab in the top left corner Under Advanced Questions , double-click or click and drag the Datasource question to add it to your form. Optional: Add an Identifier to your question Enter the Question Title Optional: Add a Description Set the +Options i. Decide if the Question will be Required or Optional Add the Datasource URL Set the +Display , with this question, the only display option is the Width of the question TIP! If you want to a JSON file and don't have an accessible link for the file, upload it to the Files section first to create an internal URL to use for links. Options Settings Options Description Optional Enabling this will make the question Optional. When a user enters the form, if the question is Optional they will be able to proceed and complete the form without providing a response to this question. Datasource URL Enter the URL for your data source in this field. The URL should return a JSON encoded dictionary (keys will be choice values, values will be choice labels). In order for the Datasource question to work correctly, the "Keys" to each of the choices will need to be unique. Display Settings Display Description Width You can adjust the width based on a percentage of the size of the page. By default, the value is 100% to make it fit the page size. Title: Adding Instructional Text to a Field
Text: Adding Instructional Text to a Field | Wufoo Help Log in Wufoo Help Build a Form Field Settings Adding Instructional Text to a Field Wufoo Adding Instructional Text to a Field You can use the Instructions for User field setting to provide additional context or instructions for filling out a particular field in your form. When someone clicks into a field to fill it out, the instructions for that field will appear in a box to the right. They'll disappear when they move on to the next field, so you can provide necessary context for each field without cluttering your form. You can apply this setting to any field type. To add instructional text to a field: Log in and go to Forms . Click the form you want to edit. In the Form Builder, click the field to open its Field Settings. Type your additional info into the Instructions for User textbox. HTML formatting is supported! Click Save Form . Instructions won't show up in the Form Builder, so you need to view your form to test them out. You can control the appearance of the box via the theme applied to your form. TIP! Display Instructions Under the Field You can use CSS Layout Keywords to position the instructions underneath the field instead of to the right. Title: General Settings: Overview
Text: General Settings: Overview | Apply Help Log in Apply In this article How to Access General Settings Site Details Site Access Lock Site Unlock Site Theme Localization Help Features and Settings General Settings General Settings: Overview Apply General Settings: Overview How to Access General Settings Site Details Site Access Lock Site Unlock Site Theme Localization The General Settings allow you to update the universal features of your site. This article serves as an overview of these features and explains how changes to these features will affect your site. How to Access General Settings In order to access General Settings: Click on the Settings icon Click on General Site Details This section is dedicated to the basic details of your site. The table below displays the editable fields and the actions that can be performed here. Generally, these fields are not edited once your site is live. Site Name The title of the site displayed to users visiting your site. Site Tagline (Optional) This text is displayed directly under the site title on your homepage. Organization (Optional) Your organization's information. This will not appear on your homepage. Can be used for piping organization information to emails. Site URL The text contributing to your unique site URL. Custom Domain Select Add custom domain if a custom domain will be used instead of the default .smapply.io domain. For more information on adding a custom domain, see How to Apply a Custom (Vanity) URL . Site Access The Site Access section consists of the controls used to lock and unlock your site. This can be extremely useful if you are performing maintenance on your site and programs and wish to restrict all users (including reviewers) from being able to login/register. Lock Site In order to Lock the Site: Go to the General Settings Select "Lock the site so it is only accessible by administrators" Draft a message to be displayed to your users on the homepage of your site Unlock Site In order to Unlock the site Go to the General Settings Uncheck "Lock the site so it is only accessible by administrators" Theme This section is used to set the site theme as well as add images to your site. These settings allow the administrators to manage the appearance of the site including site themes, images, and access to the CSS Editor. Theme The theme selected here will be applied to all pages within the site. Preview Select to view the current theme and content of your homepage. From the Preview, the CSS Editor can be used to customize the presentation of various pages throughout your site. See How to Access the CSS Editor for more information. Note: CSS is supported, but must be applied, monitored, and removed by site administrators. Logo The logo displays on your homepage and will be resized from the natural size of the file that is uploaded to fit your homepage without major manipulation. Favicon The image chosen for your favicon will appear as the logo in open tabs within your browser. This image will automatically be resized when it is uploaded to display as a favicon. Wide images will be compressed to fit the standard favicon size which may affect the image quality. Localization The settings here control the localization of the site which refers to the preferred timezone, date/time formats, and accepted currency. Timezone This timezone will be used as the standard to set deadlines for programs, stages, and tasks within the site. It will also be used for logging activity within the site.Users will still be able to set their own timezone which will convert their display of all deadlines from the set timezone here to theirs. Date Format The date format will be used as the standard for setting all deadlines and logging all activity within the site. Time Format The time format will be used as the standard for setting all deadlines and logging all activity within the site. Currency The currency accepted for all payment tasks within the site.This cannot be customized to individual payment tasks. Intro to SurveyMonkey Apply (2 Videos) Key Components This video will introduce you to the two major components of Apply: Build and Monitor. Title: Build Surveys with AI
Text: Build Surveys with AI | SurveyMonkey Help Log in SurveyMonkey In this article Feature Availability and Settings Creating with Build with AI Your Survey Content Mobile App Experience Help Creating Surveys Designing Your Survey Build Surveys with AI SurveyMonkey Build Surveys with AI Feature Availability and Settings Creating with Build with AI Your Survey Content Mobile App Experience Build with AI, powered by the Azure OpenAI service and OpenAI, makes it easy and quick to create a survey. To create a survey, type a prompt that includes your survey goals but excludes sensitive information. With a click of a button, we'll generate a survey for you. You can choose to use it and edit it, re-generate a new survey with an edited prompt, or start over with another survey creation method . How Your Data is Processed Build with AI uses the Azure Open AI service and Open AI to generate your survey. Your data isn't used to train Azure Open AI service and Open AI models. Learn how this feature processes your data . Avoid including any sensitive information in your prompts—you are responsible for the information you enter into Build with AI. Please note that the Azure OpenAI service and OpenAI does not use prompts in connection with Build with AI to train Azure OpenAI service and OpenAI models or improve OpenAI’s service offering. Feature Availability and Settings Build with AI is only available to some customers in the following supported regions . Feature availability depends on your plan: Basic and Individual plans : Build with AI is available for all accounts. Teams and Enterprise plans : For most accounts, your Primary Admin determines whether your team can access Build with AI . For details on the terms that apply to the use of this feature, please see our Self-Serve AI Service-Specific Terms and SurveyMonkey Enterprise Service-Specific Terms . HIPAA and Enhanced Sensitive Data Protection : Build with AI isn’t available to HIPAA-enabled accounts, or those with the Enhanced Sensitive Data Protection feature enabled. Learn how to manage access to Build with AI . Build with AI settings aren’t available in the SurveyMonkey mobile app. Sign in on a desktop device to edit your settings . Build a Survey with AI To create a survey with Build with AI: Select Create Survey . Select Build with AI . Enter a prompt. We recommend using one of the examples as a template, but you can also write your own prompt from scratch. If you use the SurveyMonkey app, you can choose to use voice commands or type your survey prompt. Submit the prompt to generate a survey. Preview your survey. If you want to use it, select Continue to edit and customize the survey. Otherwise, you can Try another prompt or start over with another survey creation method . Survey prompts can be up to 1,000 characters long. You can submit up to 25 AI-generated survey prompts per hour. Your Survey Content AI-generated surveys may include any of the following question types: Multiple choice Checkbox NPS Name Email Address Phone Single Textbox Matrix/Rating Scale Ranking Star Rating Once you choose to use the survey and you're customizing it, you can add in other question types . If your survey includes paid questions types, you can upgrade to keep them or remove them to send your survey for free. Certain survey use cases are not permitted—for details, please see SurveyMonkey's Acceptable Uses Policy , as well as additional third party provider usage policies , and acceptable use and conduct policies. How to Write a Prompt to Generate a Survey State your goal (e.g. we want to improve the employee experience). Describe what you want to know (e.g. we need to survey our employees about pay, benefits, hours, workload, and culture). Provide general context describing who is sending the survey (e.g. we're a large sporting goods manufacturer). Specify what demographic or company information you want to know about your respondents (e.g. business industry and size, or age and gender). Be specific and as detailed as possible about the desired context, outcome, length, or style. Be precise—avoid ambiguity or vagueness. Iterate on your prompt until you get a survey draft you can work with. If your prompt contains unsafe content, you may receive an error or be unable to create an AI generated survey for up to an hour. You can create a survey in another way or wait to retry Build with AI with an edited prompt. Mobile App Experience When using Build with AI in the SurveyMonkey app, you can use voice commands to create your survey prompt rather than typing it out. The app uses native OS speech-to-text to capture your voice prompts. Voice prompts are not stored in SurveyMonkey – only the prompt’s text output is stored. Once survey questions are proposed on the preview page, you can Continue to edit and customize your survey. Or, select Try another prompt to revise your prompt. Your Account’s AI Settings To manage AI feature access , sign in to your SurveyMonkey account on a desktop. AI feature settings aren’t available in the mobile app. Related Articles Scoring Your Survey Measure Customer Satisfaction (CSAT) with SurveyMonkey Accepting Payments with PayPal English Company SurveyMonkey About Us Jobs Blog Help SurveyMonkey Help GetFeedback Help Market Research Help SurveyMonkey Audience Help SurveyMonkey Contribute Help Wufoo Help Apply Help Support Site Status Unsubscribe Contact Us Email Opt-In Policies Legal Center Privacy Policy Cookies Notice California Privacy Notice Copyright © 1999-2025 SurveyMonkey BBB credentials logo TrustedSite logo

Title: Get a Recommendation Task
Text: Get a Recommendation Task | Apply Help Log in Apply In this article How to Create a Get a Recommendation Task Task Settings What Happens Next? Quick Reference Help Build Tasks Get a Recommendation Task Apply Get a Recommendation Task How to Create a Get a Recommendation Task Task Settings What Happens Next? Quick Reference The "Get a Recommendation" task is useful when applicants are required to provide a reference or multiple references in support of their application. NOTE: For information in regards to assisting Applicants and Recommenders with issues in this process you can refer to our Applicant FAQ and Recommender FAQ . How to Create a Get a Recommendation Task In order to create a Get a Recommendation Task in your site: Go to your Workflow Click on the Name of the stage to access the stage configurations. Click on the Tasks tab. Click on the + icon Select Get a Recommendation Complete the task settings as listed below. Task Settings Settings Description Title This is the name of the task that will be visible to your applicants within their task list. Recommendation Format Choose the accepted format for the recommendation: - Fill out a Form - Attach a File If you select Fill out a Form you will have the option to create a new form or select a form that already exists in your site. You can then edit the form within the form builder based on the information you require from the recommender. If you select Attach a File this will allow the recommender to attach a file as a recommendation. TIP! Select both formats to either give the recommender the choice of the formats type they wish to complete, or to force them to complete both formats. Allow Multiple Recommendations Select this option when multiple recommendations are required. - Set the minimum number of recommendations required - Set the maximum number of recommendations required --OR-- Select No Limit Limit requests to specific email domains Restrict email invitations to a specific email domain. For example, a use case could be if a program for research funding is being run internally in a school and students need a recommendation from a professor of the school. Setting the domain to be limited to @myschool.edu will ensure that only emails to that school are sent. Allow Applicants to see Completed Recommendations Enable this if you wish for your applicants to be able to see what their recommenders have to say about them. If this is NOT enabled they will not be able to see the completed recommendations. Allow Recommenders to see Applications Allow your recommenders to be able to view the application of the applicant they are submitting a recommendation for. Description This description is shown to applicants who complete this task. Specifying a description is optional. When checked, the Visual Editor is displayed which allows the content to be formatted accordingly. This description will be visible to your applicants within the application underneath the task. Optional Make your task Optional. By default, your task will be required to complete. If you wish to allow your applicants to proceed without completing the task you can set the task to be optional. Deadline Set a deadline on your task. Decide if you wish to prevent applicants from completing the task after a certain date. Prevent Editing Enabling this setting will mean that applicants will not be able to edit the task once they have fully completed it. Prerequisites The tasks you set as Prerequisites will need to be completed in the site before this task becomes available. A common example of this is if you wish to force your applicants to complete a Basic Information form task before this task becomes available. TIP! Select "Hide task until prerequisites are met" if you wish to make it clear to your applicants that they need to complete the prerequisite first. What Happens Next? There are three major components to the Get a Recommendation task: 1. Applicant Completes the Request The Applicant fills in the details of the Recommender including the First Name, Last Name, Email, and a brief message (optional) to send the recommender. 2. The Recommender Completes the Recommendation The Recommender receives an email with an invite to complete the recommendation. This will allow the recommender to login to the site. Upon logging in they will be able to see the application in their recommender panel. When they click Start they will be asked if they wish to Accept or Decline the recommendation request from the applicant. Upon Accepting, the recommender will be able to complete and submit the recommendation for the applicant within the site. The decision to Accept or Decline will be displayed to the applicant within their application. However, based on the Notification settings the applicant can also be notified when the recommender completes their application. 3. The Applicant must confirm that the Recommendation has been received. Once the recommender has completed their recommendation, it will be marked as complete to the recommender. However, on the applicant's side, within their application, the task will remain In Progress, until the applicant confirms that they have received the recommendation and clicks Submit. Quick Reference Quick Reference allows recommenders to submit recommendations without logging into a SurveyMonkey Apply account. They will instead use a secure, one-time link sent to their email to provide their recommendation. You can enable Quick Reference individually for each task. How do I enable it? To enable Quick Reference for a task: Access the settings of your Recommendation Task. Check the box to Enable quick references . Once you enable Quick Reference, your recommenders will start receiving secure, one-time-use links to provide their recommendations. Title: How to Categorize Programs
Text: How to Categorize Programs | Apply Help Log in Apply In this article Add a Program to a Category Remove a Program from a Category Help Build Programs How to Categorize Programs Apply How to Categorize Programs Add a Program to a Category Remove a Program from a Category Within SurveyMonkey Apply it is possible to create and update categories for your programs. Program categories allow you to group multiple programs under one umbrella which can be quite useful for site organization and reporting. Add a Program to a Category Once categories have been added to one program they can be enabled for any additional programs within the site. By enabling a category for a program you will be associating that category to the program going forward. To add a program to a category: Go to the Site Dashboard Go to the Program Settings Click on the Extras tab Select the checkboxes of categories you would like to associate with that program. Your selection will be auto-saved. Remove a Program from a Category To remove a program from a category: Go to the Site Dashboard Go to the Program Settings Click on the Extras tab Remove the checkbox selection of the category that no longer applies to the program. Your selection will be auto-saved. Title: Notifications
Text: Notifications | Apply Help Log in Apply In this article Site Notifications: Overview How to Access Site Notifications Applicant Notifications Reviewer Notifications Recommender Notifications Administrator Notifications How to Edit Notifications Help Features and Settings Emails Notifications Apply Notifications Site Notifications: Overview How to Access Site Notifications Applicant Notifications Reviewer Notifications Recommender Notifications Administrator Notifications How to Edit Notifications Site Notifications are commonly used emails that are sent out of the site that SurveyMonkey Apply has already set up for you. This article will explain the various notifications available, how to enable/disable certain notifications, and how to edit the default email text to meet your own needs. Site Notifications: Overview Within this section of the site, you can manage emails that are commonly used to invite users to your site and communicate user progress. You will not be able to add or remove any of these Notifications, however, optional Notifications can be enabled/disabled as needed, and if additional emails are needed to be sent out automatically Automated Emails can also be configured. Within each section are both System Notification and Optional Notifications. Our System Notifications are necessary for the functionality of your site, and therefore cannot be disabled. However, the default text can be edited to suit your needs and can also include piping variables to further customize a notification to the user receiving the email. NOTE: We do not recommend completely removing existing Piping Variables within the default email text as they are useful in carrying out actions in the email. For example, the {{ site_title.link }} variable will send a customized link to the user to be able to login to the site. It will also prompt users who don't have a password to be able to create one. Therefore, without this variable in the email, the user may not be able to login to the site. How to Access Site Notifications Select the Settings menu Click Emails Enter the Notifications tab Applicant Notifications The following Notifications will be sent to Applicants based on specific actions that may occur in the site. Listed below are the available notifications under this tab and the applicable action. System Notifications Notification Description of Notification Invitation Email This email will send out when the Applicant is Sent an Invite . Email Confirmation This email will send out when the Applicant initially registers to the site. It is used to validate their email address as they will not be able to submit their application until their email has been properly verified. A URL within the email will be provided to allow them to validate their email and return them to the system. Collaborator Invitation This email will send to individuals that applicants specify they want to add to their applications as collaborators. By default, the email should include a link for the user to follow to complete the registration process. Optional Notifications Notification Description of Notification Welcome Message This email will send out when the Applicant initially confirms their email address within the site completing the registration. Application Submitted This email will send out when the Applicant submits their application. If enabled, this email will be sent anytime an application completes an application stage within your workflow. For example, if you have two application stages this email will send out on the two occasions where the applicant will submit their application. Collaborator Invitation Accepted This email will send to the collaborators when they have confirmed the invitation and successfully have access to the site. Recommendation Request Accepted This will send to the applicant when the recommender has accepted the recommendation request. An email is sent to the applicant who made the request to notify them. Recommendation Request Declined This will send to the applicant when the recommender has declined the recommendation request. An email is sent to the applicant who made the request to notify them. Recommendation Request Completed When the recommender has completed their recommendation for the applicant, an email is sent to the applicant to notify them. NOTE: For the Recommendation Request Notifications, these statuses can also be viewed by the applicant when they view the recommendation request. Reviewer Notifications The following Notifications will be sent to Reviewers based on specific actions that may occur in the site. Listed below are the available notifications under this tab and the applicable action. System Notifications Notification Description of Notification Invitation Email This email will send out when the Reviewer is Sent an Invite . Note added to an assigned application This email will be sent to reviewers assigned to the same application for a given program/stage when the note is added. This will only be sent out if specified by the Admin or Reviewer adding the note. Optional Notifications Notification Description of Notification Welcome Message This email will send when the Reviewer initially confirms their email address within the site completing the registration. Assigned Applications This email will be sent to the Reviewer when you have assigned them applications to review. Recommender Notifications The following Notifications will be sent to Recommenders based on specific actions that may occur in the site. Listed below are the available notifications under this tab and the applicable action. System Notifications Notification Description of Notification Invitation Email This email will send out when the Recommender is Sent an Invite by an administrator. Recommendation Request This email will be sent to Recommenders when the Applicant submits a recommendation request. Optional Notifications Notification Description of Notification Welcome Message This email will send out when the Reviewer initially confirms their email address within the site completing their registration. Recommendation Request Withdrawn This email will be sent to the Recommender to inform them that the Applicant has rescinded the request for a recommendation from this Recommender. Administrator Notifications The following Notifications will be sent to Administrators based on specific actions that may occur in the site. Listed below are the available notifications under this tab and the applicable action. System Notifications Notification Description of Notification Invitation Email This email will send out when the Administrator is Sent an Invite by another administrator. Note added to an assigned application This email will be sent to reviewers assigned to the same application for a given program/stage when the note is added. This will only be sent out if specified by the Admin or Reviewer adding the note. Optional Notifications Notification Description of Notification Welcome Message This email will send out when the Administrator initially confirms their email address within the site completing their registration. How to Edit Notifications By default, the notifications will be populated with template text that is recommended to use for your process in the site. However, you also have the option of editing this text in order to customize the verbiage to suit your needs. In order to edit a notification: Go to Notifications Click on the Role tab based on which notification you wish to edit Click on the Edit icon to the right of the notification description Make your desired changes to the subject and email body Press Save . NOTE: The template notifications are also pre-populated with Piping Variables such as the {{ site.title_link }} which will send custom information to the user that sends in. Based on the need of each notification we would highly recommend against removing existing piping variables completely from the email notification as they could affect the usability of the email. TIP! If you do make an alteration to either the text or the piping variables, you can always click Reset to Default to restore the email to the original template text. Title: Getting Anonymous Feedback
Text: Getting Anonymous Feedback | GetFeedback Help Log in GetFeedback In this article Share the Survey Link Disable Email Tracking Help Account Management Privacy, security, and compliance Getting Anonymous Feedback GetFeedback Getting Anonymous Feedback Share the Survey Link Disable Email Tracking Collecting anonymous responses is a great way to receive honest feedback from team members or customers. Share the Survey Link Each survey's unique URL can be found by navigating to Distribute > Link. By default, this survey link will collect anonymous responses. If you need to track identifying information along with your survey responses, you’ll want to use merge fields. Disable Email Tracking To send anonymous surveys from GetFeedback’s Send to a list feature, you’ll need to disable email tracking from the email’s template. On the Send to a list from GetFeedback page, add survey recipients to your list, entering each recipient’s email address on a separate line. Press Save once you've entered all your recipients. Once the list is saved, you'll see the Send bar appear at the bottom of your Survey Builder. To disable email tracking, uncheck the box labeled Enable email tracking on the bottom left of the screen before sending the survey. Note: Disabling email tracking will prevent our system from showing response details such as 'Email Opened at Date', 'Email Link Clicked at Date', or the email address the response came from. Title: Filtering by Open-Ended Comments or Text
Text: Filtering by Open-Ended Comments or Text | SurveyMonkey Help Log in SurveyMonkey In this article Filter by Tags Filter by Question and Answer Help Analyzing Results Filters & Views Filtering by Open-Ended Comments or Text SurveyMonkey Filtering by Open-Ended Comments or Text Filter by Tags Filter by Question and Answer You can filter your survey results by specific words or phrases people may have used in open-ended responses. Filter by Tags You can use the text analysis features to identify and tag recurring words or phrases in your open-ended text responses, then filter by those tags. Filter by Question and Answer Since survey takers may have used synonyms, misspelled words, or abbreviated terms, we recommend filtering by multiple words or phrases. When creating a filter, separate the words or phrases you want to filter for by commas. The filtered view will include responses that match any of the answer criteria defined in the filter. You can filter by the following open-ended question types: Numerical Textboxes - Choose the row to filter by, and choose to filter results that are Greater than , Less than , or Equal to the value you enter. Single Textbox or Comment Box - Enter word(s) or a phrase you'd like to filter by and choose to include responses that match All Words , Any Words , or the Exact Phrase . Multiple Textboxes - Choose the row to filter by, and enter a word or phrase. Choose to include responses that match All Words , Any Words , or the Exact Phrase . Contact Information - Choose the row to filter by, and enter a word or phrase. Choose to include responses that match All Words , Any Words , or the Exact Phrase . Date and/or Time - Enter the date and/or time you'd like to filter by, and choose to include responses that were submitted Before , After , or Exactly on that date and/or at that time. Title: Instant Notifications
Text: Instant Notifications | SurveyMonkey Help Log in SurveyMonkey In this article What Emails You Get Setting Up Instant Notifications Sharing Instant Notifications with Others Help Sending Surveys Getting Notified of Responses Instant Notifications SurveyMonkey Instant Notifications What Emails You Get Setting Up Instant Notifications Sharing Instant Notifications with Others ENTERPRISE FEATURE: If you're interested, contact sales . If you already have an Enterprise account, contact your Customer Success Manager. Instant notifications let you quickly see new survey responses by sending you an email and message in the Notification Center each time a complete response is submitted. Only survey owners can turn on instant notifications for their survey, but they can share those notifications with others . What Emails You Get You’ll get an email each time a new complete response to your survey is submitted, which will also show as a message in the Notification Center . The email has a link to view the individual response so you can see it without logging in to a SurveyMonkey account. The link stays active for 90 days after the notification is sent. To receive notifications for multiple surveys, you'll need to turn on instant notifications for each one. Each person receiving notifications can get a maximum of 20 instant notifications a day, across all surveys. TIP! Learn about other ways to get notified about survey responses. Setting Up Instant Notifications Instant notifications are set up for each individual survey by the survey owner. You can only turn on instant notifications for surveys you own, not on surveys that are shared with you. To turn on instant notifications for a survey you own: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Click Manage Notifications . Turn on instant notifications for yourself. TIP! If you turned on notifications but you're not getting emails, try these troubleshooting tips . You'll still see them as messages in the Notification Center . Sharing Instant Notifications with Others You can share instant notifications with anyone—people in or outside of your team as long as you’re the survey owner. To share instant notifications with others: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Click Manage Notifications . Scroll to instant notifications and click Add . Enter the email addresses of the people you want to share instant notifications with. If you're in a team , you can also select team members from the list. Click Share . When you share instant notifications with someone, they’ll get an email to let them know. They'll then start to receive emails each time a complete response is submitted, with a link to view the individual response so they can see it without logging in to a SurveyMonkey account. TIP! Track your Instant Notifications in the Notification Center . Stop Sharing Instant Notifications with Someone To remove someone from receiving instant notifications for a survey: Go to the Collect Responses section of your survey. Click Manage Notifications . Scroll to instant notifications and click Recipients . Click the Trash can icon next to the people you want to remove. Click Done . Opting Out To stop receiving instant notifications, reach out to the survey owner and they can take you off the list. To find out who the survey owner is, look for the name listed in the instant notification email. When you opt out of instant notifications, you’ll no longer receive these messages in the Notification Center . Title: How to Apply a Status to an Application
Text: How to Apply a Status to an Application | Apply Help Log in Apply In this article How to Apply a Status through the Stage Settings How to Manually Apply a Status How to Automatically Apply a Status How it Appears in the Site Help Monitor How to Apply a Status to an Application Apply How to Apply a Status to an Application How to Apply a Status through the Stage Settings How to Manually Apply a Status How to Automatically Apply a Status How it Appears in the Site Application Statuses allow you to add a custom status to your applications based on the round the application is in. This article will walk through how to apply a status to an application that is visible to the applicant. How to Apply a Status through the Stage Settings Once you have created a status within your stage you can choose to automatically apply one status to all applications that enter that stage. This will not only apply the status to the application but it will also enable the status to be visible to the applicant on their application. To apply a status automatically to applications that enter the stage: Go to the Stage Configurations of the stage the status should be applied in. Go to the Settings Tab. Under the Application Status section, select the status that has been created. This will not apply retroactively to applications that are already in the stage, only incoming applications. If necessary, you will need to apply the status manually to applications currently in the stage. How to Manually Apply a Status There are 3 ways to apply a status manually: By moving the Application to a new stage Within the Admin Application Preview Within Manage Applications By moving the Application to a new stage Go to the Manage Applications page within a program. Select the checkbox to the left of the application's title. Select Move Stage . Select the stage to move the application to from the drop-down menu. Click the Status you wish to Set. Select Move . TIP! Use these steps to apply a status to multiple applications at once. If you do not wish to move the applications to a different stage you can simply select the stage they are currently in. This will also fire any automations that have been setup to fire based on the application moving to this stage. Within the Admin Application Preview Go to the Manage Applications page within a program. Select the application ID to enter the Admin Application Preview. Click Status . Select the status you wish to apply. Within Manage Applications Go to the Manage Applications page within a program Select the application(s) you wish to add or change the status for. Click Workflow . Click Change Status . Select the status you wish to give the application based on the stage they are in. Click Change Status . How to Automatically Apply a Status In some cases, you may have multiple statuses within a single stage that you wish to apply. If this is the case you can use Automations to apply different statuses to different applications within a single stage. For example, in some cases, after an applicant has moved through the review stage, they may need to be sent back to the application stage to make updates or corrections to their application. This action is based on a reviewer response in the reviewer form to move the application back to the application stage. The reason we use an automation is that we do not want to apply a status to all applications in the stage, only ones that have been in the Reviewer stage and been moved back. WHEN TO APPLY Source Event Target Review Reviewer has completed a Review Reviewer Stage CONDITIONS Reviewer Form: Would you like to request more information from the Applicant? is exactly Yes DO Action Source Action Application Assign a Status to the Application Status: Additional Information Required TIP! Add an action to send an automated email to the applicant to inform them of what information may be required based on a comment field in the reviewer form. To automatically Remove a Status , select the Status in the automation Action to be "None." How it Appears in the Site Once you have applied a status to an application it will be visible to your applicants on their application tile. Therefore, when the applicant logs into their account they will be able to quickly identify where their application is in the process. Using the above example we can also notify the applicants that additional information is required in their application and they will need to enter their application to complete it. Title: Survey Tooltips
Text: Survey Tooltips | SurveyMonkey Help Log in SurveyMonkey Help Creating Surveys Question Settings Survey Tooltips SurveyMonkey Survey Tooltips Tooltips give survey takers more information about a specific word or phrase in your survey. For example, you can use a tooltip to define a word in your survey people may not be familiar with or give extra context about how to answer a survey question. Adding a Tooltip You can add one tooltip per survey question or additional survey text block. It’s not possible to add a tooltip to answer text, the survey title, or intro paragraphs. To add a tooltip: Go to the Design Survey section of your survey. Click a question or additional text field. Highlight the text you want to add a tooltip to. Click the Tooltip icon in the formatting toolbar. Enter your tooltip text. Click OK . Deleting a Tooltip To delete a tooltip: Go to the Design Survey section of your survey. Click the question or additional text. Highlight the text with the tooltip. Click the Tooltip icon in the formatting toolbar. Click the Delete icon. What Survey Takers See Words with tooltips added are underlined. Survey takers can hover over the word to read the tooltip. Title: Using a Custom Domain to Send Emails
Text: Using a Custom Domain to Send Emails | GetFeedback Help Log in GetFeedback Help Survey channels Email Using a Custom Domain to Send Emails GetFeedback Using a Custom Domain to Send Emails You can use your custom email domain to send emails with our Send to a List feature, Salesforce Automation , or Zendesk Automation . For example, you might want to send emails from help@[companyname].com. Our Support team can help you set up your custom domain. We can only use a custom domain your company already owns. To set up your custom email domain: Contact GetFeedback Support with the custom domain you want to use. Our Support team will reply with a TXT record to add to your domain’s DNS settings. Have your IT team add the TXT record to your domain’s DNS settings. Let our support team know that you’ve updated your domain settings. We’ll verify your domain and let you know when it’s ready to use. Once your custom domain is ready, you can select it as the sender email address when creating your survey email. Some domains are authenticated with a DMARC record to prevent third-party services (such as GetFeedback) from sending as that domain on your behalf. If you domain has this type of record attached to it, you won't be able to use your domain name. DMARC policies are set up by your own IT team and we can't override them.
